loans.name: Shakeela Nasir Javed Group

texts.en:
Shakeela baji is married to N. J., and they have resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband earns a living by selling clothing in the community. Shakeela baji helps him by selling clothes to their relatives. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to increase her husband’s  business. 

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. Safeera baji and Abida baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling businesses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
L. Lê Thị (175060101) is a 47-year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has four school-aged children.

L. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month.

In 2006, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to build a shelter for her pigs.

L. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 4th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna M., 38, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in her pool table business. She sells to the village community and general public six days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD). She has two previous loans with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Anna’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a new pool table and a new sheet

loans.name: Dos

texts.en:
Mr. Dos S. is a married man and the father of six children: five are of school age and the other one is married and works driving a truck for a company.

Dos S. and his wife currently earn a living by cultivating crops. Besides his farming job, Dos S. akso uses his location on the river to fish for a profit. He has been fishing for years but he still needs more equipment to support his business. Therefore, he would like a loan from Kiva to be used as capital to buy a fishing boat for fishing activities.

Dos S. was not available for the photo so his wife is shown instead.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for fishing activities

loans.name: Lilian Elizabeth

texts.es: Lilian Elizabeth A. V. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en la zona occidental del país. Hace ya 11 años, Lilian y su esposo manejan una panadería propia, con la cual distribuyen y surten de pan a distintas zonas de su pueblo. Sus tres hijos ayudan y colaboran en la panadería, que tras una década de existencia se ha vuelto el pilar de ingresos de la familia. Lilian solicita un préstamo para comprar materia prima para su mercadería y ampliar su producción y su distribución en el pueblo, que a la vez, aumente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Lilian Elizabeth A. V. lives in the Department of Ahuachapán in the western part of the country. For eleven years now, Lilian and her husband have been running their own bakery which distributes and supplies bread to various areas of their town. Their three children work and help them with the bakery, which for more than a decade has been primary source of income for the family. Lilian is seeking a loan to buy the raw materials for products and to increase their production and distribution in the town, while at the same time increasing their income.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
M. Farhod is married and has a young son. With the faith that his son could go to school, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots to be able to make enough money to pay for his schooling. This is why he started this business five years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now Farhod needs a loan of 3000 Somoni. He is going to spend the loan to purchase more dried apricots, which he will process further and sell. With your help, Farhod will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his son went to school and is an honorable person.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy dried apricots for expanding his business

loans.name: Fonjong

texts.en:
E. was married and has five children. He was very supportive of his wife, but she abandoned him due to poverty. As a very hard working man, he has faced many challenges in life, such as poverty and sickness. These problems made life very difficult for him. It was a great hardship for him to sponsor his five children in school until the year 2000 when he saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.

He is convinced that his business will succeed because of his business experience. He is well known in the community. He is going to provide the community with palm oil and pork.	

He plans to use the profit from this loan and previous loans to pay for his children's school fees, and to feed and clothe his family. With these benefits, he will enjoy a better and more comfortable life. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it includes training before the loan is disbursed and proper follow-up to ensure proper use of the loan. Also, the method of repayment is convenient and comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, sticks, feed and medicines, and to repair his pig sty

loans.name: Emerson Esael

texts.es:
el sr. EMERSON ESAEL S. R. tiene 13 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo; su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el Boulevard la Democracia frente al super mercado ALRACHID de esta ciudad.
Don Emerson, se dedico desde la edad de 12 años al comercio ya que sus padres de igual manera son comerciantes, a él le gusto mas el comercio que los estudios, y solo curso hasta el 2º de secundaría y dejo los estudios.
don emerson cuenta con muy buena experiencia en el comercio ya que la mitad de su vida se ha dedicado al mismo,. Esta casado y nos comento que dentro de un par de meses espara ser padre de su 1º hijo(a)
Ahora el piensa en hacer crecer mas su negocio y tener muchas ganancias ya que se le viene la responsabilidad de mantener a su primer hijo.

loans.use: compra de camisetas deportivas, camisas de vestir, blusas, zandalias, tenis, gorras, trajes, camisas de la seccion de futbol de Honduras y ropa para niños.

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal is a single man living with his parents and 4 brothers. He has owned an auto cleaning shop and car oil changing since 2007. He works hard to support his family in collaboration with his brother. Today, Jamal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to perform maintenance for the cleaning machine and buy additional oil changing bottles to develop his work.

loans.use: perform maintenance for the cleaning machine and buy additional oil changing bottles

loans.name: Jose Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel es una persona joven, soltero, que aun vive con sus padres, el tiene muchos deseos de superación.

Actualmente está cursando el 4 año de la carrera de contabilidad en una universidad privada a la cual asiste en horario nocturno.

El tiene una bodega donde vende todo tipo de bebidas.

Se inicio en el ramo con un capital que consiguió con la liquidación de  un trabajo que realizaba como vendedor en un negocio.

También su padre le ayudo con un poco de efectivo para aumentar su capital.
El es muy trabajador con buenas referencias en el mercado y merece una oportunidad para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ariel is a single young man who still lives with his parents. He is eager to succeed.

At the moment, Ariel is completing a 4 year degree in accounting at a private university. He attends classes at night.

He manages a warehouse where he sells all types of beverages. Ariel started this business with the severance pay he received when his previous employer went out of business. He had previously worked as a sales representative. His father also provided some additional cash to help increase his capital.

Ariel is a hard worker with good references in the marketplace. He deserves the opportunity to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages (beer, sodas, mineral water, wine, etc.)

loans.name: Janete Miriam

texts.es: La señora Janete T. de 40 años de edad, es maestra de un centro privado desde hace dieciocho años, procreo cuatro hijos los cuales estudian para tener una educación, su esposo es pastor por gracias esta la familia junta. Gracias a Dios mi vida tuvo sentido ya que por circunstancia de la vida mi mama murió, y nos crió mi abuelito pero mas tarde el también murió y por ayuda de una tía salimos adelante ya que nuestro padre nos había abandonado. Vive en un barrio Pablo Úbeda, sus planes es poder terminar de asegurar su casa por eso con este prestamos comprara  piedra, cemento, arena y hierro para hacer un muro en la parte de atrás de la casa y poder estar en mejores condiciones de seguridad ya que en el barrio hay mucha delincuencia por falta del desempleo en nuestro país. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder hacer las mejoras a nuestras viviendas, ya que solo a través del crédito se lograr construir por la facilidad de pago.
texts.en:
Sra. Janete T. is 40 years old and has been teaching for 18 years at a private school. Her four children are students while her husband is a pastor. She is thankful that her family is together. Janete thanks God that her life has meaning after the circumstances that she had to endure. After her mother died, she was raised by her grandfather but he also passed away much later. An aunt helped to support her since her father had abandoned the family.

Janete lives in the neighborhood of Pablo Úbeda. Her plans include being able to finish securing her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase stone, cement, sand, and iron to build a security wall behind her house. This will provide safer conditions since there is frequent crime in her neighborhood due to high unemployment throughout the country. She thanks the Institution for the opportunity to make these improvements to her home and providing an easy way for her to make her loan payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials for a security wall

loans.name: Olexander

texts.en:
Olexander is married with a grown daughter. He lives in Kardashinka, in the Kherson region, which is a farming area of Ukraine. Olexander is a farmer. He owns nice, equipped greenhouses and grows agricultural produce for further retail sale. Olexander has been in this business for seven years. Presently, he has 20,000 UAH invested in his venture. His gross income amounts to $2187. 

Olexander is a former military officer. His military experience has helped him stay determined and disciplined which has benefited his business in many ways. Olexander is seeking an 8,000 UAH loan to purchase additional seeds and clear plastic film for his greenhouses. He knows a great deal about farming and greenhouse building which ensures the success of his business and the consistent growth of his profit.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and clear plastic film for covering his greenhouses

loans.name: Jerusalin

texts.en:
Jerusalin A., from the village of Canaway, Tibanga, is 23 years old and has an infant. To make a living, Jerusalin sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jerusalin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, she is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Canaway, Tibanga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry A., a 48-year-old resident of Royak village in Takeo Province, owns a 1.8-hectare field upon which she cultivates rice to eA. for living. She is also a chicken breeder who is seeking a loan to expand her breeding business by purchasing more chickens, with the rest of money going toward the purchase of fertilizers to support her rice farming. Mrs. Ry A. is a widow with a married child who helps her with her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and fertilizers

loans.name: Mazahir

texts.en:
Mazahir D. is a market vendor. He is 42 years old, married and has one son. He has been selling fruits and vegetables for 10 years. With all these years of experience, Mazahir has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits and vegetables so that they keep in marketable condition and do not lose taste and useful properties. 

Mazahir buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers. He rents a place in the central bazaar of Imishli city. In the market, he is known among the people for his attractive prices and friendliness. Mazahir’s business generates stable and considerable income for his family. This season, Mazahir wants to purchase more products to sell. Mazahir thanks everyone for supporting him.

loans.use: To restock and diversify products

loans.name: Consolidad

texts.en:
60-year-old Consolidad is married and has five children. She’s managing a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) corn field in Banga, South Cotabato and also has a half-hectare (1.25-acre) guava field on which she makes a weekly harvest.

Consolidad needs additional capital to purchase farm supplies so she’s requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. CEVI offers the lowest interest rate and the loan would be of great help in financing Consolidad’s business.

loans.use: To buy seed and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pagne cloth for sewing

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Pictured here is Marie K., a small-scale businesswoman in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This woman is seeking a loan of SLL 2,500,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time in order to expand her business, make more sales, and consequently improve her standard of living. 

Marie K. is 42 years old, a widow with 4 children all of whom are now grown-ups and on their own. Marie was born in Makeni and has been a businesswoman for 6 years now. She sells "gara lappers" (locally dyed cloth) and rice. With the help of this loan, she will buy gara-lapper-making materials – white cotton, ink, caustic soda, etc., and pay experts to make designs on the white cotton. She will also use some of the loan to buy bags of rice.

loans.use: Buy "gara lapper" making materials – white cotton, ink, caustic soda, etc., and bags of rice

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
La Sra. Melania nacio el 11 de Noviembre de 1954, en Atilleros Vallegrande casada con don plasido, tiene 4 hijos y hace 35 años que compro una parsela en la foresta a 10 km de El Torno, dos de sus hijos trabajan con ella y los otros dos se encuentran en edad escolar, son una familia muy unida y cariñosa y la Sra. Melania siempre esta pensando en el bienestar de sus familia. 

La Sra. Melania trabaja en la agricultura, siembra papa, maiz, mani, cebolla, y tambien tienen 2 hectareas de citrico como: naranja, mandarina, saca ella su producto al mercado de el torno, ella atrabaja con su esposo y 2 de sus hijos  quienes le ayudan en la siembra y posterior cosecha de sus productos y despues lo comercializan en el mercado de la zona.

Uno de los deseos de la Sra. Melania es ver a sus hijos profesionales y a la larga hecer construir su casita en mejores condiciones para la comodidad de su familia.

El dinero del credito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de Papa, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Melania was born on November 11, 1954, in Atilleros Vallegrande. She is married; her husband's name is Plasido, and she has 4 children. Thirty-five years ago, she bought a parcel of land in the forest, 10 km from El Torno. Two of her children are school-age and work with her. They are a very united, loving family, and she is always thinking about their wellbeing. Melania works in agriculture, growing potatoes, corn, peanuts and onions, and she also has 2 hectares of citrus trees, including oranges and tangerines. She sells her products at the market in El Torno. She works with her husband and two of her children, who help her plant and later harvest her crops, then sell them in the local market. One of Melania's dreams is to see her children become professionals and, in the long term, build a stronger house for the comfort of her family. She will use the funds from the loan to buy seeds to plant potatoes. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence placed in her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds to plant potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Seydina Issa

texts.fr: -Monsieur Seydina Issa S. habite dans la communauté  de Camberene. Il est âgé  de 28 ans et est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis décembre  2006. Il est maçon, carreleur et en même  temps gère  un poulailler  chez lui. Mais son activité principale c’est le carrelage. Monsieur S. sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs destine a l’achat de poussins et d’aliment pour renforcer son activité d’aviculture. Ce crédit lui permettra d’être  a l’abri des ruptures  pour mieux répondre  a la satisfaction de la clientèle et de mieux gérer  ses besoins sociaux.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydina Issa S. lives in the Cambarene community. He is 28 years old and is a member of the local branch of UIMCEC since December 2006. He is a mason, a tiler, and also raises chickens at home. His main activity remains floor tiling. Mr. S. is requesting a loan for 200,000 francs to buy chicks and chick feed to reinforce his chicken-raising activity. This loan will prevent any shortages so that he can improve customer satisfaction and better manage his social needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: investment

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Mirtha es una mujer trabajadora de 48 años de edad, con una familia de cinco hijos, tres de ellos trabajan, su negocio es la venta de ropa y cosmético que vende por catálogos los productos Avon desde hace dos años, pues anteriormente trabajaba en una casa particular cuidando a una anciana, también trabajo como conserje para poder ganar el alimento cada día para alimentar a sus hijos ya que no tuvo la ayuda de su compañero.
Su objetivo es comprar ropa, cosmético en cantidad, para aumentar las ventas, y salir a vender en mayor cantidad de productos para lograr mejores ganancias, ya que tiene poco inventario,  para en el futuro hacer las mejoras a su casa ya que quiere mejorar la infraestructura de los cuartos que aun no ha logrado hacer,  por falta de dinero.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a 48 year old hard-working woman. She has five children; three of them work. She sells clothes and Avon cosmetic products by catalog. She has been doing this for two years. She previously worked in a private home taking care of an elderly woman. She also works as a custodian to be able to earn her daily bread and feed her children. She has not had help from her companion. Her objective is to buy clothes and cosmetics in quantities in order to increase sales. Then she will go sell her products in greater quantity in order to get improved earnings. She now has a small inventory. In the future she wants to make improvements to her house. She wants to improve the infrastructure of the rooms that she has not yet been able to make due to lack of money.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more clothes and cosmetics to increase sales

loans.name: Evelin Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Evelyn forma parte del banco comunal Alfa en la ciudad de Portoviejo, la actividad que realiza nuestra socia es el comercio de productos de belleza en diferentes marcas como Yanbal, Esika entre otras, además vende bisutería y ropa, está casada tiene 3 hijos, es de Portoviejo,  vive en la ciudadela San Francisco, tiene su casa propia; en el mundo de las ventas nuestra socia lleva 2 años, el crédito que recibirá en este nuevo ciclo en la Fundación lo invertirá completamente en su mercadería,  una parte en ropa,  por eso viaja hasta Guayaquil ya tiene un local que es donde compra al por mayor su mercadería y a precios con los cuales ella pueda obtener ganancias;  los productos de belleza que se vende por medio de pedidos en las revistas los tiene que comprar a contado para poder darle más tiempo a sus clientas con los pagos, esa es la manera en la cual ella vende dejando a crédito a sus clientas.

El sueño de nuestra socia es superarse como madre para ver realizados a sus hijos, por eso todos los días en la tarde se dedica a visitar a sus clientes;  es una manera de aportar con los gastos en el hogar, hay momentos que el sueldo del esposo no les alcanza y es una gran ayuda lo que ella puede hacer por su familia.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a member of the Alfa communal bank in the ity of Portoviejo. Her commercial activity consists in selling beauty products of various brands, like Yanbal and Esika, among others; she also sells costume jewelry and clothing. She is married and has three children, is from Portoviejo and lives in the San Francisco housing project; she owns her own house. She has been in sales for two years. She will use the funds she gets from the Fundación this cycle to buy merchandise, part of it in clothing that she goes all the way to Guayaquil to get from a wholesaler she knows there at prices that allow for higher profits for her. The beauty products she sells from catalogues; however, she has to pay cash for them and then extend credit to her customers. This is how she sells: leaving the items with her customers on credit Her dream is to be an outstanding mother in order to see her children develop to the fullest; this is why she spends every afteroon visiting customers. This is a way to contribute to household expenses because sometimes her husband’s salary isn’t sufficient and what she’s able to contribute is of great help to the family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For blouses, shirts, pants, earrings, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has one son. She owns a small business that sells clothing at the central market in Novomoskovsk and has been in this business for fifteen years. She has always offered high quality products and excellent client service. She has many repeat clients that make her business a success. Irina has an active life that encourages her business neighbors and friends. 

Irina has used micro-loans before and found them very helpful. This time, she would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and receive additional income to help her son pay for college.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Lolango Plus Group

texts.en:
Lolango Plus is a group of 19 owners of small businesses chaired by Lina. Its members are collectively responsible for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Lina is determined to be a successful businesswoman as she operates her own restaurant in her area southwest of Kinshasa. Since 2006 she has acquired solid experience, working hard and developing good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a big restaurant. She would also like to achieve financial independence through her business, which currently earns her $280 per month. Lina works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals. A trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and repaid loans, she will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying fish with the aim of making additional profit.

Thirty-eight years old, Lina is married and the mother of four children ranging in age between 9 and 20 years old.

loans.use: To increase her restaurant inventory with the aim of making additional profit

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate Y. prepares kenkey for sale in Abura (kenkey is fermented corn and cassava dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves and often accompanied by fried fish). Kate has received junior high education. She is married and lives together with her seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer.

Kate has been preparing kenkey for sale for thirty-eight years. The loan she hopes to receive will be used to buy extra maize to cook the kenkey she sells. She hopes to use the new revenues from her business to save to build a place where she can store bags of maize to keep to sell in smaller quantities.

loans.use: To buy extra maize to cook more kenkey to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
La señora Victoria Dionicia tiene 51 años de edad, conviviente, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 17 años, su domicilio está ubicado en Cajamarquilla, distrito de  Lurigancho - Chosica,  departamento de  Lima, se dedica al negocio de corte de cabello, desde hace 25 años, su estética lleva el nombre de “ESTETICA VICKY”, se inicio en este negocio ya que tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar cosmetología, logrando así la apertura de su estética, además también vende perfumes, dulces y bisutería.
Trabaja con EDAPROSPO – Prosperidad  desde hace 2 años y 6 meses, actualmente asume el cargo de tesorera de la  alcancía comunal “SARITA COLONIA” la cual está integrada por 7 socios quienes realizan diversas actividades como: comercio y servicios.
Su reciente préstamo será utilizado en la compra de mercadería como: líquidos, tintes, gaseosas y golosinas, para  seguir fidelizando y abasteciendo a sus clientes.
En el futuro anhela poder hacer  crecer su negocio y comprarse una casa. (Niños en la foto hijos de los socios).
texts.en:
Victoria Dionicia is 51 years old and lives with her two children who are 12 and 17 years old. She resides in Cajamarquilla, a district of Lurigancho-Chosica, which is a suburb of Lima. She has been cutting hair for 25 years and her beauty salon is named " Vicky's Beauty Salon". She got into the business after having the opportunity to study cosmetology which allowed her to achieve the opening of her beauty salon. She also sells perfumes, candy, and jewelry. She has been working with EDAPROSPO - for 2 1/2 years. She is currently the treasurer of the communal funds for SARITA COLONIA, which is made up of 7 associates who perform diverse activities in the commerce and service sector. The loan would be used to purchase merchandise like: liquids, dyes, soft drinks, and snacks in order to continue supplying their loyal customers. In the future she longs to grow her business and purchase a house. ( Kids pictured are children of the associates)

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise like: liquids, dyes, soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Carmen Isolda

texts.es: La Señora Carmen Isolda se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y cosa de horno en sus 24 años, siempre ha sabido trabajar y mantenerse muy independiente, el negocio fue heredado por su Mama desde hace 13 años, ella con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, pues su Madre le ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes faldas y otro tipo de vestimenta. Sueña con tener su propio establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
In her 24 years, Carmen Isolda has sold used clothing and pastries. She has always known how to work and support herself independently. She inherited the business from her Mother 13 years ago. With a lot of care and sacrifice she has managed to get ahead, because her mother had taught her to support herself in a humble manner. She will invest the proceeds of this loan in the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, women's suits, and other types of garments. She dreams of having her own establishment in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy clothing

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián vive en casa de sus parientes en la zona de Tacagua, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, actualmente se encuentra soltero. Fabián comercializa celulares al por menor, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. El crédito será destinado para incrementar su capital de trabajo y por ende aumentar sus ventas. Está es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Por su evaluación socioeconómica califica para obtener un crédito.
texts.en:
Fabián lives with his parents in Tacagua on the west side of La Paz; he is single. He is a cell phone retailer. He supports himself with the income he earns. The loan will be used to increase working capital thus increasing his sales. This is the first time he’s asked for an Impro loan. The socio-economic evaluation done on him indicated that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Lysel's Group

texts.en:
Lysel E. is from the village of Mangandingay Cabarroguis Quirino. She is 36 years old. Lysel is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lysel E..

Lysel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lysel owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice. Lysel has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lysel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lysel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lysel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Roland

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 34 ans, celibataire et pere d'un enfant dont l'âge est ans,il commence ce commerce en 2008.En moyenne il vend environ 20000 à 85000frs par jours

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.

Avec le prêt qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer son activité en achetant des mecanisme wc, des sanitaires,des meetiger, des coudes wc,des ventous.

A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
This 34-year old man is single and a father of a child who is …years old. HE launched his business in 2008. His sales average between 20,000 and 85,000 West African Francs per day.

In order to overcome [financial hardship] and to support his family he started his hardware business. He has a number of selling strategies. His clients are entrepreneurs and governmental employees who are in the process of building houses. With this loan he plans to bolster his business in purchasing WC mechanisms, toilet bowls, mixer faucets, elbow pipes, valves etc.

In the future he plans to become a wholesaler, and  save enough in order to open a large store and be able to travel to stock up in Cameroon, Nigeria and Dubai. He is very serious about his work and also hopes to be able to offer college education to his children.

loans.use: Purchasing faucets, toilet bowls,  lightbulbs etc

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: La señora Olivia ingresó a la institución en el año 2004 con el grupo solidario ABEJITAS trabajando como nueve secuencias posteriormente ingresa al crédito individual con la garantía de su hijo siendo la cliente la única rescatable del grupo antes mencionado. Doña Olivia vive en anticrético con sus tres hijos dos de ellos universitarios y una que esta en colegio. La señora es la única que solventa con la manutención de su hogar sin apoyo del esposo. Su negocio esta ubicado en una Plaza muy conocida de la ciudad de la Paz en el sector de los helados de canela, la elaboración de estos helados es artesanal, helados muy tradicionales de la ciudad, mucha gente va a esta plaza a servirse los riquísimos helados de canela. el dinero del credito lo utilizara en una maquina para la elaboracion de los helados. En un futuro la señora desea tener su propia vivienda para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Olivia joined Emprender in 2004 as part of the Solidarity Group “Abejitas” (Bees). She then participated in nine individual loans since she was the only member remaining from that group. Doña Olivia lives in a rental property with her three children, of whom two are attending university while the other is in high school. She is the only one supporting her household since she does not receive assistance from her husband. Her business is located in a plaza market situated in a well-known area of the city of La Paz. There she makes ice cream by hand, a traditional treat found in the city. Many people visit the plaza in order to enjoy her delicious cinnamon ice cream.

The money from this loan will be used to purchase an ice cream machine. In the future, Sra. Olivia wants to have her own home for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: Purchase an ice cream machine

loans.name: Roann Guia

texts.en: Roann Guia D. is from the village of Barangay San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 20 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Roann Guia owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Roann Guia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2010, Roann Guia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roann Guia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Roann Guia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cirila; ella tiene 41 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant donde prepara diferentes platos tradicionales de la ciudad del Cusco como lomo saltado, caldo de gallina, chicharrones y otra variedad de platos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank called “LAS LEONAS DE SAN JERONIMO”. This group is located in the Cusco district, near the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Cirila is 41 years old and married with 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with the restaurant business where she prepares different traditional dishes from the city of Cuzco, such as salted pork loin, chicken soup, pork rinds and a variety of other dishes. She works from 6:00 a.m until 6:00 p.m. She wants to improve and expand her restaurant business. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cooking products. She thanks those who are making this dream possible and promises to pay her dues on time.

loans.use: To purchase cooking products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth A. is from the village of Unidos. She is 47 years old, married and has 7 adult-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a business providing general equipment rental to local community members. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Myangantsetseg

texts.en:
Myangantsetseg B. is a 26 years old young lady who lives with her mother and sister in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her sister is a university student. 

Myangantsetseg manages a clothing trade business out of a rented stall at the local trade center in her town. She sells a variety of jeans. She started her clothing business in 2007 and has built a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 2,500,000 MNT. For the future, she hopes to continue to grow her business and have her own shop. Myangantsetseg is a hardworking and open minded person and says, "I want to sell latest design clothes for my customers." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase evening dresses in to sell during the upcoming holiday.

loans.use: To purchase evening dresses

loans.name: Djekafo (Ayons Le Même Langage) Group

texts.fr:
Djekafo est un regroupement de femmes du premier quartier de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et co-épouses. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Les membres du groupe Djekafo font l’achat et la vente de produits alimentaires et la vente des  condiments de toutes sortes. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, elles ont leur premier prêt de groupe.
 Chata Koné  qui est un des membres  de ce groupe fait la restauration  dans une gargote aménagée devant sa concession qui fait face au grand marché de Koutiala. Elle vend du riz sous toutes ses formes : gras ou avec sauces du poulet rôti, de la soupe de poissons etc. Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de condiments et  d’ingrédients pour la restauration, au fur et à mesure. Elle ses mets  dans sa gargote au  grand marché de Koutiala, au comptant à une clientèle diverse et variée.
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Djekafo comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 65 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Chata Koné,  compte réaliser 70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’agrandir d’avantages  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Djekafo Group ("let's speak with the same voice") is a group of women living all in the first neighborhood of Koutiala in traditional extended families with their husbands, children and cowives. On average they are 40 years old, they are married and have each at least three children.

The members of Djekafo Group trade with grocery products and all kinds of food condiments. To expand their businesses the group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first group loan.

Chata Koné, one of the members, works in catering. Her business is located in a refurbished food stall facing the great market of Koutiala. She sells of kinds of rice (with fat or sauce), roast chicken, fish soup, etc. Her products are in high demand due to the excellent location of her stall. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of condiments and ingredients for her dishes as soon as she needs them. She sells her dishes in her food stall at the great market of Koutiala for cash to a diversified clientele.

While the other members of Djekafo Group each expect to make an average profit of 65,000 CFA francs throughout the loan cycle, Chata Koné expects to earn 70,000 CFA francs. They will use their income to pay the installments of the loan and for the daily household expenses.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to further expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch S., 46, is married and lives with four of her children in the Battambang province. She is a farmer, growing rice and vegetables. On average, she is able to make about 1.60 USD of profit each day. Her husband earns 3 USD per day selling vegetables at the local market. Three of the children are in school, while the other one is employed at a local casino. Ouch S. is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a trailer and a water pump.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer and water pump

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more hair products

loans.name: Mark Odhiambo

texts.en:
Mark Odhiambo O. runs a bookshop in Umoja estate which is well populated and has many customers who comes to his shop. Mark is married and a father of two school going children.

He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to KADET by a friend who is already a registered client. He intends to use the entire loan amount to buy more stock of text books, exercise books, and envelopes for sale.

With the additional income he will plow it back into the business by adding more stock. He hopes to grow his business and open another branch and give his children a good education. He is a humble and hardworking man

loans.use: To add more stock of text books, exercise books, and envelopes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives on his own. He has been working as a farmer for 15 years. In 2000, he bought his own land and started cultivating all types of vegetables and fruits, according to the season. He sells his products to people from his town and neighboring villages. He works hard to be able to satisfy his own needs. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. In the future, he plans to further expand his business and cultivate exotic fruits.

loans.use: to purchase needed supplies for his farm

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem is 42 years old and married to S. A., who operates a cosmetics shop in a nearby market. Through his shop, he offers cosmetics to his customers at cheap rates. 

Tasleem is a very supportive woman who assists her husband financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. She receives regular orders from her community ladies and fulfills them on time to earn an income. 

She belongs to a small city of Punjab, Pakistan called Khanewal. She has been living there in a 2 room brick house with her family for the past 15 years. 
She is the mother of a daughter and 4 sons. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver while others are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her sewing business. Through the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her finishing the orders on time and produce quality work. 

She started this business 3 years ago and hopes that an investment will help her by making her business even better. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In every loan year, she has maintained a good credit record and attended every meeting.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 52 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  With 3 children in school, Ma. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Victoria runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.   Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, oil, etc.

In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store

loans.name: Diamaguene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Diamaguéne fait partie du Banc Villageois Mamadou Lamine Guéye. Il est créé le 27 août 2009 et est composé de 11 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Aïssatou Bâ est la responsable du groupe, elle est à droite sur la photo et à croisé ses mains.         Elle est mariée avec un enfant en charge.

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de tissus thioub, wax, khartoum et parallèlement des poissons fumés.

Elle souhaite avec son nouveau prêt agrandir son activité afin d'avoir beaucoup de revenus.

Les bénéfices obtenus lui ont permis de rénover sa maison.
texts.en:
Solidarity group Diamaguéne is part of the Banc Villageois Mamadou Lamine Guéye. It was established on August 27, 2009, and is composed of 11 women who come from the same neighborhood. Their main business is retail.

Madame Aïssatou Bâ is the group leaD.. She's on the right in the picture, with her hands crossed. She's married and has one child to support. She retails various kind of fabric : thioub, wax, and khartoum. In parallel, she also sells smoked fish.

She wishes to use her new loan to bolster her business and increase her income. Her profits enable her to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and smoked fish

loans.name: Norma Gladis

texts.es:
Norma Gladis, de 35 años de edad, habita en su propia casa con sus 5 hijos por los cuales se esfuerza día con día para sacar adelante. Norma es una mujer emprendedora que ha hecho de su hogar un negocio el cual consiste en la venta de cosméticos y perfumería, a la vez también vende productos por catalogo, reside en un lugar muy transitado por el èxito en las ventas de Norma. Ella se esfuerza por mantener surtido su negocio ya que de esta manera los clientes la prefieren y cada día la buscan mas porque saben que siempre encuentra lo que buscan. Para norma es muy importante mantener activo su negocio ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta y por ello ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a integral con la fe puesta en Dios que de esta manera lograra mejorar su calidad de vida. 

El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de diferentes tipos perfumes tanto para hombre como para mujer, cremas (para el cuerpo, cara, manos y cabello), desodorantes, y variedad de  cosméticos que  sean atractivos para los clientes, entre otros productos que permitan a traer a mas clientela. Con esto ella espera obtener mayores ganancias y de esta forma poder ayudar a su amada familia que únicamente depende de ella.
texts.en:
Norma Gladis is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her five children for whom she strives every day to move forward.  She is an enterprising woman who has established a home-based business selling cosmetics and perfumes.  In addition, Norma sells products through catalogs. Since she lives in a place with a lot of transportation and visitors passing through, she has had a lot of success. She tries to maintain the inventory of her business.  As a result, her customers prefer to do business with her because she always has what they need.  It is very important for Norma to maintain an active business because it is the only source of income that she has.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral.  With her faith in God, she hopes to improve her quality of life.  

This loan will be invested in her business by purchasing different types of colognes for men and women, crèmes (for body, face, hands, and hair), deodorants, a variety of cosmetics that are popular with her customers, as well as other products that will help increase her clientele.  She hopes to generate more income so that she can support her beloved family since she is the sole breadwinner.

loans.use: to purchase colognes, crèmes, deodorants, cosmetics, and other popular products.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is already 57 years old, married and living together with her family in the village of Villa Magat somewhere in San Mateo, Isabela. She has three children who are adults. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Editha has been in her tailoring/dressmaking business for 15 years and she earns approximately PHP 7,000 monthly. She is planning to borrow PHP 20,000 to buy sewing materials like needles, chalk, and fabrics. 

Editha has been a client of ASKI for more than two years. In the future, she would like to see her business more competitive to create a productive living for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like needles, chalk, and fabrics.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia se dedica a elaborar y vender comida en su domicilio desD. hace mas D. seis años, la actividad es familiar ya que para la elaboración y posterior venta le ayudan sus hijos quienes a pesar D. estar estudiando en la universidad se sacan tiempo para colaborar a su mama, la señora Julia vive en domicilio D. su propiedad con sus dos hijos, también cuenta con una tienda D. barrio donD. atienD. desD. las seis D. la mañana hasta las diez D. la noche, solicita el crédito para mejorar su puesto D. venta con la compra D. mas mesas y sillas para brindar una buena atención a sus clientes, el deseo D. la Sra. Julia es el D. ver a sus hijos profesionales y hombres D. bien, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Julia's business is making and selling food in her home.  She has been doing this for more than six years.  It is a family business since her children help her make and sell the food.  In spite of the fact that they are studying at university, they make time to help their mom.

Julia lives in her own home together with her two children.  She also has a neighborhood store where she works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  She is requesting this loan to improve her sales location by purchasing more table and chairs, so that she can proviD. her customers with a good service.  Julia's wish is to see her children become professionals and good, hard-working people.  She is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Los Angeless Group

texts.es: El nombre de este grupo es "LOS ANGELESS", debido al nombre de la comunidad donde se localizan. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes y se ubican en el estado de Puebla en México. La señora, ARIANA es la Tesorera del grupo, ella tiene 25 años, estudio unicamente la secundaria, es casada y tiene dos hijos (3 y un 1 año de edad). Se dedica a la venta de comida; es conocida por sus compañeras por una persona responsable y que ha salido adelante ante la adversidad, siendo originaria de esta comunidad ha progresado constantemente, el prestamo lo requiere para comprar utencilios e insumos para su negocio y tiene pensado seguir invirtiendo para incrementar sus ingresos. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para la educación de sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los Angeles".  It is named after the community in which its members live.  The group has nine members who live in the State of Puebla, in Mexico.

Ariana is the group's treasurer.  She is 25 years old and studied at high school.  She is married and has two children aged 3 and 1.  Her business is selling meals.  She is known by her fellow group members as a responsible person who has managed to get ahead in life even though she has faced  difficulties.  She is originally from this community and has made constant progress.

Ariana needs this loan to buy utensils and supplies for her business.  She plans to continue investing in her business in order to increase her income.  She would like to use the profits that she makes to save up for her children's education and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy utensils and supplies for her business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 32 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and a mother of four school-aged dependents. Alma has a buy and sell business. She sells clothing. She sells ready to wear clothes, bedclothes, and curtains. Alma has had this business for two years with a monthly income of PHP 10,000. She has requested a loan of 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase clothes to sell. Alma has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Alma hopes to expand her clothing business and have a clothing shop in her town.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Vivogbe Group

texts.fr: VIVOGBE est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres sont issues de la même famille. La présidente du groupe, Afiavi Félicité (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Félicien. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés.  Afiavi Félicité et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs cinq enfants. Afiavi Félicité n'a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Il y a dix huit ans environs que Afiavi Félicité fait le commerce de produits vivriers à son domicile. Afiavi Félicité s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Afiavi Félicité sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit avec les membres du groupe VIVOGBE. Ce crédit lui servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The Vivogbe group comprises four people, all of whom come from the same family. The group president, Afiavi Félicité (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 40 years old and married to a carpenter named Félicien. The couple have five children, some of whom are in school. Afiavi Félicité and her husband live together with their five children. Afiavi Félicité only attended primary school. For about 18 years, she has sold food items at her home. She gets her supplies in Benin. This business allows her to provide for herself and her children. With the goal of satisfying her clientele, Afiavi Félicité is seeking a loan for the second time along with the other Vivogbe group members. This loan will serve to increase her stock of products and generate more profits.

loans.use: To buy various food items (beans, maize, manioc flour).

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La sociaAlejandrina;  tiene 36 años de edad  y es conviviente la socia tiene 2 hijos de  16, 10 años de edad, La socia se dedica a la administracion de su negocio, la socia tiene un restaurante;  la socia implemnto en su propia casa un restaurante de menus y bebidas, la socia tambien elabora extras y ella misma cocina y en cuanto puede esta en todo, la socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de vivieres para su negocio ella desea comprar la por mayor, papas, fideos, aceite entre otros, la socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de viveres para su restaurante y d eeste modo abastecerlo y ahorrar en la compra de viveres ya que seran al por mayor. La socia solicita el prestamo para comprar papa, arroz, aceite, entre otros.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Alejandrina is a member of the Communal Bank “Illary III” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 36 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children (ages 16 and 10). Alejandrina manages a restaurant business that is established in her home. She sells entrees and beverages, as well as side dishes. Alejandrina is in charge of the cooking and can do just about everything else. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her business. Alejandrina would like to buy potatoes, noodles, oil, and other supplies in bulk. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies for her restaurant. This will allow her to keep her business stocked and also save money on the purchase of supplies since she will buy in bulk. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy potatoes, rice, oil, and other supplies.

Alejandrina appreciates and values the loan that has been provided so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: buy potatoes, rice, oil, and other supplies.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling retail to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Stephen dreams of improving his living standards in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a single man and very hardworking. He was trained on how to grow rice by his cooperative. He has done farming for the past two years.
He will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, who is 27 years old and single, has been operating a motorbike transport business for four years to earn a living.  He also farms to earn extra income.  Through Faulu Kenya, Samuel has learnt how to save his money, and has been able to access loans easily.  Now requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike, he hopes to own a van in five years to use in the transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco tiene 40 años de edad, está casado desde hace tiempo, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad y vive en su propia casa situada en la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor es comerciante desde hace varios años, se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad que trae de la ciudad de Posadas, tiene mucha clientela a quienes les distribuye constantemente ya que también trae por pedidos. El cuenta con su propio vehículo el cual le facilita realizar sus repartos a los clientes. Además su esposa le envía mensualmente dinero desde España, con lo que cuenta con un ingreso más. Gracias a la actividad que el realiza puede mantener a sus hijos, educarlos, solventar los gastos del hogar y cubrir cualquier necesidad que en el mismo se presente.
El señor ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de harina, aceites, vinos, cigarrillos, y otros, ya que cuenta con muchos pedidos por parte de su clientela y desea satisfacer a todos.
texts.en:
Francisco is 40 years old. He has been married for some time, has four minor children, and lives in his own house located in the city of Encarnación.  

He has been a small-business owner for several years, and sells basic household necessities that he brings from the city of Posadas. He has a lot of customers to whom he is constantly distributing goods, since he also fills deliver orders.

He has his own vehicle, which makes it easy for him to make deliveries to customers. As well, his wife sends him money every month from Spain, providing him with another source of income.

Thanks to the work he does, he can support his children, educate them, pay for his family's expenses, and cover whatever household need should arise. He has applied for this loan in order to buy flour, cooking oils, wines, cigarettes and other things.  He has a lot of orders from his clientele, and he wants to satisfy everyone.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs, drinks, cigarettes, and other things to stock his store.

loans.name: Javier Otoniel

texts.es:
El joven Javier es,  mecánico de 22 años de edad, vive con su mamá y sus tres hermanos menores. Él se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la actividad de mecánica general, con dicha actividad el joven Javier ayuda a su familia a salir adelante con los gastos y así también tener una mejor calidad de vida.
 
Gracias a su excelente trabajo él tiene muchos clientes, quienes necesitan de sus servicios de forma constante; recientemente se le ha presentado la oportunidad de establecer su propio mini taller en la entrada de la ciudad y en vista que antes solo hacia trabajos a domicilio y no tenía donde recibir a sus clientes y tenia que trasladarse hasta lugares lejanos a reparar los vehículos y con ellos incurrir en grandes gastos de transporte; un amigo le ha propuesto  rentarle un local donde recibir a todos sus clientes, pero para esto el joven Javier necesita estar bien equipado con herramientas, para todo tipo de vehículo. Por tal motivo él esta solicitando un préstamo en Fundación Campo para aumentar su equipo de trabajo, a tener solo las herramientas principales o generales, pero tiene la idea de comprar también herramientas especiales para vehículos que no son tan comunes en cuanto a su reparación.

 Él trabaja todos los días menos el domingo ya que visita la iglesia al ser un joven con fuertes principios cristianos y en base a ello él tiene un alto espíritu de responsabilidad y honestidad. El préstamo en Fundación Campo le ayudara  a tener un mayor número de clientes y con ello tener mayores ingresos y de esta forma crecer en su taller y así sacar adelante a sus hermanos y a su mamá.
texts.en:
22-year old Javier is a mechanic. He lives with his mother and three younger siblings. For the last four years he has been working as a mechanic, and with his income he helps support the family and provide them with a decent standard of living.

Because of his excellent work, Javier has many customers who regularly need his services. Recently he was given the opportunity to start his own small business at the entrance to the city. Up till now he has worked out of his house and didn't have anywhere to meet his customers. He had to take the vehicles to other places to mend them, entailing extra expenses.

A friend has offered to rent him a place where he can do everything on site. That means that Javier now has to equip the workshop with tools for all kinds of vehicles, so he has approached Fundación Campo for a loan. He wants to buy the most widely used tools, but is also thinking of buying special tools for less common vehicles.

Javier works every day except Sundays when he goes to church as he is strong Christian. Because of his beliefs he is very responsible and honest. The loan from Fundación Campo will enable him to have a greater number of customers and thus increase his income. He will be able to expand his workshop and help his siblings and mother get ahead.

loans.use: to buy tools to repair vehicles

loans.name: Dolores Lorenza

texts.es:
Dolores de 29 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Orquídeas”.
El negocio de ella es la venta de perfumes, ropas, cremas.
Es comerciante, escogió esta actividad de compraventa porque su padre le heredo este negocio.
El horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, desde las 8:00am hasta 4:00pm.
Es casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de cosméticos.
Solo tiene un hijo, el cual tiene 4 años y estudia en una escuela particular.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y la compra de mercaderías como: perfumes, cremas, ropas de hombre y de mujer.
El sueño de ella es seguir creciendo en su negocio, para que su hijo tenga un buen vivir.
texts.en:
Dolores is 29 years old and lives in a suburban area called 'Orquídeas'.  Her business is selling perfumes, clothes and creams.  She is a saleswoman and chose this line of work because she inherited the business from her father.  She works from Monday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 4.00pm.  Dolores is married and her husband works for a cosmetics company.  She only has one child who is 4 years old and attends a private elementary school.

Dolores is requesting this loan to invest in her business and purchase merchandise such as perfumes, creams and men's and women's clothing.  Her dream is to continue growing in her business so that her son can live well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes, creams and men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Navruzchon

texts.ru: Наврузчон молодой перспективный студент. Он является студентом Института экономики Таджикистана. Он умный дальновидный жаждущий в поиске знаний парень. Он старается всегда пополнять свои знания. Он хочет получить займ для оплаты своего обучения. Надеется получить займ и заранее благодарить всех вас за вашу поддержку и понимание. Спасибо вам большое!
texts.en: Navruzchon is a young, promising student.  He is a student at the Tajikistan Economics Institute.  He is a smart, forward-looking young man, who is thirsty in search of knowledge.  Navruzchon always tries to gain more knowledge.  He wants to obtain this loan to pay for his education.  He hopes to get this loan and thanks all of you in advance for your support and understanding.  Thank you very much!

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Amale

texts.en: Amale is a 51-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and three school-aged children. She has owned a bakery since 2009 and produces tasty pastries. She has worked for 21 years. Despite her older age and since her income is limited, her husband who works outside the country, helps her with the household expenses especially with the heavy educational fees. With her requested loan of $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., she will be able to increase her inventory of food products such as flour, sugar and other ingredients. She has high hopes for the future of her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of food products such as flour, sugar and other ingredients.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is happy that he was able to make a lot of sales in his shop after he bought mobile phone accessories with his previous loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings.  Now that there is high demand for DVD players, he has requested a loan  for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy DVD players.  He hopes to grow his business and open three other outlets in another region so as to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy DVD players for his shop.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
Ignatius is 59 years old, married, and the father of three children. He runs a matatu (shared taxi) business in Bombolulu, Mombasa. His business has been in operation for the last 20 years, and it is doing well.

Ignatius is requesting his second loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to refurbish his matatu to make more trips to and from his service area. The additional profits will enable him to acquire a second matatu, thus expanding his business.

With the anticipated profits, he plans to repay his KADET loan. Ignatius hopes to expand his business into a transport company in the future and have a happy family.

loans.use: to refurbish his matatu in order to make more trips.

loans.name: María Ester

texts.es:
María Ester integrante del Banco comunal “Héroes del Mar 2” perteneciente a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida en un local que tiene ubicado en la orilla de una calle principal, cercana a su casa.
En este local cuenta con refrigerador, microondas, freidora, mesones, bandejas y fogones, entre otros. Ahí vende bebidas, pizzas, papas fritas, completos y churrascos. 
Trabaja en este negocio desde hace dos años. Su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a sus necesidades, por las mañanas realiza las compras de mercadería, durante las tardes preparara sus alimentos y durante las noches, abre su local para atender y vender sus productos.
Comenta que le va muy bien y que distribuye sus horarios de acuerdo a sus necesidades personales.
Su mercadería la compra en supermercados mayoristas y en el mercado de la ciudad.
Con el crédito comprará insumos para su negocio, entre sacos de papas, aceite, envases de plumavit y bebidas al por mayor. Siempre escoge lugares y comercios, donde los precios sean más convenientes.
Una de las metas para su negocio, es comprarse un vehículo para trasladar sus productos al local o cuando debe comprar mercadería.
María Ester vive junto a su marido y su hija de 2 años de edad, su marido es quien la ayuda con la crianza y cuidado de su pequeña hija, cuando ella debe trabajar. Sus sueños a nivel personal son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, ya que le han permitido invertir en su negocio e integrar nuevas y mejores estrategias en el área de ventas. 
Respecto al grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que son muy unidos y comprometidos. 
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
María Ester is a member of the “Héroes del Mar 2” [Heroes of the Sea] community bank, in the city of Valparaíso. She makes her living by preparing fast foods in a shop she has located near a main street, close to her house. At this shop, she has a refrigerator, microwave, fryer, counters, trays, and stoves, among other things. She sells drinks, pizzas, French fries, completos [Chilean style hotdogs with lots of toppings], and barbeque. 

She has been in this business for the past two years. She sets her work schedule according to her needs. In the mornings, she purchases merchandise; during the afternoon, she prepares food; and at night, she opens her shop to serve people and sell her products. She comments that things are going very well for her, and that she is able to arrange her schedule according to her personal needs. She purchases merchandise in wholesale supermarkets and in the city market.

With the loan, she will purchase foodstuffs wholesale, including sacks of potatoes, oil, Styrofoam containers and drink. She always chooses stores where the prices are most convenient. One of her business goals is to purchase a vehicle to transport her foods to the shop and to use for purchasing merchandise.

María Ester lives with her husband and her 2-year-old daughter. Her husband helps her raise and care for their small daughter while María Ester is working. Her personal dream is to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She is very pleased and appreciative of the services provided by Fondo Esperanza, as they have allowed her to invest in her business and to incorporate new and better sales strategies. Regarding the communal bank group of which she is a part, María Ester comments that they are very united and committed.

Valparaíso is located 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago. It is the regional capital and the seat of legislative power in the country. It is the main port of the nation and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, like, for example, the house of the Nobel Prize-winning poet, Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise for her business, including sacks of potatoes, oil, Styrofoam containers and drinks.

loans.name: Ghadir

texts.en:
Ghadir is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. She opened a gift shop in 2010, in order to help her husband earn their own living in a better way.
