Ghadir is a hard working woman and she has an excellent reputation in her area.

She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to improve her business by buying special Christmas gifts and household items.

Ghadir is sure that this loan will help her a lot and will reflect positively on both social and financial situations.

She hopes to expand her business more and more in the future, and to expand the shop, in addition to the quality of products provided.

loans.use: to increase her business capital to buy special gifts and household items for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra.  Elsa se dedica a la venta de bebidas y gaseosas y comida hace ya bastante tiempo, su esposo viaja a traer mercaderías de la localidad de  San Ignacio, la señora atiende su venta desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche ofrece variedad de refrescos, donde tambien tiene una rokola que le genera buenos ingresos, tiene tres hijos los cuales van al colegio del mismo barrio donde ella vive, son personas responsables las cuales trabajan hasta los domingos por el bienestar y para el futuro de sus hijos ya que su deseo es que sean profesionales, el motivo del crédito es para poder incrementar su mercadería comprando refrescos por cantidad, la Sra. Elsa se encuentra feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su negocio como en mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Elsa has been selling drinks, soft drinks, and food for a long time. Her husband travels to bring merchandise from the town of San Ignacio. Elsa tends to her sales from 8:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night. She has three children who go to the high school in the neighborhood where she lives. They [Elsa and her husband] are responsible people who work even on Sundays for the well being and future of their children. They would like for them to be professionals. The reason for the loan is to be able to increase her merchandise by buying soft drinks in greater volume. Elsa is happy and grateful for the opportunity she is provided to grow her business and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store (drinks)

loans.name: Kulsoom

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders ! This is Kulsoom and her team: Elvin (to her left) and Fabrice (to her right). 

Kulsoom is in charge of Juhudi Labs, an adventurous entity within Juhudi Kilimo, dedicated to discovering, testing and scaling new financial and agricultural products, services and processes. Fabrice is a marketing associate and Elvin is the Kiva Coordinator. They both work with Kulsoom on various development projects.

The 3 of them believe that success is in rallying coalitions of partners and mobilizing resources to lift smallholder farmers out of extreme poverty by broadening their access to education and financial inclusion. They are concerned that emerging challenges in Kenya such as climate change, conflict, and volatility of commodity prices threaten to erode decades of fragile gains in development we have made. It is for this reason that they have partnered with the following 3 start-up companies to make a difference:

1. Future Pump.
2. Ojay Greene
3. F3 Life

They are seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to pay for 3 video productions that will feature the business profiles for each of the 3 start-ups. The video will give the start-up ventures a great milestone in terms of material for fundraising and marketing, which is necessary for them if they are to meet their business objectives of forming strategic partnerships and creating brand awareness.

Future Pump is a company that produces a solar-powered water pump (called a Sunflower pump) for use in irrigation. The Sunflower pump is a low-cost pump intended to pump fresh water from underground reservoirs for irrigating farmland. A single pump can use solar energy to lift 13,000 litres per day, enough to irrigate an average small-scale farm.

Ojay Greene Ltd produces and aggregates fresh produce from local farmers to sell to regional urban supermarkets. The company also provides smallholder farmers with consultation services that touch on food production, marketing, and training packages to enable them to adopt sustainable agricultural techniques in order to produce high-quality produce to supply to urban supermarkets.

F3 Life provides training, on-site technical farming advice and credit to smallholder farmers to promote profitable, sustainable, and climate-resilient farming in the important watershed areas of Kenya. F3 Life’s credit facility has a ‘credit ladder’ which allows clients to build a credit history, demonstrate cash flows, and build collateral to enable them to secure loans from formal financial institutions. Further, loan terms include requirements for soil and water conservation measures to prevent soil erosion.

Your loan will help Kulsoom, Elvin and Fabrice pay for the production of professional videos about these start-ups. They shall help the ventures to utilize the videos to unlock new opportunities in education, funding, and strategic partnerships in order to scale their business and impact various areas such as:

1. Boosting Agricultural Productivity and livelihoods in Kenya
Kenya has an 82% dependency ratio. 75% of the Kenyan workforce is dependent on agriculture for a living, the majority working on small farms. There is a huge deficit in basic skills and access to finances, meaning that yields and income are far below the potential.

2. Expanding access to energy
Clean renewable energy programs that Juhudi Kilimo has rolled out have had a transformative effect on poor people’s lives. They have provided lighting, clean cooking, and phone charging. Future Pump focuses on income-generating opportunities such as irrigation. They are targeting rural smallholder farmers who live in off-the-grid zones and rely on solid fuels to meet their daily needs.

3. Improving financial inclusion
Rural smallholder farmers in Kenya have little or no access to formal financial services. They are unable to put their meager and unpredictable incomes into bank accounts and are therefore unable to save or take loans. Lack of credit keeps them from purchasing essential goods and services.

The partnership with the start-ups seeks to take full advantage of the explosion of the mobile phone market in Kenya by seizing an opportunity to use innovative, mobile-based solutions to provide inclusive, branchless financial services to rural farmers. We see mobile phones as a way of facilitating low-margin, high-volume business, as well as dramatically increasing the reach.

4. Increasing access to education
Education is the cornerstone of poverty reduction. Education leads to many other development benefits besides improving income. Education has traditionally been a responsibility of the public sector, but it is also an area where the private sector can make a difference!

Help these innovative businesses grow by supporting's Kulsoom's initiative.

loans.use: to pay for video production for companies improving rural smallholder farmers' livelihood

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and all attend school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a boutique selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for the last two years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy materials for making African clothes. Her major challenges include high costs of transportation. Her goal is to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house with access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making African clothes

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 49 years old and has four children. Myrna is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Myrna has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
N. Sarem has been widowed for 10 years already. She is living with her three children and running a small grocery shop in front of her house. She sells for around 50,000 Riel everyday, out of which she earns a 15,000 Riel daily profit. Her two grown daughters are also contributing to the household’s income with her factory workers salaries.

 

N. Sarem applied for a first loan of $700 because her neighbor told her about CREDIT. She would like to open a new business, selling second-hand clothes in the nearby market. She needs running capital to start the business, to purchase the clothes and to pay the daily market fee, which is 3,000 Riel. She expects 37,000 Riel daily profit ($9.25).

 

After this cycle, N. Sarem would like to invest more in her business. She would like to purchase a selling spot in the market, so that she no longer needs to rent it. The 1.5m*1.5m plot is worth $1000.

loans.use: Opening a second-hand clothing shop in the market

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en:
This hard-working person has 30 head of cattle. He has difficulty in tending a herd in the pasture because he does not have a horse. 
Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought 8-10 sheep and goats.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a horse.
He has had this business for 8 years and it allows him to support  his family.
He is 39, married, has 3 children and is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region.

loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a seamstress and she makes fabric hats. She is 41 years old and has two daughters, who, along with her husband, help her make the hats. This is a small family business, which is why they do not have any employees. Ernestina has been working in this business for more than 15 years. Her home and shop are located in the Llojeta-Tiwiña zone, one the western slope of the city of La Paz. She also has a stall on Isaac Tamayo Street in La Paz, where she sells hats by the dozen every morning. This is one of the city’s streets that gets a lot of traffic and is dominated by the informal sector. Her hat production is by the dozen, since she sells in bulk to her buyers, who then sell the hats individually; through her business, she indirectly generates several jobs.

This is the fifth loan Ernestina has obtained through IMPRO. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a Level 1 client, that is to say, Very Good in payment of her obligation. The amount requested will be used to buy fabric, thread, and burlap (jute) bags. Her work, experience, and the location of her stall give her the opportunity to obtain credit, which is why she is sure she will have the income to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina, es costurera y elabora sombreros de tela. Tiene 41 años y dos hijas, quienes junto a su esposa le ayudan en la elaboración de los sombreros. Este es el caso de una microempresa familiar por lo cual no cuenta con empleados. Tiene experiencia en el rubro por más de 15 años. Su Vivienda y Taller están ubicados en la zona de Llojeta-Tiwiña (ladera Oeste) de la ciudad de La Paz y tiene un puesto de venta por las mañanas a precio de docena en la C/ final Isaac Tamayo de la ciudad de La Paz, calle de comercio informal muy popular en esta ciudad. Sus producción y elaboración es por docena ya que en el puesto de venta es al por mayor para que sus compradores lo puedan vender al detalle, con esta actividad genera varios empleos indirectos Es la quinta vez que obtiene un crédito en Impro, Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Muy Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de tela, forro hilo y bolsas de yute. Su trabajo, experiencia y ubicación de su puesto de venta le dan la oportunidad de obtener un crédito por lo cual le asegura los ingresos para el retorno de el crédito

loans.use: Working capital to buy materials with which to make hats

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. S., 26 years old and a mother of one child, lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by operating a tailoring business and makes in average about $3/day in revenue, while her husband is a staff at a local organization. In order to maximize her family's savings, S. has an idea to grow mangoes in a plantation, which she thinks it will brings huge amount of income in a period of four to five months. To do this, S. is currently requesting for a loan amount of $800 to purchase a plot of land to grow mango and a small part of money is to purchase more clothes and threads for her inventory. In the future, S. dreams of being able to have enough money to build a new house for her family and offers her children a high level of education

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow fruits.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata C. is forty yearsold and married with six children.  A hardworking woman, Aminata contributes financially toward her family's well being. She sells food staples in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone and was able to repay her first loan successfully.  She increased her stock by purchasing onions and wheat flour with the previous loan.  Aminata needs another loan to expand her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: Increase food staple items for selling.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana S. is 35 years old and a mother of five.  She has a vegetable garden and she sells the vegetables that she grows.  She hardly needs any help from her husband  and she does the gardening by herself.  Her  two sons eleven and thirteen year old help her out.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Ilkham

texts.en: Mr. K. is a vulnerable, low-income person. He is 35 and married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Ilkham owns and operates a mini shop in Saatli town. He sells spare parts, oil and other items for cars. However, his working capital is very limited and he has no opportunity to diversify his inventory. For this purpose, he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch and is waiting to receive a $500 loan.

loans.use: To increase variety in his inventory

loans.name: Estervina Severino

texts.en: Estervina is a very active businesswoman who runs a cafeteria and also sells vegetables in the public market.  She operates the cafeteria on weekends only, when demand is greatest. During the week, you can see her in a stall in the public market selling her fresh vegetables. Estervina is 50 years old and has nine children, eight of whom are boys. She plans to use her loan to buy raw materials for her cafeteria, and more vegetables to sell in the public market.  She is very confident that she use her loan well because of the experience she has acquired during many busy and arduous years of work.  She is also determined to keep working hard to improve her her own life as well as the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for a cafeteria and vegetables for a small business.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Dorica B.. She is single with two children, ages 6 and 10, and has one other dependent who is her nephew. In 2005 Dorica established a childcare business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to expand her daycare centre. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her daycare centre in Mwanza, Tanzania.

loans.name: Sokinamoh.

texts.ru:
Sokinamoh R. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 45 years old, she is married, and has children. Sokinamoh has a high school education. She works on the market "Tijorat." She purchases goods from the city of Dushanbe and resells them on the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. This is the main source of income for her family and for that reason it is structured and functions very well. She plans to obtain the loan to increase the amount of inventory by purchasing more seasonal goods. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Сокинамох Сохибназаровна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 45 лет.замужем имеет 4детей. Образование среднее.Занимается торговлей на рынке « Тиджорат» города Яван. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует со своей торговой точки. Опыт в данном бизнесе имеет около 10 лет. Эта деятельность является основным источником ее дохода, поэтому бизнес хорошо налажен. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот путем ввоза сезонного товара. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the amount of inventory

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene works as a driver in the public service. His route connects La Paz and El Alto. This job is his only source of income, and with it he must support his wife and two daughers, both of whom are in school. The family lives in the Tilata (en route to Viacha, in the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used to purchase school uniforms and supplies, as well as to prepay living expenses, so that his daughters can go to school without any complications.

This is the second credit for which Impro has approved this client. His prompt repayment on his first loan helped him be approved for this second loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Rene es transportista del servicio público, su ruta esta entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto, dicha actividad es su única fuente de ingreso la cual cubre la manutención de su esposa y sus dos hijas que asisten a la escuela. La familia vie en la zona de Tilata (camino a Viacha en la Ciudad de El Alto).

El monto del crédito será destinado para la compra de uniforme y material escolar, a esto se suma el pago de las pensiones por adelantado. De esta manera, sus hijas podrán asistir a la escuela sin ningún contratiempo.

Este es el segundo crédito que Impro le otorga a este cliente. Su buen comportamiento de pago facilita la aprobación del préstamo a Rene.

loans.use: Investment in his daughters' education

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.es:
Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin have been members of Banco Comunal Tambillo for 1 year. They come from the Tambillo dsitrict which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Anatolia lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 children. She has a small grocery shop in her home.

Then there is Norma, who is married, is 30 years old and has 2 children. Norma has a shop where she sells groceries, fruit and vegetables. She is also involved in agricultural work and in raising guinea-pigs.

Yasmin lives with her partner, is 25 years old and has 1 daughter. She sells second-hand clothes donated by her friends and family. She also sells food and toys at the Sunday market in San Juan Bautista.

Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin need this combined loan of $850 to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, vegetables, fruit, shoe polish, toothpaste, cooking pots and plates.

Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin have four dreams - to build a house, to open a shop in their house, that their business grows, and that their children become successful in their work.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tambillo hace 1 año, ellas son del distrito de Tambillo que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Anatolia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Norma es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Norma tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Norma se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y la agricultura.

Mientras que Yasmin es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Yasmin vende ropa a pedido a personas conocidas, familiares. Además Yasmin vende comida y jugos en la feria dominical de San Juan Bautista.

Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 900 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, verduras, frutas, betún, crema dental, ollas, platos.

Los sueños de Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin son construir una casa, abrir una tienda en su casa, surtir su negocio y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin need this combined loan of $850 to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, vegetables, fruit, shoe polish, toothpaste, cooking pots and plates.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is a 60-year-old widow mother of seven children. She is a trader who trades in tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish and other goods from a tabletop in the local market. Abena says her husband died several years ago and through this business she has managed to support her seven children to finish school and enter the workforce. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more tubers, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increase her stock and make bigger income to put up a decent shelter.

Abena belongs to the community group called Okamafo (Deliverer) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Anita

texts.fr:
Born on October 26, 1972 in Cotonou, south of Benin, Ms. Anita I. is a hairdresser. Anita is married to a teacher and they have 6 children. Having already benefited from four loans (and repaid) from our institution, she requests a fifth loan to invest not only in headgear and braids, but also in cooking oil and various articles of clothing.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 26 Octobre 1972 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN et coiffeuse de profession, dame I. Anita s'est mariée à un instituteur avec qui elle a eu 6 enfants. Ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits auprès de notre l'institution qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite un cinquième crédit pour investir non seulement dans la coiffure et la tresse, mais aussi dans la commercialisation d'huile alimentaire et d'articles vestimentaires.

loans.use: To buy 15 cans of 10 L cooking oil, 50 sets of wavy hair, 10 sets of natural hair, 5 cartons of shampoo, 2 bales of skirts and blouses

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa works selling magazines. She rents a space in a downtown area in the city of Huancayo where it is very convenient for her to sell her magazines. She has been 35 years in this business, and hence knows very well what her clients buy and thus knows what magazines to buy. Rosa lives with her two children, and they help her organizing the magazines. Rosa has noticed that taste changes with time, and that the classical magazines no longer sell well with the newer clients. That is why Rosa would like to buy a set of new and varied magazines, and she is asking for a loan with the promise to repay it responsibly and on time. Rosa considers that when a person offers a lending hand to others, that person deserves her utmost respect.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una mujer de mucha trayectoria en el ámbito de las ventas de revistas, ella arrienda un espacio en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Huancayo donde puede ofrecer sus revistas con mucha comodidad. Ella lleva 35 años en este negocio, por ello que conoce muy bien el gusto de sus clientes y sabe cuales revistas traer y cuales no. Rosa vive con sus dos hijos, los que le colaboran mucho con su trabajo y le ayudan a organizar sus revistas. Rosa se ha dado cuenta que los gustos van cambiado según el paso de los años, y las revistas clásicas, muchas veces ya no satisfacen el gusto de nuevos clientes.Por ello Rosa desea adquirir un lote con novedosas y variadas revistas, y solicita este préstamo con la promesa de pagar puntual y responsablemente. Ya que ella considera que cuando una persona le tiende la mano a otra, merece todo su respeto.

loans.use: To buy a new set of magazines to sell them in her business.

loans.name: Berlyn Beatriz

texts.es:
Berlyn is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics on foot and also in her home. She is married. Her husband drives a taxi. The car is belongs to them both. They both work very hard to support their son of 14 years. For 6 years Berlyn has been dedicated to the sale of cosmetics to her neighbors in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of the city of Managua. She started this business with her own capital and the help of her husband, but had to request loans from AFODENIC because her initial investment was very small and she needed more inventory. Like the previous loans, this loan will be used to invest in her business, buying perfumes of the AVON brand to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Berlyn se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y también lo hace en su casa de habitación, es casada, su esposo es taxi, el vehículo es propiedad de la pareja. Ambos se esfuerzan mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo de 14 años. Desde hace 6 años Berlyn se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a sus vecinos del Barrio Villa Reconciliación de la ciudad de Managua, empezó este negocio con capital propio y ayuda de su esposo, tuvo que requerir de créditos a AFODENIC, ya que su inversión inicial era muy poco y ella necesitaba tener más inventario, al igual que los anteriores este crédito será usado en inversión para su negocio, comprará perfumes de la marca AVON para ofertarlos a sus clientes

loans.use: To buy AVON perfums to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina runs a small business selling denim clothing for women. She is married with two grown daughters. In 2007, Valentina was faced with tough circumstances; she was diagnosed with cancer. Her husband left the family, and she had to fight the disease herself. However, she didn't get desperate. She decided to trust God with her life. Today her family circumstances have stabilized. Valentina's husband returned to the family. Her daughters got settled in life. Today Valentina has about $2,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1000. She is making about $400 in profit each month.

Valentina has been in the clothing business for over 10 years and has partnered with Nadiya Ukraine for 7 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain a loyal clientele. Currently, Valentina has two vending locations. Valentina would like to receive a loan for 5000 Grivnas to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of denim wear. High-quality, durable, and comfortable merchandise will sell well and will help Valentina's business grow, especially this fall season.

loans.use: To increase stock before the fall season

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Angela L., tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es a quien ella ayuda en sus estudios actualemnte ya que los otros dos se mantienen por su propia cuenta. La actividad economica de ella es la venta de ropa nueva actividad que desarrolla por encargo, teniendo mas de 15 años de dedicarse, cabe señalar que este seria su segundo credito con el programa KIVA,. Doña Angela da inico en los creditos como toda perosna con deseos de superacion y la ncesidad de obtener un poco mas de ingresos incrementadno su capital de trabajo inicial, ella continua con su sueño de poder incrementar su negocio y darle un giro mas adelante de instalsr una pequeña tienda. Por lo que desea contar contar siempre con el apoyo de nuestra institucion que lepermita ir desarrollandose economivamente e ir logrando sus metas propuestas, solicitando nuevamente para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Angela L., 53, is married and has three children, one of whom she still helps with schooling. The other two children are self-supporting. Angela makes a living selling new clothes, work that she learned by doing, having more than 15 years experience now. It should be noted that this loan would be Angela's second with KIVA. She started like everyone with the hope of getting ahead and a need for a little more income. By increasing her working capital, she's continued toward her dream of growing her business and moving a step closer to setting up a small shop. She's counted on our institution's support for what she's needed to develop her business and fulfill her goals which is why she's again asking for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 21 años es  soltera, natural de la ciudad de Lima vive sola en un cuarto que alquilo. Delia al migrar de la capital hace dos años decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de chompas de lana, ya que siempre le gusto tejer y es lo que mejor sabe hacer. Delia vende Chompas por pedidos los cuales vende en la ciudad de Juliaca los días de feria y  también lleva a la ciudad de Cuzco. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tiempo que le demora tejer las chompas ya que los pedidos son abundantes y a veces ella no se abastece en terminar todos los pedidos. Es su primer préstamo en microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que Delia esta solicitando quiere comprar algunos repuestos de su máquina para hacerla trabajar al máximo y también  comprar material en lana, hilos, etc.
texts.en:
Delia is 21 years old and single. She is from Lima and she lives alone in a rented room. Delia left the capital two years ago and decided to start a business making and selling wool sweaters. She's always liked to weave and she knows how to do it well. Delia sells sweaters by request, and also on market days in the cities of Juliaca and Cuzco. The most difficult part of her job is that it takes a long time to sew the sweaters and sometimes she isn't able to fill all of her orders. This is Delia's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She'll use the money to buy some replacement parts for her loom so that it can work at maximum efficiency. She'll also buy materials like wool, thread, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for her loom

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung V., 46, is married and lives with four of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers and make US$2 each day. The family is also supported by two of the children who work in the local garment factories.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have made it a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these challenging times, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to breed pigs for extra profit. She sees this new business as a good economic investment and will use it to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To breed pigs.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa   es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Carmen Rosa es casada, tiene  49 años y cuatro hijos  de 27, 22,18 y 12 años,  el menor de sus hijos todavía está en la escuela y otro de sus hijos está en estudios superiores.
Carmen Rosa tiene su negocio hace ya treinta años, vende productos de belleza de todas las marcas, les ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, ella invierte paga y saca mas mercadería para su stock.También va a comenzar a vender ahora en el tiempo de verano raspadillas y cremoladas.
Desde hace diez años recibe los préstamos ha podido  invertir mas y es una gran ayuda.

Carmen Rosa  necesita  un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo y en la compra de una máquina para moler hielo para la venta de raspadilla y cremoladas.
Carmen Rosa  sueña con  tener su propio negocio y trabajar con su familia, también ampliar el taller de cerrajería de su esposo.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the village bank el Triunfo. She is married, 49 years old and has four children aged 27, 22, 18 and 12. The youngest of her children is still in school while the others are pursuing continued studies. Carmen Rosa has been in business for thirty years selling beauty products of all brands. She sells to family and friends and uses her earnings to increase her stock. Now that it is summertime sh ealso plans to start selling snow cones (crushed ice with syrup on top). She has recieved loans for the past ten years which has allowed her to invest more money and has been a great help. Carmen Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles (325 dollars) which will be spent buying more beauty products and a machine to crush ice for snow cones. She dreams of having her own business and working with her family, and also of improving her husband's locksmith shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing beauty products

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: Lek S., 32, lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She stays at home doing housework and helping her husband making drums. Her husband, Tum Thyni, 30, pictured here, is a true entrepreneur who has had a business making drums since 2005. On average, he makes and sells about 5 to 7 drums at the market every day to earn approximately US$ 7.50. The drums are made from palm trees. This couple has three children and all of them are students. Mrs. Lek S. is asking for a loan to purchase palm trees to use to make drums.

loans.use: To purchase palm trees to use to make drums

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mrs. Vith P. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Phang Phat, is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from the house, he usually has to pay a lot of money for a motor taxi to get to work. Thus, Mrs. Vith P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to go to work. She hopes to reduce the transportation expenses. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi F. est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est  revendeuse de céréales et de légumes au marché d’Atakpamé. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité, Akou désire avec ce crédit acheter plus de marchandises pour la revente. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits.
texts.en:
Akouvi F. is a 35-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four. She sells grain and vegetables at the Atakpamé marketplace. To expand her business, Akou would like to use this loan to buy more merchandise for resale. This will enable her to increase her sales and consequently her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Fadhil

texts.en: Fadhil R. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur business man.  He runs a business to provide transport services at Chanika, in Dar es Salaam.  He owns a taxi and receives 30,000 Tshs per day, equivalent to four hundred thousand Tshs per month.  He has been in the business for three years and plans to extent his services by buying more taxis.   He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to extent his business.

loans.use: Expand taxi business.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исматов Исмоил проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Исмоил более 20 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует коврами. Работает вместе со своими старшими детьми. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и расширить ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Ismoil I. lives in the Gissar area. He is 50 years old, is married and has eight children. He works in a store. He has a food store. Ismoil works there together with his older children. He plans to receive credit in order to increase his turnover and expand his product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Dadajon

texts.ru: Дадажон Махкамов-мужчина 50-ти лет,женат имеет 2-х детей.Занимается продажей одежды на вещевом рынке. Один раз в неделю  он ездит за товаром в город Истаравшан.Ему помогает его жена и дети. Дадажон имеет 20 летный стаж работы и у него большой опыт. Кроме этого он роботает художником театре.На новый займ он хочет привезти сезонный товар на летнее время.Он рад,что кредитуется в нашей организации.
texts.en:
Dadajon Mahkamov is 50 years old and is married with two children. Once a week he travels to Istaravshan to purchase clothings that he later sells at the market. His wife and children help him with this business. Dadajon has 20 years of work experience. In addition, he works as an artist in the theater. He would like to use the new loan for bringing summer clothing. He is happy to be our client.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase summer season clothing for sale

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira Q. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 29 years old. Mira is married and is the mother of a small child. To make a living, Mira owns and operates a business venture operating pedicab transport services. Mira has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase an additional pedicab for the business.

Mira is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used for repairs on her pedicab and to purchase new equipment for the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Mira from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For vehicle repairs and the purchase of new equipment

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sevda Group

texts.en:
Sevda Group has seven members, of which Sevda A. N. is the leader. The group is requesting a loan of $US 1500 to improve their following businesses.

Sevda wants a loan for her embroidery business. Sakaba wants to take assist her husband with his car parts shop. Mallei wants to help her son with his vegetables and fruits shop. Zenat wants a loan for the tailoring business. Shmen wants to assist her son with his ice cream shop. Qais also wants to improve his ice cream business. Finally, Amal wants to expand his taxi business. They are thankful to kiva lenders for their worldwide support.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Joven Miguel Angel es originario de la comunidad de Totonicapan  a su corta edad ha emprendido su propio negocio en la venta de ropa para damas y ganchos el nos comenta que el negocio le dio la idea su difunta madre, el lucho para conseguir un puesto de venta en la plaza solicitando en la Municipalidad y la cual lo consiguio  vender los dias de plaza que son los dias martes y sabados con el capital que tenia no hera suficiente para surtir su mercaderia hoy visita las oficina de ASDIR para poderle ayudar con un credito que le servira para surtir su mercaderia.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a young man from the community of Totonicapan, who started his own business selling clothes and clothes’ hangers for the ladies. He says that his deceased mother gave him the business idea. He struggled to get a booth in the city square market. He got the booth and sells on Tuesdays and Saturdays which are the market’s days. His working capital is not enough to replenish merchandise so he is asking for a loan to ASDIR that will be used to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. spent her life on the farm. Since she was just a little girl, she has been work hard to help support her parents and grow crops for their livelihood. Now she has two children. Her husband manages a one-hectare (~2.5-acre) rice field. At first, their harvest was intended for family consumption until they decided to sell the excess for additional income for their family.

Now, she needs additional capital to support her business. She is applying for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loanto buy a unitsprayer and foliar fertlizer (fertilizer that is applied directly to plant leaves).

CEVI helps farmers sustain their livelihood. Through the credit services, training, and insurance coverage services that it offers, more and more were able to grow their business.

loans.use: To buy a unit sprayer and foliar fertlizers

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mrs. Phorn P. is 28-year-old and a resident of Pursat Province. She lives in her own old wooden house with other family members and makes a living as a farmer. Her husband works as a requirement worker for income and also assists her on the farm. This couple is blessed with two kids who are not yet attending school and under their care. In the past, the family has been paying much money in hiring the neighbor’s oxen to alleviate plowing their farmland because they don’t own a cow to for using purposes. Phorn P. is taking out her loan to buy a cow so that it will allow her to cut the hiring fee.

loans.use: To buy a cow so that it will allow her to plow the fields

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en:
Ameen is 29 years old. He is single and lives with his parents in their own home. He is the source of economic support for their family. He makes a living buying and selling shoes to provide a greater income for his family.

Ameen would like to request a loan of US$ 1500 in order to restock his inventory and purchase more merchandise for the new season. Be an important part of the growth of Ameen's business! He sincerely thanks you.

loans.use: Restock his inventory and purchase more merchandise for the new season

loans.name: Señor Pan De Azucar De Sacllo Group

texts.es:
El banco se denomina  “ SEÑOR PAN DE AZUCAR DE SACLLO”, este banco está situado en la comunidad de Sacllo ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Calca, en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los antiguos Inkas.

Nuestros socios conforman este banco en su mayoría dos años continuos, siendo socios cumplidores, ellos alternan sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, esta época ellos están arando sus tierras para hacer efectiva una nueva siembra de maíz, esta zona produce un grano grande y dulce, otros socios requieren el dinero para comprar animales menores como son cuyes y aves de corral, para la reproducción y la futura venta, algunos socios mas son docentes y otros tienen su tienda de abarrotes, todos en general tienen sus tierras y son agricultores, a parte de esta actividad alternan con diferentes comercios menores, ellos solicitan el préstamo para invertir el dinero en sus cultivos.

Nuestros socios se encuentran sumamente agradecidos por el préstamo otorgado comprometiéndose al pago de sus deudas en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
The Señor Pan de Azucar de Sacllo bank is located in the Sacllo community, which is in the Calca district and province in the heart of the sacred valley of the ancient Incas. The members who make up this bank have mostly done so for two continuous years. They are dependable members. They alternate their activities between the home and farming. This time of year they are plowing their land to get it ready for a new planting of corn. This region produces a large and sweet grain. Other members need the money to buy small animals like guinea pigs and poultry to breed and later sell. Other members are teachers. Others have grocery stores. Generally, all of them have land and are farmers. Aside from this activity they alternate with different small businesses. They are asking for the loan to invest money in their crops. Our members are extremely grateful for the loan granted, and they promise to make all of their payments in the determined time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and seeds to plant their crops and small livestock

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah has been in business for 15 years and, besides a vegetable business, she sells Irish potatoes. She works seven days a week and gets 20 customers a day. She incurs extra expenses transporting to and from suppliers in the Owino market (one of the busiest markets in Uganda). The major challenges she faces are transport costs and seasonality.

Hadjah is a 40-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of 10 and 18 years. She lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. All her children go to school. Hadjah rents a one-room house where she lives with seven people. There is no electricity or piped water in her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Hadjah has been with MCDT for five years, now on her fifteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more vegetables and sacks of Irish potatoes. Hadjah's aspiration is seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and sacks of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina B. is popular in her nickname as “ Marie” in their village located at Brgy. Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcya. She is 45 years old and finished her secondary education. Due to financial shortage, she did not pursue her college studies. She works hard to earn a living until she got married to Teodoro B. Jr. and they are gifted with two children namely Caroline B. and Diana Rose B..  Being a responsible parent, both of their children are now in college level taking up different degree. Despite our economic crisis, they are still striving for the sake of the future of their children.
	Her husband is one of the soldiers who are assigned in Manila while she is engaged in selling snacks in their village to help her husband in earning income to support the education of their children. Since she only have small capital, she only earns a net income of P 600.00 per week. In this regard, she wants to borrow additional capital to strengthen her business. She tried to apply an amount of P 5,000.00 to be added in her capital to acquire materials and ingredients needed for her business. She is so thankful when she joins in this organization because it gives her the opportunity to improve her small business. And she hopes that through her efforts and sacrifices, their two children will finish their studies and her business will also grow. As she have said,” Patience and sacrifices are the key to success.”

loans.use: additional capital to buy more ingredients needed in her business

loans.name: De Las Nieves

texts.es: La Señora De Las Nieves O., es madre de un hijo menor, su domicilio particular se encuentra en el Barrio San Agustín de Ciudad del Este, se dedica a manicura y pedicuro en la peluquería de su hermana en el micro centro de la ciudad, también cuenta con un local de ventas de ropas, tal crédito solicitado destinara a la compra de mercaderías tales como  ropas y frazadas, se trata de una persona con un excelente comportamiento de pago reflejado en sus antecedentes con nuestra empresa.
texts.en:
Ms. De Las Nieves O. has a young child. She lives in the San Agustín neighborhood in Ciudad del Este. She works a manicurist/pedicurist at her sister’s beauty salon downtown, but she also has her own apparel boutique. She will be using this loan to purchase merchandise, such as clothing and blankets. She has had an excellent repayment history with her previous loans from our institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel and blankets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es:
la sra. Edith Xiomara A. O. tiene 27 años de edad, vive en la colonia Rivera de la Vega en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene un año de haber iniciado con su negocio, sus clientes son sus vecinos, pulperias, mercaditos, tambien hace tortillas por encargo para reuniones o fiestas.
el credito lo necesita para comparar harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua. desea comprar mas para tener una mayor produccion y asi tener mejores ventas.
nos comento que su sueño es tener una maquina para elaborar tortillas y hacer una mayor produccion ya que este alimento es muy comprado por muchas personas.
texts.en:
Edith Xiomara A. O. is 27 years old and she lives in the Rivera de la Vega neighborhood in the city of Tegucigalpa. She is involved in the production and sale of tortillas and has a year in the business. Her customers are her neighbors, convenience stores, and small markets. She also makes tortillas to order for meetings or parties.

Edith needs the loan to purchase cornmeal, firewood, lime, and water. She would like the purchase more in order to increase production and, thus, have better sales.

She remarked to us that her dream is to have a machine to make tortillas and have increased production since it is a food purchased by many people.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of firewood, cornmeal, water, lime, matches

loans.name: Bibi Begam Group

texts.en:
Gull Soma is the group leader of Bibi Begam group. There are four members in this group. Gull Soma is a married woman. She is 50 years old with four children in her house. Gull Soma wants to take a loan for her son's general store. He sells different kinds of things. He wants to purchase more good quality materials for his shop. In fact, his main purpose is to attract more clients and to purchase the things which are in high demand in his market.

Bibi Begam and Hafeza want to take a loan for their tailoring business. They need six machines and a desk for their business in her house. They want to buy the necessary materials for their business. Rahema wants to take a loan for her son's business selling fuel. He wants to make his shop larger. He wants to expand and improve his business. 

They request a group loan of 40000 Afghani. They would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders who support the people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Afi Djigbodé

texts.en: Like many other Togolese entrepreneurs, Ms. A. engages in many activities to support herself and her two children. She sells fabrics for clothing as well as charcoal and firewood. She is divorced and lives and works in the Agoé region of Togo. This will be her first loan with WAGES, which she will divide between both her businesses. Specifically, she will purchase 20 bags of charcoal and 1 load of fabrics. This loan will help keep her two businesses running smoothly.

loans.use: To buy fabric and charcoal

loans.name: Paraiso Group

texts.es: El grupo “Paraíso” esta representado por la señora María Jaqueline y conformada por 10 miembros los cuales se conocen muy bien ya que no es la primera vez que trabajan bajo esta modalidad D. créditos solidarios como grupo. La gran mayoría D. las socias se dedica al comercio D. productos como ropa para niños, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos D. forma ambulante o por medio D. catálogos, servicio D. peluquería, entre los varones se dedican muchos se dedican al transporte D. público, servicio D. pintura D. viviendas y la atención D. café Internet. El mercado en el que trabajan es bastante competitivo por lo que los socios continuamente van mejorando sus productos y mejorando sus servicios para no dejarse sorprender por la competencia. La mayoría D. los socios destinará el crédito al mejoramiento D. sus negocios así como a la compra D. insumos, materiales y a mejorar sus herramientas D. trabajo, como pintura nueva para sus vehículos, compra D. materiales al por mayor como abarrotes y mayor material para la venta D. ropa. Dentro D. la institución los socios van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando pagos puntuales y ganas D. sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Paraíso” (Paradise) Group is led by Sra. María Jaqueline and consists of ten members who know each other very well. This is not the first time they have participated together in a solidarity group loan. Most of the members have retail businesses selling products such as children’s clothing, groceries, cosmetics through catalog orders and on-demand, and hairstyling services. The male group members are primarily involved in public transportation, residential house painting, and management of an Internet café. The markets in which they work are very competitive, so the members are continually improving their products and services so that they won’t be surprised by their business rivals.

Most of the members will use their loans to improve their business by paying for supplies, materials, and improvements to their equipment, such as repainting their vehicles. Others will buy inventory in bulk to sell such as groceries and clothing. The members are starting their third loan cycle with the Institution. They have demonstrated that they are capable of completing their payments on time and becoming successful on behalf of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita A. currently lives in Nkwen, Cameroon, and is the widowed mother of three children. She has been with GHAPE since 2007 and has demonstrated a creditworthy character exemplified by her repayments, her consistent attendance at meetings and her support of her borrowing group. She is currently requesting her third loan from GHAPE. 

With this latest loan Rita is hoping to continue the business supported by her prior loans. She has requested 400,000 XFA in order to purchase lumber and to pay for the labor of converting it into firewood to sell.

Rita is confident that her business will continue to do well because of her experience in this industry. She understands her customers, their demands and the increasing need for firewood in her area. She is confident that her business will continue to provide revenue for reinvestment and to meet her family’s needs.

Rita hopes to use the profits from her business to provide for her children including providing her family with meals. She will also be utilizing the revenue to take care of some personal medical needs.

Rita’s loan will be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO (non-governmental organization) based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients

loans.use: To buy more timber and to pay for its conversion into firewood to sell

loans.name: Pansheirwat12 Group

texts.en:
Marzya is the group leader of Pansheirwat12 group. There are four female members in this group. They want to develop their businesses. The group leader, Marzya, is 56 years old. She lives with her four children. She wants to take out a loan for her business of quilt-sewing. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business.

Sherowza wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store where he sells different kinds of things. He wants to expand his business and buy more materials, especially the things that are more in demand. He also wants to attract more customers. And Hazar Bibi wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. She wants to expand and further her business.

Leda wants to take a loan for her tailoring business and works hard to earn money for the completion of her family’s requirements. She needs to buy a new sewing machine for her shop because she has lots of problems with the old one she has during sewing. Besides, she wants to hire a student to help her with her business and to enlarge her business.

They are requesting a group loan of 56,000 Afghani. They want to thank all lenders of AFSG and Kiva that help poor people of Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Primberdieva Akbermet`s Group

texts.ru:
Примбердиева Акбермет является лидером данной группы. Группа состоит из 4 участников. Это их первый кредит в МБФ. 

Акбермет 33 года, она замужем. Ее супруг оказывается услуги транспортных перевозок по маршруту Узген-Бишкек-Узген, поэтому из-за специфики работы, он много времени проводит в столице нашей республики. Вместе с мужем Акбермет воспитывает 4 детей. Самому старшему 9 лет, а младшему 1 годик. Она занимается розничной реализацией детской одежды с арендованной точки на центральном рынке Узгена. Хотя она начала этот бизнес в 2009 году, за счет хороших предпринимательских навыков, она в данное время получает стабильный доход, достаточный чтобы, достойно содержать семью. Кредит будет использован для закупа детских кофточек, водолазок. 

Замиру 44 года. Он женат и воспитывает 3 детей. Его супруга работает в России в пекарном цехе. Старшая дочь является инвалидом и поэтому постоянно находится дома. Остальные двое детей учатся в старших классах местной школы.  Замир занимается животноводством: откормом и разведением КРС и МРС. В данное в приусадебном хозяйстве держит 7 голов  МРС и  2 голов КРС. Кредит будет использован для закупа 2 голов МРС и ягненком.

Гулмире 36 лет, замужем. У нее есть собственный магазин, который находится в центре родного села. Этим бизнесом она начала заниматься после замужества. В данное время продает широкий спектр товаров, включая продукты питания и одежду. Кредит будет использован для закупа макарон, соли, сигарет, спичек, а также для детского комплекта одежды. 

Динара Рысбаева является последним участником этой группы. Она берет кредит для закупа семян подсолнуха, который будет посажен в собственном участке. Кроме этого ее супруг занимается выращиванием скота, а также в свободное время оказывает услуги перевозок по маршртуту Узген – село Колдук.     


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Akbermet P. is the leader of this group. The group is made of 4 participants. This is their first loan with MBF. Akbermet is 33 years old and married. Her husband provides transportation services on the Uzgen-Bishkek-Uzgen route, and due to the nature of his work, he spends a lot of time in the capital of our republic. Together with her husband, Akbermet is raising 4 children. The oldest is 9 years old, and the youngest is 1 years old. Akbermet is involved in retail sales of children’s clothing at a leased retail outlet on the Uzgen central market. Although, she started this business in 2009, due to the good entrepreneurial knowledge, Akbermet has a stable income, enough to decently support the family. The loan will be used for the purchase of children’s blouses and shirts. Zamir is 44 years old. He is married and raising 3 children. His wife works in Russia at a bakery. The oldest daughter is disabled and always stays at home. The other two children attend a local school. Zamir is involved in animal husbandry: feeding and breeding of cattle and small livestock. Currently, he has 7 heads of small livestock and 2 heads of cows in the household. The loan will be used for the purchase of 2 heads of small livestock and a lamb. Gulmira is 36 years old and married. She owns a store, located in the center of her native village. She started this business soon after she got married. Currently, Gulmira sells a wide variety of merchandise, including food products and clothing. The loan will be used for the purchase of pasta, salt, cigarettes, matches and also children’s clothing sets. Dinara R. is the last participant of this group. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of sunflower seeds to be planted on her own land. Besides this, her husband is involved in raising livestock and also provides transportation services on the Uzgen-Kolduk route.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's clothing

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos en el pueblo joven Fernando Belaúnde, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo. La zona se caracteriza por tener habitantes de bajos recursos, cuenta con servicios de agua, luz y desagues, pero no cuenta con  calles asfaltadas  ni veredas. La vivienda de Fernando tiene techo de calamina con piso de tierra.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte publico en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. El pertenece a una asociación de Mototaxistas que tiene un paradero ubicado en el frontis de una universidad y que recorre rutas dentro de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Fernando sale muy temprano para aprovechar las horas donde hay mayor afluencia de personas que van a sus centros de labores y regresa a su domicilio a las 8 pm aproximadamente despues de haber hecho su jornada diaria. Los ingresos que haya tenido en el dia le sirven para apoyar a su esposa en la alimentacion y gastos del hogar.

Actualmente Fernando se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de un nuevo motor para su unidad movil, ademas desea cambiar las llantas y brindarle mantenimiento en general, asi no tendra problemas con su unidad y podra brindar un buen servicio.

Fernando nos comenta que anteriormente deseaba adquirir una mototaxi pero tuvo que desistir porque estas unidades eran demasiado costosas para los ingresos que obtenia, actualmente sigue queriendo adquirir una nueva unidad movil, pero primero quiere que su unidad actual se encuentre en perfecto estado.
texts.en:
Fernando is 55 years old, and he is married. He lives with his wife and three children in Fernando Belaúnde, a new town in an urban area on the outskirts of the city of Chiclayo. The area is characterized by having inhabitants with few resources. They have water, electricity, and sewage services. But, they do not have asphalt streets or sidewalks. Fernando’s house has an aluminum roof and a dirt floor. He offers public transportation services in a “mototaxi” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle, which is used to transport cargo and passengers). He has been doing this for ten years. He belongs to an association for mototaxi drivers, which has a stop located in front of a university. He covers routes within the city of Chiclayo. Fernando leaves very early to take advantage of the hours when there are more people who are going to their work centers. He returns home at approximately 8:00 p.m. after having done his day’s work. The earnings he has for the day help his wife with the food and the household expenses. Fernando is currently asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan for 1,500 PEN to buy a new motor for his mototaxi. Also, he wants to change the tires and perform general maintenance. That way he will not have problems with his mototaxi, and he will be able to provide good service. Fernando tells us that earlier he wanted to get a mototaxi, but he had to give up because they were too expensive for his income. He still wants to get a new one, but first he wants the mototaxi he currently has to be in perfect condition.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance expenses for his mototaxi

loans.name: Femmes Commerèantes N°6 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement  Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) comme son nom l’indique est un réseau de femmes qui s’activent  dans le commerce.  Il est basé à Grand Thiès et il a été créé depuis 1992 par Madame Maty Niakh l’actuel président du réseau. Cette présidente a eu cette idée  à l’issue d’une formation qu’elle avait bénéficiée  de l’ONG OXFAM à Thiès. Elle connait, ainsi, bien la gestion de groupe, entreprenariat …etc.  Les membres du réseau sont extrêmement dévoués et se rencontrent une fois par mois. Ainsi, après des frais d’adhésion au groupement, chaque membre est tenu de cotiser mensuellement 200 FCFA pour une caisse de solidarité.
Souhaitant se financer, elles décidèrent  d’adhérer à  U-IMCEC. C’est ainsi que,  leur réseau se voit scinder en 19 sous groupes de 5 personnes  pour un meilleur profit des financements. Elles sollicitent pour une deuxième fois un prêt de 100 000 FCFA par membre,  soit 500 000 FCFA par sous groupe afin de développer leurs diverses activités.
Cependant, les règlements sont versés à la présidente assistée par la trésorière du groupe, Madame Coumba Seck, pendant leurs réunions mensuelles et ces deux se chargent à leur tour de rembourser U-IMCEC. Ce réseau qui, dit la présidente, n’a qu’un seul et noble objectif : combattre la pauvreté dans les ménages. Actuellement, le réseau compte 19 sous groupes avec chacun une présidente et une trésorière.
Pour  les Femmes Commerçantes N°6, elles sont dirigées par Madame Bousso D. âgée de 43 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui vend depuis 5 ans des légumes, arachide, poissons séchés, huile de palme. La trésorière est Madame Moussou C. vendeuse d’huile de palme et poissons séchés depuis 4 ans au marché Grand Thiès. Les autres membres sont composés de Madame Oumy G. qui vend du riz, mil et de l’huile, Madame Soda Lèye vendeuse de poissons frais et de Madame Coumba F.  qui vend des légumes
texts.en:
The group Femmes Commerçantes (F.C) as the name suggests is a network of women who are active in trade. It is based in Grand Thies and was created in 1992 by Maty Niakh, who is the current president of the network. The president had this idea after receving a training from the NGO Oxfam in Thies. She is also trained in group management, business administration, etc. Network members are extremely dedicated and meet once a month. Beside a membership fee to the group, each member is required to contribute monthly with 200 CFA to a solidarity fund. Wishing to finance themselves, they decided to join U-IMCEC. Thus, their network has splitted into 19 groups of 5 people each, for a better use of funding. They request a second loan of 100 000 FCFA per member, which is 500 000 FCFA per sub-group, to develop their various activities. However, the contributions are paid to the President, assisted by the Treasurer of the group, Ms. Seck Coumba during their monthly meetings and they are responsible to refund U-IMCEC. The network, accordng to the president, has only one noble goal: to fight family poverty. The network currently has 19 subgroups, each with a chairman and a treasurer. F.C. No. 6, is chaired by Mrs. Bousso D., who is 43 years of age and mother of 7 children; she has been selling vegetables, peanuts, dried fish and palm oil for five years . The Treasurer is Mrs. C. Moussou, who has been selling palm oil and dried fish for four years at the market place in Thies. The other members are Ms. Oumy G., who sells rice, millet and oil, Ms. Soda L., who sells fresh fish and Ms. Coumba F. who sells vegetables.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Pacencia

texts.en:
Pacencia D. C. is a 59-year-old married woman from Antipolo, Rizal. She and her husband feel blessed to have six children.  She is a member of the Dalig center of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal West Branch. Pacencia is a very industrious woman determined to achieve a better life.  Despite hardships caused by poverty, she remains strong and dedicated in her desire to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and support of her husband makes her life quite meaningful.

To earn a living, Pacencia buys and sells chickens. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2007. During the course of her membership, she has been noted as an excellent performer with respect to regular attendance at meetings, loan repayment and projects. She is now seeking her third loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional inventories of chickens.

Pacencia's dream is for her grandchildren to complete college.  Additionally, she hopes to continue her business as a sustainable livelihood to support her family. She also hopes to finish the building of their new house made of concrete.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventories of chickens

loans.name: Veronica Nurilaura

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pequeños Comerciantes es un buen grupo de socias que se reúnen en la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de la provincia de Manaba.

En este banco se encuentra la señora Verónica de 38 años de edad está comprometida el esposo es chofer,  tiene 3 hijos, su ocupación es ser comerciante de productos de belleza Avon, en la mañana se dedica a las tareas del hogar en las tardes es que tiene que salir a recorrer a sus clientes a diferentes lugares, también ha optado por realizar reuniones en su casa para que las clientas conozcan mas de los productos, entrega folletos y tarjeta de esa manera le ayuda a tener mas clientes, a nuestra socia le gusta mucho trabajar es un aporte económico para el hogar, también cuenta con la ayuda del esposo en el taxi que el conduce, si ella tiene que ir a visitar a alguna socia y vive lejos la  lleva el esposo, al principio estaba con duda si entraba al negocio o no pero fue una amiga quien la motivo y ahora está muy contenta las señora Verónica.

Con el nuevo crédito nuestra socia invertirá el total en los adquirir los productos ya tiene que entregar varios pedidos.
texts.en:
The Pequeños Comerciantes (Small Businesspeople) Community Bank is made up of a wonderful group of women who work together in the town of Portoviejo, the capital of Manaba Province. One of the members is 38-year old Verónica whose husband is a driver. They have three children. Verónica sells Avon beauty products. She spends the mornings doing household chores and then in the afternoons she goes out to visit her customers in different locations. She also invites customers into her home where they learn more about the products, and delivers flyers and business cards to help her gain more customers. Verónica really enjoys her work and is a great financial help for her family. Her husband also helps her. If she has to visit someone who lives a long way away, he drives her in his taxi. She wasn’t sure if the business was a good idea at the beginning, but a friend encouraged her to go ahead and now she is happy with the way it has turned out. Verónica plans to use all of this new loan to buy more products for which she already has orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy Avon beauty products

loans.name: Jessenia Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Jessenia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, pero también tiene junto a al esposo una lubricadora, el se encarga de administrar el negocio, 8 años trabaja en una empresa privada, invierte por semana todo, lubricante, liquido de freno,y repuestos para carros, en su casa tiene un pequeño local, cerca de ellos hay una mecánica eso le ayuda mucho para que en el negocio le vaya bien.

 Quiere incrementar su negoción con baterías y llantas, y en el futuro le gustaría tener el local mas amplio en el centro de la ciudad, en la casa de sus padres. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo,
y su esposo a la lubricadora, con el crédito quiere invertir en aceite para carros, liquido de frenos, en especial repuestos para carros, quieren surtir bien su negocio.

Tiene dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad. Y lleva casada 15 años.
texts.en:
Sra. Jessenia sells beauty products through catalogs, but she and her husband also own an oil change station where she is responsible for managing the business. They have owned their business for eight years. Every week they invest in lubricants, brake fluid, and spare parts for automobiles. They operate their small business out of their home, which is located near a mechanic, so this helps them to do well.

Jessenia wants to expand her business by offering batteries and tires. In the future, she would like to move to a larger location in the central part of the city at her parents’ house. With this loan, she will invest in motor oil, brake fluid, and custom automobile parts so that she can keep her business well-stocked. She and her husband have two children (ages 12 and 13) and have been married for 15 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motor oil, brake fluid, and custom automobile parts

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
O. A. Mary is thirty-five years old, is married, and is blessed with two children. She is also taking care of two dependents who live with her.

Oquaru Asibazuyo has operated a retail shop business for over seven years and is using the loan to purchase retail shop items such as sugar, tea, rice, beans, and so forth to sell.

Oquaru Asibazuyo’s dreams are for her business to expand and for her to become a successful woman in whatever she is doing.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, tea, rice, beans, and so forth for her shop

loans.name: David Mutua

texts.en:
David is a 25-year-old young man. He buys polythene papers and supplies them to the shops within the slum area. He has been in the business for a period of five years now.

He wants to use his loan to increase his stock of polythene for sale. He hopes to open a retail shop (kiosk) within the slum area.

loans.use: To buy more polythene papers to sell

loans.name: El Calvario Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Calvario lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora María Magdalena C. C. quien hace seis años inicio vendiendo gaseosas y chiverías negocio que con el tiempo y gracias a los préstamos mejoro hasta convertirla en una pequeña pulpería. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Vicenta Bertha P. Téllez desde hace 8 años se dedica a la realización y comercio de tortilla bastimento por excelencia de los  nicaragüenses y Ángela del Carmen Martínez tiene una pulpería desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
The group El Calvario is made up of three hard working women, brave and enterprising. The coordinator is Mrs. María Magdalena C. C., who started selling sodas and other products six years ago. With time and the help of the loans, she has improved her business and has converted it into a small general store. The other members of the group are Vicenta Bertha P. Téllez, who for the last 8 years has been making and selling tortillas, a Nicaraguan staple, and Ángela del Carmen Martínez, who for the last six years has had a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in basic grains, chiverias, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es:
Martha Luz Z. Valencia tiene 39 años y vive en el barrio Villa del Carmen, con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 15 años,  Municipio de Soledad en el Departamento del Atlántico. Tiene una miscelánea donde vende de todo un poco así usted puede comprar desde un lápiz hasta productos de bisutería, perfumes y detalles en general. Su negocio es de origen familiar surgió por su necesidad de hacer un aporte importante al sostenimiento de su hogar y para  poder solventar las necesidades de la comunidad, allí vende todo tipo de mercancías, especialmente  útiles escolares y papelería en general,  aprovechando la vecindad de su negocio con una zona escolar.

Este es sus segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde el primero notó un aumento en sus ventas y  también que le produjo un mayor margen de ganancias por las compras de contado que hizo con su crédito,  el que le   funcionó como un el capital de trabajo a bajo costo. Ahora con su credikiva va a surtir la miscelánea de lápices, plumeros, libretas, moños, blusas, pulseras, binchas, colonias, aretes y perfumes femeninos y masculinos.

Su sueño es que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria y que su negocio sea reconocido no solo en su barrio, sino en su localidad,  por eso justamente su mayor desafío es posicionarlo en el mercado, aprovechando que vive en un barrio donde la oferta de mercancía económica tiene una gran demanda y eso es justamente lo que ella comercializa desde su miscelánea.
texts.en:
Martha Luz Z.
