Valencia is 39 years old and lives in the Villa del Carmen neighborhood, within the Soledad Municipality in the Atlantic Department with her husband and her 3 children, between ages 10 and 15. She has a general store that sells a little bit of everything, from pencils to accessories, perfumes and other items. It's a family business that started because she needed to make important contributions toward supporting her household and also to fulfill her community's needs. While her shop sells all sorts of products, the most useful items are the school and general stationary supplies; taking advantage of the fact that her business is next to a school. This is her second credit with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Since her first credit, she has noticed an increase in sales and also a wider profit gap from being able to make her stock purchases in cash with her credit. It worked like a low cost work capital. Now, with her Kiva credit, she is going to stock her shop with pencils, pens, notebooks, overalls, blouses, bracelets, earrings, perfume and cologne. Her dream is for her children to earn a University degree and for her business to be known not only in her neighborhood but in the entire area. As such, her greatest challenge is to make a name for her business in the sector, taking advantage of the fact that she lives in a neighborhood where the availability of inexpensive merchandise is in high demand and this is exactly what she is commercializing off of with her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her general store with pencils, pens, notebooks, overalls, blouses, bracelets, cologne, earrings, and perfumes.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 50 años de edad, convive con su  pareja y tienen cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Villa Quintiarina, ubicada en la selva tropical peruana, donde tiene propia casa a base de madera. Víctor quería estudiar la carrera de agronomía, pero por motivos económicos no pudo concretizar su sueño. Solamente se aferró al único trabajo que tiene que es cultivar cacao, producto por el cual tiene mucha demanda además que recibe buenas rentas económicas. Por lo general la ayuda su pareja y sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha contrata peones para que faciliten la recolección de su cacao, que luego serán vendidos en los centros de acopio de su comunidad. Su plan a futuro es remodelar su casa a base de material noble, para que de esa manera se sientan cómoda su familia. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además confía en su grupo comunal, porque todos se ayudan entre si. Con el crédito que solicita, cumplirá con los pagos que tenia pendiente con sus peones.
texts.en:
Víctor is 50 years old, and he lives with his life partner. They have four children. They live in the Villa Quintiarina community, which is located in the Peruvian tropical forest. They have their own house there; it is made of wood. Víctor wanted to study for a degree in agriculture. For financial reasons he could not make his dream come true. He took up the only work that he has, which is cultivating cacao. There is great demand for this product, and he receives good income from it. His wife and children usually help him. However, during the season for harvesting he hires laborers to facilitate the gathering of his cacao. It will be sold later in the local collection centers. His plan for the future is to remodel his house with sturdy material. That way his family will be comfortable. This is his eighth loan with MFP. He pledges to continue making his payments on time. He trusts his communal bank because everyone helps each other. He will use the requested loan to make the outstanding payments to his laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay his laborers

loans.name: Laurent

texts.en:
Laurent is 32 years old and married with a one-year-old child.  His wife is a primary school teacher.

Laurent sells beans, Irish potatoes, plantains, peanut flour and onions in the local marketplace.  He has been selling these items for the past 5 years and believes the popularity of his business is due to his good customer care.  With the loan he plans to increase his inventory of foodstuffs.  His goal is to double his sales over the next year.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of foodstuffs

loans.name: Embes Yazmani

texts.es:
Embes de 29 años, vive en una zona periurbana con caminos de tierra llamada “Paraíso”. tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, con su esposa tiene dos hijas gemelas de tres años. 

Inicio con su tienda hace 6 meses atrás, para poder mantener a su familia. Con su esposa trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer.  Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector donde vive el tubo que poner unas rejas en su tienda para mayor seguridad. Vende arroz, bebidas, azúcar etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz bebidas, azúcar y otros víveres para mejorar su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su cas ay tener mejor surtida su tienda.
texts.en:
Embes, 29, lives in a periurban zone with unpaved streets called “Paraíso.” He has a small store in the front of his house. He and his wife have twin, three-year-old daughters. He started his store six months ago in order to support his family. He and his wife work every day from very early in the morning until nightfall. One of the difficulties he faces is the high crime rate in the area where he lives. He had to install metal grates on the store for better security. He sells rice, beverages, sugar, etc. He wil use the loan to buy rice, beverages, sugar and other foodstuffs to improve his store. In the future he wants to finish building his house and have his store better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, beverages and sugar.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok B., 30, is a garment factory worker in the Takeo province. She is married with one child, who is still living at home, and her husband works in construction. She typically makes about US$2 each day. Sok B. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase an old house for her husband to renew and then resell for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase an old house.

loans.name: Berclin

texts.fr:
Jeune monsieur de 35 ans,célibataire et pere d'un enfants dont l'âge est de 12ans ans,il debute son commerce en 1996 quand il perd son travail lors de la faillite de lusine ou il travaillait.En moyenne il vend environ 15000 a 35.000frs par jours

Pour pallier a cela et prendre en charge la vie de sa famille il se lance dans la quincaillerie .
Il a plusieurs strategies de vente, ses clients sont les entrepreneurs, les fonctionnaires qui sont entrain de construire des maisons.

Avec le prêt qu'il compte recevoir, il va renforcer en achetant des mélanger lavabo et beignoir, des colle gebajoint,des robinets, des floteurs bache à eau,des fusible.

A l'avenir il pense se lancer dans la vente en gros et avec ses economies , epargner beaucoup pour pouvoir ouvrir un grand magasin , voyager aller acheter de la marchandise au Cameroun, Nigeria et Dubai 
Tres serieux, il pense aussi a envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes ecoles pour leur formation.
texts.en:
This young 35 year old is unmarried and has a 12-year-old kid. He started his business in 1996 when the factory he worked at went under. He makes, on average, 15,000 to 35,000 francs in sales per day.
To alleviate his situation and to support his family, he started a hardware business. He has various sales strategies, and his customers include entrepreneurs and civil servants who are building houses.
With this loan, he will stock up on a mix of sink and bathtub parts, some Gebajoint glue, faucets, float valves and fuses.
In the future, he is thinking of going wholesale. With his savings, he plans on opening a big store, and going and getting his merchandise in Cameroun, Nigeria and Dubai. A serious man, he also plans to send his kid to a good school.

loans.use: Purchase of faucets, glue, float valves and fuses

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Susana tiene como actividad la venta y elaboración de pan y alfajores en la zona donde reside con esta actividad ayuda a su esposo en el mantenimiento de su hogar, el esposo es conductor asalariado, trabajando de es esta manera por varios años, en esta oportunidad al esposo sr. Félix, se le presento la oportunidad de adquirir un vehículo, ya que ellos tienen dinero ahorrado al  cual aumentaran el dinero solicitado en este crédito, para así de esta manera adquirir un vehículo con el cual podrá trabajar y de esta manera mejorar su economía, también así de esta manera poder transportar a su esposa en la venta del pan y así facilitar el trabajo de su esposa, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado .
texts.en:
Sra. Susana produces and sells bread and shortbread cookies in the area where she lives. This business enables her to help her husband with maintaining their household. Her husband, Sr. Felix, has been working as a salaried driver for several years. He has been presented with an opportunity to purchase a vehicle.

Susana and her husband have money saved up, but are requesting a loan so that they can increase their reserves. By acquiring this vehicle, her husband will be able to work and improve their financial situation. In addition, her husband can use the vehicle for selling bread, thereby creating work for him to do. Susana is very grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle for selling bread & providing work for her husband

loans.name: Aurora's Group

texts.en:
Aurora B. is from the village of Anquiray, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 45 years old. Aurora is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Aurora is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Aurora owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Aurora has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Aurora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. Aurora is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the product offering. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Aurora from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Sr. Luis es soletero vive con su madre y su abuela, se dedica a la confección de prenda, ya hace mas de 3 años que se dedica a este rubro, se inicio en este rubro con su tía , que tenia un taller de costura , pero con sus ahorros logro independizarse y abrió su taller propio.
 
 El  necesita de este crédito para la compra de mas telas ya que llega el verano y tiene muchos pedidos de prendas para esa temporada , ya que con lo que tiene no abasteces. 
En el futuro  desea tener una boutique.
texts.en: Luis is single and lives with his mother and grandmother. He works making clothes, and has done this for over 3 years. He began this business with his aunt, who had a dressmaking workshop, but with his savings he became independent and opened his own workshop. Luis needs this loan to purchase more fabric, as summer is ariving and he has many clothes orders for the season, and what he currently has won't cover the orders. In the future Luis wants to have a boutique.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is from the village of Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has one child. Janeth is a sari-sari (variety) store owner where she sells a variety of products. She has been engaged in her business for more than 2 years and earns approximately 1,000 pesos (PHP) a month..

In June 8, 2010, Janeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Janeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to provide additional working capital

loans.name: Baleke Baseke Women's Group-Mpigi

texts.en: A decade is the time 28 year old happy go lucky N. Annet has been operating her Pub and restaurant business in Mpigi Town. She got involved in this business with the influence of her sister. Before all this happened, Annet was pursuing her education. Annet, who belongs to Baleke Baseke Group, says weekly her business profits are to the tune of shillings 60,000. Annet is happily married with 1 child. She also does some goat rearing. With this loan, she says she is going to buy more crates of drinks for her Pub business.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks for her pub

loans.name: Michell Alexandra

texts.en:
Michell is a 19 year old entrepreneur. She lives with her parents in a house made of concrete in an area called “Suburbio” in the city of Guayaquil. The area is called suburbio because most of its inhabitants are small business owners. 

Michell likes sales and two years ago she started a small store of her own. Her mother attends to the customers in the mornings when Michell is at the university and Michell takes over in the afternoons. 

She tries to sell a variety of products: personal hygiene and milk products but also food like ham.  She plans to use her loan to buy more milk products and sodas. 

In the future she hopes to increase the variety of products offered at her store. She hopes to include clothing items as well. Her biggest fear is that she and her mom would both get sick and there would be no one to attend to the store. She hopes her parents will stay healthy.

loans.use: To buy milk products and sodas to sell

loans.name: Kitumbua

texts.en:
Kitumbua is a single woman with two children, both of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over fifteen years, she has operated a firewood business, selling from home to her neighbours and food kiosk (stall) operators. Kitumbua faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the rainy season it becomes hard to get enough firewood for resale. She hopes to buy charcoal and firewood for resale on  wholesale terms in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase 10 bags of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of firewood for resale

loans.name: Awali Mukama Group-Jinja

texts.en: Badru L., 47, the operator of a taxi transportation business in Jinja for 22 years, belongs to Awali Mukama group-Jinja.   Badru, a happily married man with four children, was formerly in a poultry business.  Earning a monthly income of 300,000 shillings, he will use this loan to buy new tyres and other spare parts for his taxi.

loans.use: The purchase of tyres and other spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita R. is from the village of Linangkayan, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 66 years old. Conchita is widowed and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods and coconut wine in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Rosa Luz

texts.es: Rosa Luz M. D. C., D. cincuenta y seis años D. edad, resiD. y tiene instalada una tienda y venta D. jugos en su casa desD. hace años en Santa Tecla, departamento D. La Libertad. Rosa vive junto a su esposo Don Guillermo que aún trabaja como motorista del transporte público del sector y tres hijos que se encuentran trabajando y que ya colaboran con los gastos que genera este hogar.  Rosa es una mujer realizada y feliz ya que gracias a los ingresos que obtiene D. su negocio ha podido colaborarle a su esposo para que sus hijos ya ahora sean personas insertadas en la vida productiva D. este país. Pero Rosa Luz no conforme con esto se siente llena D. vida y desea seguir siendo útil y por ello desea reinvertirle a su negocio, a través del crédito solicitado, para que productos con los que no cuenta como maquillajes, lociones, medicinas ahora los tenga para sus clientes
texts.en:
Rosa Luz M. D. C., age 56, resides in Santa Tecla in the Department of La Libertad. She has a store and juice shop in her home that she started several years ago. Her husband, Don Guillermo, works as a motorcycle driver in the public transportation sector. They have three children who are working and contributing to the household expenses. Rosa is an accomplished woman and feels happy with the income her business generates. She and her husband have worked together to raise their children, who are now productive citizens of El Salvador.

Rosa does not feel that she has reached her potential in life, so she wants to continue being useful and reinvesting in her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire products that she does not have in stock such as make-up, lotions, and medicines that her customers must have now.

loans.use: Purchase make-up, lotions, and medicines.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Erkingul's Group

texts.en:
Erkingul J., 45, is a leader of this group. As Kyrgyzstan is in the heart of the historically know Silk Road, the master of eastern trade techniques are still left in Kyrgyz blood. Erkingul is a resident of the town of Tup and has three children. Her oldest son is employed in neighboring Kazakhstan, while the other two children are busy with their studies. 

In 2006 Erkingul took a loan in a local bank and opened her own retail shop. The secret of her success is that she is very sensitive to customers’ tastes and expectations. She almost never has leftover goods. Her monthly profit has reached 10 000 soms. Erkingul applied for this loan because she needs to stock her retail shop with large amounts of goods such as beverages. In the future she hopes to increase the goods circulation to 200 000 soms and to assist her son in purchasing a house. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
P. Rano lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She is married and has five children. Rano is a hardworking woman who started a business selling fabrics. She has been in this business for 17 years. She purchases her goods from Korvon market in Dushanbe. Rano would like to get a loan of 5,000 somoni for purchasing new seasonal fabrics to increase her working capital. She thanks all lenders who support her and allow her to improve her standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, as it served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON’s History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is currently in a business of selling bread. She is 30 years old, married, with five children, all of whom go to school.  Elizabeth borrowed a loan to stock more bread to sell. She hopes to expand her business with extra profits in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bread to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 58 years old and married with four children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari or general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Julieta has borrowed and repaid 6 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Julieta aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Housein

texts.ar: حسين عمره 42 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع المحروقات ونقلها الى المحطات له في عمله 15 سنة هو طموح محب للعمل يعمل بجد ويريد ان يزيد من مدخوله وان يربي اولاده ويساعدهم في تخطي الظروف الاجتماعية الصعبة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء محروقات ومازوت وان يطور المحطة له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد ساهم في تحسين الظروف المادية للمصلحة له خبرة واسعة في عمله ويحلم بأن يمتلك محطة وقود كبيرة حتى يكون قد اساس لحياة اجتماعية سليمة
texts.en: Housein is a 42-year-old husband and father of three who is committed to helping his children advance in life. For the past 15 years, Housein has been transporting and selling fuel, a job which he has been very passionate about. Housein’s last loan from A. Majmoua went far in helping to improve his business, and he now wanted to seek another one to purchase more fuel and diesel oil and to further develop his gas station. Housein ultimately hopes to one day own a mega gas station.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and further develop his gas station.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Erlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & eggs. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks & breads. Erlinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & breads

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma forma parte del banco comunal “Los Luceros” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida rápida entre estos papas fritas, hot dog, churrascos y variedad de empanadas de carne y pollo. Diariamente vende 200 empanadas, 50 hot dog, un saco de papas fritas y 10 churrascos, además ofrece té y café. Norma arrienda un local y se dedica a éste negocio desde hace 4 años, ya que quedó cesante. Su horario laboral es de 11ºº a 23ºº horas, todos los días de la semana. 
Con el crédito comprará 50 sacos de papas, aceite, mostaza, mayonesa para su negocio. 
Sus metas son comprar un sitio para construir su local de comida rápida. Además anhela comprar una freidora de papas.
Norma vive junto a sus cuatro hijas de entre 27 y 21 años de edad, además de sus 6 nietos.  Una de ellas trabaja en su mismo negocio. 
Sus sueños a nivel personal son ayudar a sus hijas socioeconómicamente, hace poco tiempo una de sus hijas comenzó a estudiar y otra de sus hijas accedió a una casa propia.
Norma está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, ya que ha podido generar mayores ingresos en su negocio, que le han permitido concretar sus sueños. Además disfruta mucho de las reuniones, ya que aprende mucho y ha conocido buenas amistades. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Luceros” which is located in the city of Temuco. She prepares and sells fast food such as French fries, hot dogs, steaks, a variety of meat empanadas, and chicken. Every day she sells 200 empanadas, 50 hot dogs, a sack of French fries, and 10 steaks. She also offers tea and coffee. Norma rents her location and started her business four years ago after she lost her job. Her work schedule is from 11am to 11pm. She works every day of the week.

With this loan Norma will buy 50 sacks of potatoes, oil, mustard, and mayonnaise for her business. Her goals include buying a site on which she can build a shop for her fast food business. In addition, she wants to buy a deep fryer.

Norma lives with her four daughters who are between the ages of 21 and 27. She also has six grandchildren. One of her daughters works with her in her business. Her dreams on a personal level include helping her daughters financially. She supported one of her daughters for a short time as she began her studies and helped another daughter acquire a house of her own.

Norma is very pleased with and appreciates the support provided by Fondo Esperanza. She has been able to generate more income from her business, which has allowed her to fulfill her dreams. Norma also enjoys the meetings because she has learned much and has established good friendships.

Temuco is the capital of Araucanía region. This city is located 670 km to the south of Santiago, the Chilean capital. The surrounding areas have a series of lakeside resorts (such as Pucón and Villarrica) as well as striking plant and animal life found in the nature parks nearby. Half of the inhabitants of this region are Mapuche, an indigenous group that is native to Chile.

loans.use: to purchase 50 sacks of potatoes, oil, mustard, and mayonnaise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma, 42 years old, is married, with 1 child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines for 8 years. Emma requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase toothpaste, detergent, seasonings and other miscellaneous items to sell. Emma  would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, detergent, seasonings and other miscellaneous items to sell

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  He is 44 years old, married to Mirriam and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use this loan to buy a dairy cow to boost his farming income.

In the future, Antony hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ramiro Martín

texts.es:
El señor Ramiro tiene ya mas de diez años dedicándose a la elaboración y ventas de piñatas (figura artesanal).
Esta solicitando un préstamo le está haciendo falta mas materia prima para la elaboración y necesita comprar, carrizo, papel periódico, pagamentoo y papel de colores para decorar las piñatas, ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio ya que Don Ramiro y su esposo, trabaja elaborando las piñatas, y el ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en: Ramiro has been making piñatas (artisanal figures) to sell for over ten years now.  He is asking for a loan because he needs more raw materials to make them.  He needs to buy reeds, newspaper, glue and colored paper to decorate the piñatas but does not have the necessary money and he does not want to decapitalize the business.  He plans to repay the loan with part of the profits obtained from the business since Ramiro and his wife work making the piñatas and that’s their family’s source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Guido; el socio tiene 43 años de edad; y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, el socio trabaja en su taller de carpintería el socio es carpintero de profesión y el realiza bellos y finos muebles, el socio también puede trabajar en series y armar los diferentes muebles y de este modo vender por ejemplo carpetas a los diferentes colegios de su distrito, el socio requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de madera por pies para la realización de sus diversos trabajos. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera. 

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian" community bank, located in Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco.

His name is Guido and he is 43 years old. Giudo has two children, ages four and six. He owns a carpenter's workshop and makes beautiful, high-quality furniture. He also offers construction and assembly of furniture sets, so local schools often hire him to build classroom furniture. Guido needs a loan to purchase timber by the foot, for use in his workshop. 

Guido is grateful for the business support and is committed to timely payment of his loan installments.

loans.use: To invest in timber.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La señora Angelina tiene ya más de tres años dedicándose a la venta de artículos escolares. 
A su negocio le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía. Solicita su cooperación en este crédito que esta solicitando para invertir en comprar paquetes de cuadernos, lápices, plumas, carpetas, mochilas, hojas para las copiadoras y  biografías. 
Desea armar paquetes escolares para vender ya que cerca de su negocio esta un escuela y poder ofrecer a buen precio. 
Con este préstamo mejorar las ganancias e ingreso de su negocio, podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Teodoro se encargara de las gastos familiares con las ganancias que el obtiene de sus ventas de tacos en diferente partes de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Sra. Angelina has been selling school supplies for more than three years. Her business is lacking a variety of merchandise. She is seeking assistance with this loan so that she can invest in the purchase of packages of notebooks, pencils, pens, folders, backpacks, and sheets of paper for photocopying and writing reports.

Angelina wants to assemble school kits to sell since her business is located near a school. She will offer these kits at a good price.

With this loan, Angelina hopes to improve the revenues and profits of her business. This will enable her to improve the quality of life of her family. With the revenue she generates, she will be able to repay the loan. Her husband Sr. Teodoro will take charge of the family expenses with the income he generates selling tacos in different parts of the city.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, pens, folders, backpacks, and sheets of paper.

loans.name: Turibamwe Group

texts.fr:
Lazare est un commerçant âgé de 59ans qui habite  la localité de Nyamugari au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Il  fait le commerce de produits  alimentaires dans un restaurant depuis 7ans. Il faisait le commerce des produits alimentaires de boutique avant de commencer ce métier. Il a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 6e année des études primaires. Il est et père de 13 enfants ; le 1er ayant 36 ans et le dernier avec 5ans.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 100,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital en achetant une  plus grande quantité de produits alimentaires consommes dans le restaurant afin de  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« TURIBAMWE»
texts.en:
Lazare is 59 years old.  He is a merchant and lives in the town of Nyamugari in the center of the country, in the province of Gitega.  He has been selling food products to a restaurant for seven years.  He sold food products from a shop before beginning this type of work.  He attended school up to the 6th year of primary studies.  He is the father of 13 children; the oldest is 36 years old and the youngest is five.

The loan of 100,000 Burundi francs that he will get will allow him to increase his working capital by buying a larger quantity of food products to be used in the restaurant.  This will mean large profits for him.
He is a member of the community group « TURIBAMWE».

loans.use: to increase his working capital by buying a larger quantity of food products to be used in the restaurant in order to make large profits.

loans.name: Manfredy

texts.es:
Manfredy, es soltero vive con sus padres, él se dedica a comprar y vender ganado, y siembra granos básicos: frijoles y maíz, se dedica a dichas actividades desde hace dos años, todos los días trabaja, el día martes va al tiangue para comprar ganado y vender, los demás días se dedica a la agricultura. 
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ganado y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, y tener más fondos para seguir progresando y que sus ingresos sean mejores.
El sueño de Manfredy es seguir apoyando a sus padres, ya que ellos dependen económicamente de él, y ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Manfredy is single and lives with his parents. He buys and sells cattle as well as cultivates basic staples, such as beans and corn. Manfredy has engaged in these activities for two years and works every day. On Tuesdays he goes to the market to buy and sell cattle. He spends the rest of the week farming.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cattle and fertilizers for his crops. By having more funds available to him, Manfredy can continue progressing and improving his income. His dream is to continue supporting his parents who are financially dependent on him. He will also help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 49 años y 8 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 10 años.
Juana tiene una tienda de abarrotes en Apacucha y vende cochinilla y tara, empezó con un negocio pequeño y fue creciendo poco a poco, gracias a ello pudo educar a sus hijos, y construir su casa. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosa y cerveza para su tienda. Agradece mucho porque todo es gracias a las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal y a la responsabilidad que le enseñaron. Su meta es poder terminar de hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Tarpuy” communal bank.  She’s 49 years old and has 8 children.  She’s been a member of Finca Perú for the last 10 years.

Juana has a grocery store in Apacucha and she also sells cochineal and spiny holdback.  She started out with a small store and has gradually been growing.  Thanks to it she was able to educate her children and build her house.

She will use the requested loan to buy soft-drinks and beer for her store.  She is very grateful because everything is due to the training she’s gotten in her communal bank and the responsibility she was taught.  Her goal is to be able to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años, es casado y tiene 5 hijos, vive con su familia en Ambato en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador. Se describe como una persona amigable y le gusta confiar en las personas de su barrio.

José trabaja con su esposa e hijos en la crianza de borregos para posteriormente venderlos. Es el segundo crédito que le solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de crías de borrego para su crianza y cuando esten adultos para sacarlos a la venta; esta inversión le beneficia ya que crecerá su negocio y en un futuro podrá tener buenos ingresos para poder mantener a su familia.

Su sueño es poder convertirse en comerciante mayor de compra venta de animales.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old, married, and has five children. He lives with his family in Ambato, which is in the central mountains of Ecuador. He describes himself as a friendly person who likes trusting the people in his neighborhood.

José works with his wife and children raising sheep in order to sell them later. This is the second loan he has requested from FODEMI. The money will be invested in the purchase of lambs to raise. When the animals reach adult age, they can be sold. This investment will be a benefit because he will be able to grow his business and have more income in the future to support his family.

His dream is to become a wholesale animal merchant.

loans.use: to buy lambs.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 33-year-old single woman. She has worked as a tailor since 2001. She used to work as a kindergarten teacher, but she has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to improve her own business.

Her previous loan was very impressive since she didn't regret leaving her former school employers and was very proud of what she achieved. Zeinab is a hardworking woman. She has a very special reputation and is liked by most of her customers. 

Zeinab is requesting a loan for the second time from Al Majmoua in order to buy new textiles requested by her customers for the coming autumn and winter seasons.

Zeinab is proud of her business and hopes to expand it more in the future through buying extra tailoring machines and being capable of employing women to help in responding to all customer needs.

loans.use: to buy new requested textiles.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Lida has a bakeshop that sells breads, pastries & cakes. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries.
Lida is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Lida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads & pastries

loans.name: Erminio

texts.en:
Erminio is from the village of Isabela. He is 37 years old. He is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Erminio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. He has been engaged in this business for 12 years and earns about P 30,000 per harvest.

His previous loan was used to purchase seeds, seedlings, young crops and fertilizer. Erminio is requesting a new loan of P 40,000. In the future, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow on his farm.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 24 years old and single. She has a 2-year-old child.

Raquel sells accessories and school supplies to the people in her community. She has had this business for 5 years. Each month, Raquel earns 6000 PHP running her store.

Raquel has requested this loan to buy more items to sell. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Chekalini Central Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Chekalini Central Group in Western Kenya! Jane is the facilitator of the Chekalini Central group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Jane takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Jane had a very good maize yield harvesting 19 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jane was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Jane will educate her children and ensure food security for her family.
 
In 2012, the members of Chekalini Central group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Jane with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay the initial payments of his new motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is married and has 2 children.  She is 39 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.  She is a farmer and sells crops to earn a living.  Lilian has been doing this for 10 years. 

Lilian has requested a loan of PHP15,000 to purchase seedlings for raising crops.  She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Lilian hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings for raising crops

loans.name: Marliz Viviana

texts.es:
Marliz Viviana tiene 23 años es casada vive con el esposo y con la hija de 4 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicado en el Recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón ventanas, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Marliz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, frejol, alverja. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la agricultura comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, urea, líquidos. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los productos agrícolas sin ningún tipo de problemas y podrá ayudarle para el bienestar de la familia.

Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que la familia cuente con salud y siempre estar unidos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Marliz Viviana is 23 years old, married and lives with her husband and 4 year old daughter in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. 

The members of the Nuevo Amanecer (New Dawn) communal bank are located in the hamlet of San Luis de Zapotal that belongs to the canton of Ventanas. They work in farming, growing short-cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Marliz grows corn, beans, and peas, and the buying and selling of agricultural products takes place in Ventanas.

She is asking for an agricultural loan to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers. The support of the loan would help her buy, without any problems, the agricultural products which would be of help for the wellbeing of her family.

She faces challenges such as pests and diseases and weather changes. 

Her dream is that her family has health and always be together. In her free time she likes to listen to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizers

loans.name: Sadara

texts.en:
Sadara is a farmer and has been farming for five years. He is requesting a loan, which he will use to hire employees to help on his farm. He faces challenges of high price fluctuations and seasonal weather variations. 

Sadara's business goal is to expand his plantations and hire employees to expand his business. Sadara's family goal is to educate his children and build a permanent family house.

loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: Rosa Fanny

texts.es:
Rosa tiene una papelería desde hace aproximadamente 8 años, con la cual ha podido contribuir junto con su esposo a la generación de ingresos para su hogar. Rosa es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales todos se encuentran en época de estudios, por lo que les debe garantizar lo que requieren para llevar con normalidad sus estudios. Rosa inició su negocio con el ánimo de colaborar a su esposo en la generación de ingresos, pues el salario que le pagaban a su esposo no era suficiente para sostener todos los gastos de su hogar. Rosa actualmente tiene su papelería muy bien posicionada, lo que le ha garantizado tener muy buenas ventas. Debido a que la fotocopiadora de Rosa se encuentra en muy mal estado, Rosa busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una fotocopiadora con la cual pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio. 
Rosa espera que de esta manera sus ingresos mensuales no se vean afectados por la renovación de la fotocopiadora y de esta manera le pueda seguir garantizando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Rosa sueña con tener una gran papelería ubicada en un local propio y donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas.

loans.use: Compra de una fotocopiadora con la cual pueda ofrecer un mejor servicio.

loans.name: Domingo Gonzalo

texts.es: Domingo es un hombre emprendedor de 54 años de edad, acompañado, con dos hijos de 18 y 16 años, su negocio es un cafetín  desde hace 13 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 8 años, tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser muy responsable y cumplido. El crédito lo requiere para hacer mejoras en el cafetin como compra de zinc, bloques, hierro, alambre para amarre de hierro, estribos, cemento, arena, piedrin, etc.
texts.en: Domingo is an enterprising man of 54 years. He is in a relationship and has two children, who are 18 and 16 years old. His business is a snack bar, which he has had for 13 years. He has been a client of the institution for 8 years and through this time has proven to be very responsible and reliable. He needs the loan to make improvements to his snack bar, such as the purchase of zinc, cement blocks, rebar and wire, supports, cement, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to make improvements to his snack bar.

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 26 años de edad, estudió hasta 9ª grado, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la escuela, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos y al comercio de mariscos.

Moisés se dedica a la pesca artesanal, él conoce muy bien la actividad que realiza ya que desde pequeño ha ejercido dichas labores, esto lo aprendió de su  padre y amigos que fueron quienes lo indujeron a que conociera el negocio de comercio de marisco. 

Él necesita el crédito para comprar redes que utiliza para la pesca, ya que actualmente las que posee se encuentran bastante deterioradas y necesita mejorar su equipo de pesca para obtener mayores resultados y ganancias.

Sus sueños son que su familia viva en un lugar digno y que nunca les falte lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Moisés is 26 years old, and attended school until the 9th grade.  He is in a relationship, and has 3 children who are studying in school. His partner works in the domestic trade and also sells seafood.

Moisés works fishing traditionally, and he knows the job he performs very well, since he has been working at said trade from a young age.  He learned this work from his father and friends who led him to know about the seafood business.

He needs the loan in order to purchase fishing nets, since those he currently has are fairly deteriorated, and he needs to improve his fishing equipment to obtain greater success and income.

His dreams are for his family to live in a suitable place and never lack life's necessities.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, because the ones he has currently are deteriorating, and he needs to improve his fishing equipment to obtain greater success and income

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Vilma has a computer shop business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and additional unit of computer for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and additional unit of computer for her business

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela G. who was born in Chimborazo, Ecuador is a 45 year-old married entrepreneur. She runs a small vegetable market that she and her husband rent in the busy district. Manuela has been the owner of this particular business for 4 years, but she thanks her parents and husband for teaching her how to run such a business. Their advice about where to find the best products for the lowest price, as well as how to display her vegetables has been valuable. Ms. G. works from 6 a.m. until 5 p.m. She is asking for a $465 loan to purchase more vegetables in cash, allowing her to get wholesale discounts. Manuela wants lenders to know that she is a hard-working and industrious woman who wants her business to succeed.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables in cash from local suppliers

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena lives in the area of San Juanito Chihuahua and is a mother of three sons all of a young age. Her current husband work in EUA and is a mechanic. A few years ago she began a clothing sales store, because her ex husband took her children away, arguing that she did not have the funds to support her children. This led her to work very hard day after day in order to be able to reclaim her sons. Today, they are living with her again, thanks to the work she developed. Her business also allowed her to settle home expenditures. She has proven herself to be a very strong entrepreneur.

At this time Lorena is requesting a loan of $975 in order to buy more merchandise and expand the sales of her business. She and her family need your generosity, the decision is in your hands. She and her family would always be thankful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena vive en la localidad de San Juanito Chihuahua es madre de tres hijos aún menores de edad, su actual esposo trabaja en EUA en un taller mecánico. Ella hace algunos años comenzó con un negocio de venta de ropa, pues su ex esposo se llevo a sus hijos argumentando que ella no tenía ingresos para sostenerlos. Esto la impulsó a luchar y trabajar arduamente día a día para poder recuperar a sus hijos. Ahora están con ella de nuevo, gracias a la actividad que ella desarrolla y también ha podido a su actual pareja a solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy emprendedora y fuerte.

Actualmente Lorena requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de 975 dlls para poder comprar más mercancía y aumentar las ventas de su negocio. Ella y su familia necesitan de tu generosidad, la decisión esta en tus manos. Ella y su familia te lo van a agradecer siempre.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Tania

texts.en:
Tania has a small caber cafe in the outskirts of Guayaquil, Ecuador. Hhe was able to start the businesss with the help of her parents. Tania and her sister mostly provide word processing services along with copies. There are not many businesses like this in the poor sectors of the city, but slowly the people are coming around to use them.

She hopes that she can take out a loan because she wants to improve on the physical appearance of the business. Right now, there is not a clear division between the cyber café and her parent’s home. She wants to build a wall and put in a door to establish the presence of her business.

loans.use: Make the space in her home more adequate for her word processing business.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali K. is 27 years old and married with two children. Before migrating to the Makeni town of Sierra Leone, Ali was a susbistence farmer in a remote Sierra Leonean village. After two years of farming, he managed to save $100 which he invested in his current second-hand clothing business.

With previous loans from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), Ali has been able to generate greater income to help pay for his family's expenses. He is requesting an additional loan to expand his business. Ali says that customers are attracted to well-stocked shops and that an increased inventory will allow him to earn a good income from the increased sales he will make.

loans.use: Increase inventory of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Yeabu T. was born in Mangoro village near Magburaka in the northern part of Sierra Leone. She is forty-five years old and married with four children. She owns a store on the outskirts of the town where she sells palm oil.

Yeabu's husband rents a motorbike to provide services for passengers and shares the profit with the motorbike owner. His income is insufficient to support their family. Her previous loan allowed Yeabu to help take care of her family, especially paying school fees and medical bills.

Yeabu would like to expand her business to generate more income so that she and her husband can purchase a motorbike to use for their family business. This loan of $175 will go to purchase 50 more gallons of palm oil and with time will enable Yeabu to earn a good profit .

loans.use: Purchase additional palm oil to sell in her shop

loans.name: Maua

texts.en: Maua T. is a 38-year-old mother of 4 kids and she is doing the best she can to help her children and the family. Maua has a plantation business, and she is glad to have the financial support from S.P.B.D. through the loans she gets. Her husband supports her in the difficult job of maintaining their plantation. Maua is looking forward to her next loan from S.P.B.D., which she plans to use to expand her plantation so that she can sell more taros, which will give her money for her loan repayments and family needs.

loans.use: To buy a wheel barrow, weed spray, and weed-killing chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Naiden

texts.en: Naiden K. lives with his wife and their three kids in the village of Rogozeno near Vratza. Until the last year, Naiden worked as a builder in the capital city, but now he has decided to start a farming business. Naiden has money for one cow and is applying for a loan to buy another. Naiden’s wife is unemployed and takes care of the kids. The loan amount is $775.

loans.use: To buy another cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add his business stock.

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en:
Ayo A. is 36 years old, married and has 5 children. She comes from Iba Area of Lagos State Nigeria. She's a fashion designer and also, sells ready made clothes.

Ayo A. has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $875 to buy more clothes and tailoring materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes and tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Angela K.. She is married with three children, aged 9, 13, and 15.

In 2006 Angela established a poultry business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase additional chicks to raise and sell. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. ("Kuku" means "chickens" in Swahili.)

Angela thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma V. D. C. is a talented seamstress and business woman in the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. Vilma started her business making custom shirts, pants, pillow covers, sofa covers, bathing suits, and underwear 18 years ago, after taking a sewing class at a local technical school. Over the years she has acquired many loyal customers and created a healthy business.

Vilma is 51 years old with four children and happily married. She loves her business and what it has done for her. Before she had low self confidence and was bored. Now she has many friends and was able to help send her children to school.

A member of the community bank Siete Estrellas, Vilma is requesting a loan of s/1500 (US$ 550) to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to buy new fabrics, threads, and elastic. Her dream is to one day have a small factory and employees.

loans.use: buy new fabrics, threads, and elastic

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas S. is single and has no children. She is a hairdresser and is focused on expanding her business.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more hairdressing materials. This will allow her to improve the conditions of her service and attract more clients.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more hairdressing materials.

loans.name: Aiša

texts.en: Aiša was born in 1961. She is a widow. She sells curtains and material for sewing at the market. She has two children, a son who works and one daughter who attends secondary school. This is her first loan at the MCO . Aiša intends to invest this loan in purchasing additional textiles for selling in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To purchase additional textiles.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Rosine L. was born on January 1, 1980 in Ghana. Married to Pierre DOSSOUGOUIN, a welder by profession, she is the mother of two children, who are both in school, in the 6th grade and in kindergarten, respectively. Trained as a master hairdresser, Ms. Rosine L. used to practice her trade in a shop in Xwlacodji behind the public primary school in that area, and she used to market cosmetics there, too. But with the rarity of customers, she dedicated herself much more to selling these cosmetic products and moved towards the downtown, in the Sikècodji district, while still marketing cosmetics. To do so, she came to apply for an initial loan of 30,000 francs CFA enabling her to stock enough supplies. It was a very profitable experience because her capital accrued and the demand grew, such that she lacked, due to means, the merchandise to meet the demand. The profit that she earns from this business enables her to support her family. One loan after another, since the demand is ever-growing, she is presently requesting her fifth loan in the amount of 180,000 francs CFA in order to achieve these objectives.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

L. Rosine est née le 1er janvier 1980 au GHANA. Mariée à DOSSOUGOUIN Pierre, soudeur de profession, elle est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés respectivement en classe de 6ème et à la maternelle. Maîtresse coiffeuse de formation, dame L. Rosine exerçait dans son atelier à Xwlacodji derrière l’école primaire publique de ladite zone et y commercialisait aussi des produits cosmétiques. Mais avec la rareté de la clientèle, elle se consacrait beaucoup plus à la vente de ces produits et déménagea vers le centre ville au quartier Sikècodji menant toujours la vente des produits cosmétiques. Pour ce faire, elle vint contracter un premier prêt de 30.000fcfa qui lui permis de s’approvisionner suffisamment. L’expérience fut très profitable car son capital s’est accru et la demande grandissante à tel point qu’elle manquait, faute de moyens, de produits pour leur satisfaction. Les bénéfices qu’elle tire de cette activité, lui permettent d’apporter un appui à la famille. De prêt en prêt, puisque la demande ne cesse d’accroître, elle sollicite actuellement pour son 5ème prêt un montant de 180.000fcfa afin d’atteindre ces objectifs.

loans.use: To buy 10 dozen hair extensions and 3 boxes of beauty products

loans.name: Livestock Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vui Thi C. is 43 years old. She is the senior member of the group. Her group has completed a good first funding round. In this second round, She is requesting 4,256,000 VND to invest in a breeding pig.

Her group includes:

  • Mrs. Xuan Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy cattle.
  • Mrs. Gia Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy feed for pigs and chicken.
  • Mrs. Bich Duyen Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy breeding pigs.
  • Mrs. Tam Thi N., requesting 4,256,000 VND to buy pig feed.

    Translated from Vietnamese by Chi N., Kiva volunteer.

    Cô C. Thị Vui (MS: 09050022), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô là người trưởng nhóm rất nhiệt tình. Cả nhóm cô đã hoàn thành rất tốt C. kỳ một. Lần này tham gia C. kỳ hai, cô vay 4.256.000 VND để lấy vốn mua lợn giống.

    Trong nhóm cô còn có

  • Chị Ngô Thị Xuân (MS: 09050026), vay 4.256.000 VND để mua bò.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Giá (MS: 09050024), vay 4.256.000 VND mua cám cho lợn, gà.
  • Chị Nguyễn Thị Bích Duyên (MS: 09050025), vay 4.256.000 VND để mua giống lợn
  • Chị Ngô Thị Tám (MS: 09050028), vay 4.256.000 VND mua cám lợn.

loans.use: Buying livestock and feed

loans.name: Eleunida

texts.es:
Eleunida is a member of the Lord of the Miracles Community Bank and lives in San Martín, Peru. She has a firewood business and depending on the season she also sells aguaje, a local fruit. She has been running her business for over a year out of her home. She considers keeping her customers satisfied to be of upmost importance and has work hard to do so ever since she started her business. With the $350 loan she is requesting, which she plans to repay within four months, she will purchase more firewood to keep in storage and thus be able to satisfy the demands of her customers who live in her neighborhood and community.

Eleunida is 38 years old, married and has a daughter who helps her with the customer service side of her business and household chores. She feels very proud of what she has achieved because it is the fruit of much effort and constant dedication. Her dream is to have store where she sells food.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Eleunida es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de los Milagros II” , vive en la Región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales, tiene un negocio de venta de leña y de acuerdo a la temporada también vende aguaje, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa ubicado en el Jr: ayacucho No 285 - morales, ya lleva en este negocio mas de 1 año, considera que mantener al cliente satisfecho es lo primordial, para que se venga manteniendo durante tanto tiempo en este tipo de negocio. Con éste crédito de S/. 1000.00, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará mas leña para que tenga en almacén y poder satisfacer así las necesidades de sus clientes que viven en su barrio y la comunidad. Eleunida tiene 38 años, esta casada y tiene 1 hija mujer quien le apoya en la atención al publico en el negocio y las tareas domesticas de la casa, se siente muy orgullosa de lo que ha logrado ya que es fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación constante, desea tener un local para que venda comida.

loans.use: Purchase firewood at wholesale / Compra de leña al por mayor.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Khekh Niakk  qui signifie lutter contre la pauvreté en wolof  est un groupe de quatre personne qui s'active communément dans le commerce de tissus. ce pret Contribue au renforcement de leur capital pour satisfaire la demande de clientèle dans les préparatifs des fetes de korité et tabaski.
texts.en:
Khekh Niakk which means struggle against poverty in Wolof is a group of four people who are working together in the field of selling cloth. This loan will contribute to bolstering their capital so as to satisfy the demand of their clientele as people prepare for the holidays of "korité" and "tabaski" (Muslim Feast of the Sacrifice).

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: dyeing

loans.name: Jessica Jackelin

texts.es:
La  señora Jessica Jackelin es la fiscal del Banco Comunal Las Auroras en Acción, tiene 31 años de edad y vive en Aurora Díaz manzana 2 lote 5 del pueblo joven Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Estudió hasta el cuarto año de educación secundaria, pero se embarazó de su pareja, el señor Ernesto Zelada Linares, con quien tienen 2 hijas de 14 y 7 años.
Jessica empezó su negocio asociándose con su madre e incrementando el negocio que ya tenían, antes tenia la cuarta parte del negocio y actualmente tiene el 50% del mismo. Se encuentra ubicado en su casa.
Recuerda que con el primer préstamo que fue de 300 soles el cual devolvió en 4 cuotas, compró tarjetas telefónicas y ropa interior.
Con este crédito de 1,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, implementará su negocio con cerveza y otros artículos de primera necesidad.
Jessica nos cuenta que sueña con tener su propia movilidad para poder ir y venir de Trujillo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jessica Jackelin is the public attorney of Las Auroras en Acción Community Bank. She is 31 years old and lives in Aurora Díaz, Block 2, Lot 5, of the town of Joven Aurora Díaz, Salaverry, Trujillo, in La Libertad. She studied until the fourth year of secondary school. She and her husband, Mr. Ernesto Zelada Linares, were pregnant. They have two daughters, who are fourteen and seven years old. Jessica started her business with her mother and grew the business that they have. Earlier, she owned 25% of the business, and, at present she owns 50% of the business. It is located in her home. Her first loan of 300 soles was repaid in 4 installments. With this, she bought calling cards and undergarments. With this loan of 1000 soles, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will supply her business with beer and other necessary goods. Jessica is counting on us to help her achieve her dream of having her own vehicle so that she can go to and come from Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and other necessary goods

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan O. is a 50-year-old mother of four children in Doem Romdeng village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Mam, is a construction worker. Three of their children are employed in a garment factory and the youngest attends the local school. Mrs. Phan O. is a farmer and owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Because her field is infertile and infested with pests, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow and to make her field more productive.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides and hire a laborer.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is 48 years old and is married to a local businessman. They have four children, one in school and the other three in college. Rosemary and her husband also support one of their grandchildren.

Rosemary owns a hardware store in Rongo, Kenya where she sells cement, paint, nails, and iron sheets, among other items. Rosemary has been running the business since 2002, and is now applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Schillings in order to increase her stock.

loans.use: Purchasing cement, paint, and iron sheets

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Marko Jara Group

texts.en:
The women of the "Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara" are requesting a loan of 7,900 Nuevo Soles to fund their various endeavours. The Triunfadoras (or “The Triumphant”) formed as a communal bank less than one year ago. Because they are a new group, their loan amounts are small, varying between three and eight hundred Nuevo Soles. They meet monthly in one bank member’s home on Pomorrosa Street in a suburb of Pucallpa, Peru. The city is a bustling regional capital and major transportation hub of the Amazon River basin area in eastern Peru. The construction of the highway fifty years ago, linking Pucallpa to Lima, marked the beginning of a new epoch for the booming capital. No other city in the jungle is connected to the country’s capital by a paved road; for this reason, all major shipping throughout the Amazon Basin to Lima passes through Pucallpa.

The women of this communal bank all work in and around Pucallpa, operating small businesses from corner stores out of their homes to stalls in local markets. The majority of the women in the "Las Triunfadoras de Marko Jara" bank sell some sort of product for a living. The Triunfadoras are requesting loans of individual amounts, but they collectively guarantee the repayment of the entire bulk loan. The bank members will be using the loan to fund a variety of endeavors including: sales of vegetables, shoes, candy, bananas, furniture, and bottled drinks. Each woman will repay her portion of the bulk loan within the same four-month term.

The bank members requesting a group loan are: Milena Liliana G. F. (s/.500), Danitza Ivette M. T.(s/.500) , Ines Magaly G. F. (s/.800), Rosa O. P. (s/.800), Graciela P. R. (s/.800), Teresa D. Pilar M. S. (s/.800), Ada Luz H. D.(s/.500), Corina T. V.(s/.500), Elena L. L.(s/.500), Janeth Savely F. I.(s/.500), Zoila S. L. (s/.500), Enith C. E.(s/.300), Milka Liceth D. A. D.(s/.300), Pilar D. R.(s/.300), and Elizabeth L. U.(s/.300).

loans.use: finance a variety of business endeavours including sale of vegetables, potatoes, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Lilian Kizza ‘S Group

texts.en:
Lillian is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 29-year-old married woman with 3 children aged between 4 and 10 years. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She rents a two-roomed house where she lives with six people. They have electricity and no piped water at home The family gets three meals a day.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works in Ntinda market selling matooke (bananas). Lillian works seven days a week and doesn’t incur any additional transport costs because she buys her goods from her place of work. Lillian sells to an average of 25 customers a day and sells to all categories of people. Lillian has been in this business for the five years and has in MCDT for six years, servicing her twelfth loan. Lillian's monthly expenses include rent for accommodation and also daily market dues She wants to buy more bananas and aspires to sell only at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Talaleu

texts.en: Talaleu T., 43, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in a plantation business. Her husband does all the farming. She sells to the public 1 day per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (approximately $145 USD). She has no previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Talaleu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of the loan will be used for her business.

loans.use: To maintain business needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more switches, sockets and electric wires

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia T. is forty-one years old. She is married and has five children, three daughters and two sons. All of her children are still in school. Some are in the senior high school and the junior high school. Others are in the basic schools.

She trades to make some income to support her husband financially. Olivia sells building and construction wares such as shovels, machetes, paints, and cements, in a store in her community. Her shop is located at the market square. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy more goods to stock her shop. Olivia hopes to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy hardware to sell.

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is 46 years old and she is married with no children. She sells crates of drinks and bottles of wine. Her hope is someday to own and operate a big supermarket.

She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000, which she plans to use to purchase more crates of drinks and bottles of wine to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks and bottles of wine to sell.

loans.name: Amadou Souleye

texts.fr: mr N. est né en 1963 à THIES .IL est travailleur municipal depuis sept ans ;il s'est marié récemment et sa femme doit rejoindre le domicile conjugal .C'est dans le but d'équiper sa chambre qu'il sollicite ce pret pour acheter un lit et une armoire .
texts.en:
Mr. N. was born in 1963 in THIES. He has been a municipal worker for seven years. He got married recently, and his wife must join the marital home. With the goal of fixing up his bedroom, he's requesting this loan to buy a bed and an armoire.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an armoire and a bed

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in Battambang Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Soeurn C., age 43, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. 

C. has been selling fruit in the local market for more than four years and earns approximately $3.50 per day. She is married to Bora, 44, who is a construction worker. She is a good mother who has given birth to six children: five are single and one is married and lives separately. 

C. saw that her neighbor's investment selling fresh fish is a profitable one. She hopes to enter this business but she lacks capital, so she would like a loan to use as capital to buy fish to sell. 

The other three borrowers are:
V. provides small loans with specific repayment schedules to the neighborhood. She applies for a loan to use as capital in her business operations.

S. will use the loan to increase her business selling bread.

S. sells Khmer noodles. She requests a loan to begin a new investment as a used clothes seller.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Nadim

texts.en: Nadim is 25 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hebron, Palestine. He runs a small grocery store selling food. His store is well known in the neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours. Currently he is seeking a loan of $2,000 to to buy more foodstuffs in order to improve his business. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory to increase the variety of goods he offers

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila E. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 49 years old. Mila is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (about US $125) a month for these activities.

In 2000, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
