Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 pesos from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mila is requesting a new loan of 15,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Mila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila B. is from the village of Tagpangi, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 27 years old. Sheila is single and has one infant child. To make a living, Sheila owns & operates a specialized retail business selling firewood in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Sheila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Sheila is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Sheila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Tagpangi, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth E. is a 31-year-old mother of Loue Mar, 2 years old, and 1-year-old Ma. Lorraine. She is a wife to Loue and an entrepreneur to many of her customers. Maribeth enjoys every single day of her life playing different roles being a woman. At the age of 27, she became a member of ASHI. She made a loan, and she found herself running a business she enjoyed the most, buying and selling fish. Five years ago, Maribeth was still in the process of discovering the secret towards business success. As she goes along with her discovery, loans she made in ASHI have helped her. Eventually she found what she was looking for - happiness being the owner and manager of her own business. She has grown and produced another kind of business out of her profit- a variety store. 

From a PHP5,000 loan she made when she first joined ASHI, now she makes a PHP24,000 loan to be used to finance her fish business and her variety store. She plans to add shrimp, prawn, and crab to the items she sells. 

Someday, Maribeth wants all of her children to finish college and have their own career. She would be very happy to see them enjoying a life that is not under the umbrella of poverty.

loans.use: To buy a variety of seafood to sell and to finance her variety store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris es una persona trabajadora y jovial, ella  tiene 30 años de edad y es madre de tres niños, ella se dedica a la costura (lencería) para ello cuenta con una máquina de coser y una remalladota.  Su esposo se dedica a la venta de madera. 
Forma parte del Banco Comunal “ Las  Heroínas” desde hace un año. Doris empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1800 soles, ella  invertirá parte de este dinero en la compra de telas, hilos, elástico, y la otra parte invertirá en el mantenimiento de su motocarro. 
La meta de Doris es tener su propio taller de costura y también tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Doris is a hard worker and cheerful person. She is 30 years old and a mother of 3 children. She is a seamstress (linen goods) for which she uses a sewing machine and an industrial sewing machine. Her husband sells lumber.

Since a year ago, she is part of the Communal Bank “The Heroines.” Doris started with a loan of 300 soles. With this loan of S/.1800 soles, she will invest part of the money to buy fabrics, threads, and elastic; the other part she will invest in the maintenance of her motorcycle taxi.

Doris’ goals are to have her own sewing shop and have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics, threads, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es socia del Banco Comunal Lila.
Norma es soltera, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Norma vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en un triciclo, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Norma se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos y gallinas.
Norma necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas y alimentos para los animales.
Los sueños de Norma son construir su casa y ahorrar mas.
texts.en:
Norma is a member of Lila Community Bank. She is a 34-year-old single mother of two children. She sells fruits outdoors from her tricycle, an activity she carries out every day. Furthermore, Norma also makes a living raising livestock such as pigs and hens. She is requesting a loan of 1400 soles (approximately $500), which she plans to invest in the purchase of fruits and feed for her animals. Norma's dreams are to build her own home and to save more.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit as well as feed for her livestock

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret sells second-hand clothes to make a living in her community in Sapele, Delta state, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of 70,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. 

She is 52 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
EL señor Francisco S. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos menores de edad que les quiere dar lo mejor. 
Tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su vivienda por medio del crédito gubernamental, pero le esta haciendo falta algunos detalles, pero para el lo mas la barda alrededor de la casa ya que es una seguridad para su familia. 
Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su empleo en una fábrica en el departamento de fabricación.Ya ha tenido un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco S. is the father of three dependent children for whom he desires to provide the best.

His home is lacking a few details, but the most important element that is missing is a security wall around his house in order to provide protection for his family. Francisco does not have the time to apply for assistance from the government.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to pay for the materials and labor for someone to make this improvement. He plans to repay the loan from his earnings as an employee at a manufacturing plant. Francisco has one previous loan with FVP that was repaid on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a security wall

loans.name: Ester

texts.es:
la señora Ester R. esta es casada,  tiene 57 años de edad, tiene una hija a su cargo que estudia su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada. 
ella tiene un negocio de pulperia desde hace unos tres años, el cual le a ayudado a salir adelante y a cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar.
ella asiste a la iglesia catolica es muy religiosa. 
su mayor sueño es que su hija la menor se gradue de la universidad
esta es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
57-year old señora Ester R. is married and has one daughter at home. Her daughter is a student and her husband works for a private company. Ester has run a general store for the last three years. It has enabled her to get on in life and to pay for some of her household expenses. She attends church and is very religious. Ester’s biggest dream is to see her youngest daughter graduate from university. She is the family’s sole provider of income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food items for her store such as beans, rice, sugar, tortillas

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana María L. C. es socia del Banco Comunal Picoaza.  Este  banco está conformado por mujeres  de todas las edades.  Picoaza es un pueblito ubicado a diez  minutos al norte de Portoviejo en la provincia de Manabí en la costa de Ecuador, ésta  provincia es  muy  conocida por su gastronomía, las playas y los ceibos (arboles únicos de la región) y ésta localidad no podía ser la excepción pues es un lugar muy comercial, aquí  encontramos muchos  distribuidores de productos agrícolas,  consumo, ropa, etc.

El esposo de  Ana María es conductor de un autobús en Portoviejo, ellos  viven con su  hijo y  un nieto llamado  Wilmer.  Nuestra socia  tiene un pequeño local donde donde funciona una tienda de abarrotes y también prepara comida que vende a sus vecinos y otros comensales del sector, nos indica que empezó este negocio para  ayudar a su familia en estos tiempos difíciles.


Ana María le gusta trabajar con la Fundación ESPOIR por los  beneficios  que ofrece a comparación de sus competidores, manifiesta que la educación  que reciben todas las socias les permite  conocer más sobre  planificación familiar y finanzas  para saber cómo  invertir su dinero. El crédito obtenido va a invertir en su tienda comprando arroz, azúcar, sal, pan y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana María L. C. is a member of the Picoaza Communal Bank. This communal bank is made up of women of all ages. Picoaza is a small town located ten minutes north of Portoviejo, in the province of Manabi on the coast of Ecuador. This province is well know for its cuisine, its beaches, and ceibo trees (trees unique to this region). This area is not an exception though, and is very commercial: here there are a lot of distributors of agricultural products, consumer goods, clothing, etc. Ana María's husband is a bus driver in Portoviejo. The couple lives with their son and their grandson Wilmer. Our member has a small store where she sells groceries and also prepares food to sell to neighbors and other people from the area. She tells us she started this business to help her family during these difficult times. Ana María likes to work with Fundación ESPOIR because of the benefits it offers compared to its competitors. She says the education that all the members receive teaches them more about family planning and finance, and how to invest their money. The funds from this loan will be invested in the business through the purchase of rice, sugar, salt, bread, and other basic products.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, salt, bread, and other basic products for retail sale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is thirty years old. He is married and has four children. All of his children are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Axim in the western region of Ghana. Emmanuel works hard to be able to provide for the family. He trades in second-hand clothes for men. He sells in his community and also treks to nearby communities to sell. Emmanuel has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario L., 51 years old, started tilling her farm in 1990. Her primary crop is rice, but she also plants vegetables in her farm. She really enjoys farming. She tells us that her life is really in the farm that she tills, and she is happy when it succeeds and she harvests the grains. Currently, she is busy preparing the soil to get ready for planting rice seedlings.

She will need additional capital in order to ensure the success of her business. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc., which she will use to buy all the farm supplies she needs to grow her crop. This loan will really help in ensuring that Rosario will experience a quality harvest.

loans.use: Essential farming supplies

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo de  43 años ,  es conviviente tiene 3 hijos dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y el ultimo tiene 10 años, el cuenta con casa propia de material noble compartida con una de sus hermanas, casa herencia de sus padres, su conyugue cuenta con el ingreso de un negocio reciente de cabinas de internet en su mismo domicilio, El Sr. hugo se dedica como maestro de construccion hace 15 años,se inicio como ayudante desde muy joven,  el Sr. hugo tiene muchos sueños y metas uno de ellos es poder tener su maquinaria completa, con el dinero que solicita invertira en mas maderas.
texts.en:
Hugo, 43, is in a common law marriage and has three children. Two of the children are grown, and one is ten years old. He has his own house made from sturdy material. He shares the house with one of his sisters; the house is an inheritance from his parents. His life partner has income from a recent business, an internet café in their home. Hugo has been a construction foreman for 15 years. He started as a helper when he was very young. Hugo has a lot of dreams and goals. One of those is to be able to have all of his machinery. He will use the money he is requesting to buy more lumber.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lumber

loans.name: Ruth Constanza

texts.es:
Ruth es socia del Banco Comunal Hormigas.
Ruth es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Ruth vende ropa a pedido, sus ventas los realiza a amigos y familiares al crédito, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Ruth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos, pantalones.
Los sueños de Ruth son aumentar su mercadería y educar a su ultimo hijo.
texts.en:
Ruth is a member of the Hormigas (“Ants”) Communal Bank. Ruth is 49 years old, married, and has 3 children. Ruth sells clothing by special order. She works every day selling her products to friends and relatives. Ruth needs a loan of 2000 soles, and will use the money to invest in the purchase of jackets and pants. Ruth’s dream is to increase her merchandise and to educate her youngest child.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing jackets and pants

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
Beatriz M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 50 anos de idade, casada mae de 4 filhos de 27, 23, 21, e 07 anos de idade, o mais novo vai a escola. Fez somente 4ą classe, nao continuou por falta de condições financeiras pelos progenitores. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Boane, nasceu no bairo Km 16 e construiu a sua residencia onde vive com a sua familia ate hoje. Tem um negocio proprio há mais de 09 anos, trabalha das 8h as 17horas no mercado local, vende mais arroz, açucar, velas, temperos etc e nao possui nenhum empregado. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas familiares e ainda poupa algum atravez de Xitique ( sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que tambem sao clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz,temperos, sabao, velas e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade de mercadoria no seu estabelecimento e satifazer a demanda da sua clientela. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 5.200.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 8.000.00mt, 8.7000.00.mt e 10.000.00mt todos para  a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para  a construção de um novo estabelecimento comercial e oferecer melhor comodidade aos seus clientes.
texts.en:
Beatriz M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province, in southern Mozambique. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children who are 27, 23, 21, and 7 years old. The youngest attends school. She only finished the 4th grade due to her parents' lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else. She has never left Boane. She was born in the Km 16 neighborhood, where she still lives today with her family. She has had her own business for more over 9 years. She works from 8am to 5pm in the local market, where she sells rice, sugar, candles, condiments/spices, etc. She does not have any employees. She earns about 5,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for her family's expenses. She even saves some through Xitique (a traditional rotating savings system). She has never had loans with other banks. She found out about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is her 6th loan, which has a value of 15,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy goods (rice, condiments/spices, soap, candles, etc.) in order to increase her business's supply and satisfy her customers' demands. The previous loans were for 5,200 MZN, 8,000 MZN, 8,000 MZN, 8,700 MZN, and 10,000 MZN, all for the same activity. In the future, she would like to request more loans in order to build a new business establishment and to improve its convenience for her customers.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell essential goods (rice, sugar, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Bugwere1 Khainza Leya Group

texts.en: K. Leya is a hardworking businesswoman. She is married and blessed with six children. Two of her children are going to school. She deals with fresh vegetables and she has been selling vegetables for over three years. She is using the loan to purchase fresh vegetables from farms to market for sale. She is a promising businesswoman whose dreams are obtaining land and constructing a good house.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pro Mujer(Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Adriana tiene 21 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos de tres y un año, su esposo trabaja como mensajero en la Comercializadora de productos cosméticos Yanbal, vive en la urbe cuencana donde se puede disfrutar de la belleza colonial de su Centro Histórico, los ríos que bañan la ciudad, su gente y su gastronomía que  hacen  de ésta ciudad  uno de los lugares más visitados de nuestro país por turistas nacionales y extranjeros.

Nuestra  socia se dedica a  los quehaceres de su hogar, al cuidado de una sobrina y los días sábados trabaja haciendo la limpieza en casas ajenas hasta el medio día, su amiga Alexandra la animó a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres emprendedoras que se agruparon en el banco Comunal Pro Mujer para sacar adelante a sus familias y tener más y mejores oportunidades de superación personal y económicamente.

Este es su primer crédito y con el va a montar un  pequeño bazar  para lo cual comprará tarjetas, peluches, regalos, bisutería, útiles escolares, ropa,  entre otros artículos de uso personal y para el hogar. Tiene como meta retomar sus estudios ya que se retiro de primer curso.

Sandra D. es otra socia del banco comunal Pro Mujer, vive en la urbe de la ciudad con su esposo y sus tres hijos que se encuentran de 22, 21, 17 años todos estudian tanto en la universidad como en el colegio, la casa no es propia sino de sus suegros ahí tienen un departamento independiente, como su esposo es médico veterinario de profesión tiene su consultorio en la misma casa para ahorrarse el arriendo.

Sandra es empleada privada trabaja en un local  de recaudación punto pago del consumo de energía eléctrica de la ciudad en el que se encuentra  hace cinco  años, su horario de labores es de  lunes a sábado  de 8 a.m. a  6 p.m.

Este es su primer crédito con la institución y con el dinero que reciba va a pagar la matrícula de su hijo  en la universidad. 

El  sueño más anhelado es poder tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Adriana is 21 years old, married and has two children, ages 3 and 1. Her husband works as a courier at the Yanbal cosmetics factory. They live in the city of Cuenca, where they can enjoy the colonial beauty of a historical center. The rivers nourish the city, people and gastronomy, making it one of the most visited places in the country by natives and foreigners. Adriana dedicates herself to the household chores and caring for her niece. On Saturdays, she works cleaning other people's homes until midday. Her friend Alexandra encouraged her to join this group of enterprising women, which joined forces with Kiva partner Comunal Pro Mujer to make headway for their families and to have more and better opportunities for personal and economic advancement. This is the group's first loan, and with her portion Adriana plans to start a small bazaar for which she will purchase cards, stuffed animals, gifts, jewelry, school supplies, clothing, and other personal and household products. Her goal is to resume her studies since she has a first-grade education. Sandra D. is another member of the community bank, and she lives in the city with her husband and their three children, ages 22, 21 and 17, all of whom are either studying in college or high school. It is not her own home, but her in-laws live in a separate area. Because her husband is a veterinarian, he runs his office out of the home to save on expenses. Sandra has worked as an employee at a private collection agency for the city's electric company for the past five years. She works Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. This is her first loan with the community bank, and with the money she plans to pay for her son's university education. Her biggest dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase items to start a bazaar; pay for son's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional hair dryers, chairs and hair products.

loans.name: Chelsi Group

texts.en: Merwais, son of G. H., is 41 years old, married, and the father of six children. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, and is the leader of Chelsi group. Merwais has been running a general store for more than a year. He is a very hardworking man who wants to earn money to meet his family’s needs. He wants to buy necessary items for his shop such as shampoo, notebooks, pens and biscuits. He is very glad that he has this chance to progress.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, notebooks, pens, biscuits etc. for his store

loans.name: Isabel Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Isabel tiene 21 años de casada con dos hijos ella junto a su esposo tiene un taller llevan con el muchos años, nacieron en este bello cantón de la provincia de Manabí como lo es Junín, en esta parte de la región sus habitantes son agricultores ganaderos y comerciantes de productos de la tierra, pero en esta ocasión nuestra socia se dedica a otra ocupación con lo es la venta de repuestos para  bicicletas,  y además de que el esposo y sus hijos se dedican a reparar las mismas, el pequeño taller lo tiene en su propia casa en una área destinada para ello, desde las 7 de la mañana están en pie para emprender la labor cotidiana hasta que sean las 7 de la noche que es cuando cierran el taller para ir a descansa.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Isabel podrá trasladarse hasta la ciudad de Portoviejo para surtir su taller, es en la capital de los manabitas que realiza sus compras necesarias como repuestos, pintura ligas y mas accesorios, ya tiene un lugar preciso donde comprar al por mayor y así  obtener buenas ganancias, hasta los actuales momento la señora Isabel no ha tenido problema alguno con los pagos al créditos muy responsable y espera seguir trabajando en lo mismo le gusta mucho y eso le hace feliz a toda la familia, con todo estos años de trabajo han podido estos esposos brindarle el estudio a sus hijos y hacer de ellos hombres de  bien.
texts.en:
Isabel has been married for 21 years. Along with her husband and two children, she has a workshop that they have had for many years. They were born in the pretty Junín canton in the Manabí province. In this area the inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock production, and they also sell agricultural products. But this time our member has a different occupation. She sells spare parts for bicycles, and in addition, her husband and children repair bicycles. The small workshop that they have in their own home is in a separate area dedicated to the business. From 7 in the morning they are on their feet carrying out the daily labor until 7 at night, which is when they close the workshop so they can rest. With this new loan Isabel will be able to go to the city of Portoviejo to restock her workshop. This is the capital of Manabí province, where she can purchase the items she needs, such as spare parts, metal paints, and other accessories. She already has a place where she buys wholesale; in this way she gets good profits. Up to this date, Isabel has not had any problems with the payments on her loans. She is very responsible and hopes to continue working in the same business. She enjoys it very much, and it makes her whole family happy, because with all of these years of work this couple has been able to provide their children with an education and raise them to be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy metal paint and bicycle accessories

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith B. is a trained and qualified nurse who operates a pharmacy located in the eastern part of the city. She has been in this business for about 10 years. She is married with one son and three other dependants. Judith is married and her husband is currently unemployed. As she is the only one operating a pharmacy in her area, there is increased demand for the drugs she sells. As a result, she is seeking a loan to buy more drugs and hopes to expand her pharmacy with the proceeds from this loan.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia E. is from the village of Mitazan. She is 74 years old, is married, and has ten adult children. Dionesia owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In January 2000, Dionesia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Dionesia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 17th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a farmer from Kisii town, in Western Kenya. He is 41 years old and married with 5 children between the age of 5 and 14. All the children attend school.

Ben has been farming for over 8 years and has employed 3 farmhands. His products are milk, eggs and biogas which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from his employment as an accountant. His major challenge in farming has been lack of capital for expansion and the high cost of poultry feeds.

He recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 45,000KES and has requested this loan of 70,000KES to expand his poultry project. Through this loan, his family's health will improve and he will be able to earn enough income that will help him educate his children.

In future, Ben would like to produce chickens for sale in large quantities.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. is married and has six dependents. She has been educated up to junior high level.

Ekua sells soft drinks in Abura and has been selling soft drinks for about two years now. Her husband is a mason. Ekua uses her income to support her husband in taking care of the home.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase assorted drinks to fill her fridge and then to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to open a shop.

loans.use: To purchase assorted drinks to fill her fridge and sell

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en:
Donatha is 39 years old and married with two children. The oldest one is 16 years old and the youngest one is 2 and half years old. Donatha owns a small business selling various styles of shoes. This business is profitable. That is why she chose it. Donatha’s husband works in the bank. This family has a target of obtaining all things that they need. Donatha’s business is open from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Saturday.

Donatha is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. With this expansion, she will be able to earn more profit, which is the target of everyone in business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Juan Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ignacio V. C. tiene 27 años de edad, es un joven  soltero, bachiller en humanidades, vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba.

Actualmente se dedica a la actividad de promotor-consultor para la Empresa de telecomunicaciones TIGO, capturando personas para la utilización de servicios de celular, internet y adquisición de aparatos, haciéndolos clientes de dicha Compañía. Su trabajo es caminar por las zonas más concurridas de la ciudad y ofrecer o comercializar los productos y servicios que brinda dicha institución. Sus ganancias no son fijas mas por no tener aun una profesión solo percibe un Porcentaje mínimo de sus ventas, lo cual cubre sus gastos universitarios y suficientes para su alimentación. El Sr. Juan Ignacio V., es un joven muy  emprendedor, que esta constante búsqueda de superación, pero necesita que confíen en él. 

El Sr. Juan Ignacio solicito el crédito para poder adquirir una computadora que le facilitará mucho el trabajo que realiza actualmente siendo más eficiente en su trabajo, además necesita para poder realizar sus trabajos universitarios. Es una persona que quiere superarse y retomará la universidad en la carrera de administración de empresas.
texts.en:
Juan Ignacio V. C. is 27 years old, single, has earned a bachelor’s degree in humanities, and lives in the city of Cochabamba. He currently works as a promoter-consultant for the telecommunication company, TIGO, bringing in new cellular and internet customers, and selling devices. His job is to walk through the busiest part of town, offering company services and products. His income is not set; he receives a small commission on his sales, which are enough to cover the cost of his university tuition and food. Juan is a very entrepreneurial young man who is constantly in search of ways to succeed, but he needs people to believe in him. Juan requested this loan in order to buy a computer that will make his work much easier. He will also be able to use it for his university work. He is one who wants to succeed and wants to take university courses in business administration.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Computer for work and study

loans.name: Elda Mayda

texts.es: Elda es de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos varones y cuatro mujeres, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de artículos de consumo diario, en la actividad tiene más de 10 años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para capital de trabajo, compra de aguas gaseosas el cual es una inversión rentable, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, por tal motivo no tendrá inconvenientes para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Elda is 39 years old, married, and she has two sons and four daughters. She sells grocery store items of daily use and she has 10 years' experience in this business. She requests a first time loan to supplement her working capital and with it she will purchase soft drinks, the investment that is the most profitable. Her personal references illustrate that she is a responsible, hard working person, which is why she will not have any troubles repaying the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Karina Elizabeth Hernández A. cuenta cn un negocio de la venta de comida desde  hace 10 años  lo cual ofrece variedad en platillos como lo son s, tacos, tamales, menudo y pozole y mas depende del platillo que el cliente quiera comer y lo distribuye con sus conocidos aun bajo precio de acuerdo a la economía. Este negocio le ha beneficiado mucho en su economía ya que es de la manera que ella cubre sus gastos. Para seguir con su venta requiere de un préstamo comprar más mercancía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karina Elizabeth Hernández A. has had a prepared food business for 10 years. She offers a variety of dishes like: tacos, tamales, menudo (tripe soup) and pozole (soup made with a pork and white corn base) and others depending on what the customer wants to eat. She sells to her acquaintances at a low price and according to the economy. The business has been of great benefit to her because this is how she meets household expenses. To continue selling she needs funds to buy more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mang

texts.en:
Mang S., 37, makes and sells pig banks at the local market of her Takeo province. She typically makes US$2 of profit every day, while her husband works in construction and earns US$2 per day. 

This couple has five children, two are garment factory workers and three are in school. Mang S. is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to make new investment. She will build a small coffee shop to sell coffee.

loans.use: To open a coffee shop.

loans.name: Shirley Magda

texts.es: La Sra. Magda vive en la Urbanización el Toborochi lugar en la cual viven hace muchos años, la Sra.se dedica a la venta de pollo al spiedo en su mismo domicilio con la ayuda de su hija que tiene 24 años y esta en la universidad, además sus ventas son darías, la Sra. por la mañana se va al mercado a realizar sus compras para la preparación del pollo en la tarde además ella genera trabajo a una muchacha de 16 años a quien le paga de forma mensual por su ayuda en el negocio, lo que hay que rescatar de este negocio es que es el único mas cercano en los alrededores y la Sra. Magda ya es conocida y muy querida en el lugar, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Magda Necesita comprar insumos para la preparación de sus riquísimos pollos y también refrescos, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Magda lives in the Toborochi colony and she has lived there for many years. She sells roasted chicken from her home with her daughter’s help. Her daughter is 24 years old and she is in university. In advance of her daily sales, she goes to the market in the mornings to make the purchases necessary to prepare the chicken for sale in the afternoons. She also employs a 16 year old young woman for help in the business. She is paid on a monthly basis. Her business is the only one of its type in the neighborhood. Magda is well known and much loved in her community. Magda will purchase soft drinks and ingredients to prepare her delicious chicken with the funds from this loan. She is very grateful to the organization for the support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make roast chicken.

loans.name: Zoila Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUAYNA PICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoila Rosa; ella tiene 61 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquilares de su casa, ella alquila diferentes cuartos de su casa por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar las habitaciones de su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para que arregle las habitaciones.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Zoila Rosa is a member of the Communal Bank “Huayna Picchu”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 61 years old, widowed, and has two children. Zoila divides her time between her daily activities and her business renting rooms in her house. She rents out different rooms of her house so that her children can get ahead. Zoila wants to make improvements to the rooms in her house. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy materials for making repairs.

Zoila Rosa is grateful to those responsible for making her dream come true, so she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase materials for repairing rental rooms

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
In 2008, Maria Fe found a chance to acquire business capital. She joined ASHI, the first kiva field partner, and she was encouraged by the stories of poor women of ASHI. She wanted to become successful like them and use loans in her business.  Because of the opportunity of receiving loans, Maria was able to start a business buying and selling vegetables.  She is courageous enough to take all the risk of running a business.  She thought she could be successful because her husband is there to support her and because of a dream she kept in her mind of having all of her children finish their schooling through the completion of college. 

Now she is requesting a new loan for the amount of 25,000 PHP. The loan fund will be used to pay for inventories of vegetables. She believes with more stock she will attract more customers in their village.

Maria Fe has never hoped for anything more than for her family and her children not to experience the hard life she and her husband has experienced. She dreams of building a new concrete and spacious house and expanding the business. 
 
Maria Fe’s one hope and dream is to alleviate her family from poverty. Maria Fe is very pleased to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping fund her business endeavor.

loans.use: To pay for inventories of vegetables.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario, tiene 24 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de medicina y ropa, vive con su esposa, su hermano y la esposa de este, tiene dos hijos de 8 y 5 años, él trabaja para la alimentación de su esposa y sus hijos, este negocio nació por la influencia de sus amigos, no tiene horario de trabajo.
Actualmente necesita dinero para invertir en el negocio y solicita un préstamo ya que no cuenta con la suficiente disponibilidad para realizar las compras; su inversión será en medicina y ropa, con este préstamo desea tener para los clientes de varios estilos de prendas de vestir así como la medicina para distintas enfermedades.
Sueña con un negocio amplio, que sus ventas sean por mayor, manejar bien este préstamo y mejorar las condiciones económicas de la familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 24 years old. He lives in San Rafael Oriente, in the department of San Miguel. He sells medicine and clothing. He lives with his wife, his brother, and his brother’s wife. They have two children who are 8 and 5 years old. He works to provide for his wife and their children. He started this business on the advice of his friends. He doesn’t have a set work schedule.

He needs money to invest in his business and he is requesting a loan because he doesn’t have sufficient cash to make the purchases. He will buy medicine and clothing. With this loan, he would like to make available to his customers various styles of clothing, and also medicines for a variety of illnesses. 

He dreams of having a large business and of having greater sales; of managing this loan well and improving the economic conditions of his family.

loans.use: To buy medicines and clothing

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.en:
Buenaventura T. is from the town of Trinidad. He is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Buenaventura owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Buenaventura also owns and tills a rice farm. He sells his harvest to the market.

Buenaventura joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Buenaventura has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Buenaventura is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feed. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Nem

texts.en:
Nem N., 45, is a farmer earning an income of 2 USD per day. N. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations.  The family has to spend 80 USD on food, 3 USD on electricity supply, and 15 USD on other necessary expenses every month.

N. is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for the family to use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a motorbike for the family to use

loans.name: Martha Evangelista

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal 11 De Septiembre. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Martha, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 8, 6 y 1 años, los  dos mayores estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ceviches en la ciudad de Charapoto, venden todo tipo de ceviches de camarón, pescado, conchas, etc. trabaja  los viernes, sabados y domingos desde las 6h00 hasta las 13h00, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo, nos cuenta que llevan en su negocio por dos años, y que fue por la necesidad de tener algo propio que decidió poner este negocio.

Este crédito es para comprar colas, aguas, pescado, camarón y otros productos necesarios para la preparación de estos platos deliciosos, es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por la forma de trabajo que tiene la institución. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en: The 11 De Septiembre ["September 11th"] Community Bank meets every fifteen days in the city of Charapoto. This location is known for its traditional culture and for being a few minutes from the best beaches of the province, such as San Jacinto and San Clemente. Here we meet Mrs Martha. She is 31 and in a common-law marriage, a relationship from which she has three children, aged 8, 6 and 1. The two oldest children are in school. Her husband is a merchant. She has a ceviche [seafood dish] business in Charapoto city. She sells all types of ceviches with shrimp, fish, conches, etc. She works Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 6:00 am to 1:00 pm. Her husband helps her with this work. She tells us that she has had this business for two years, and that she decided to start it out of the necessity to have something of her own. This loan is to purchase colas, water, fish, shrimp and other necessary products for making these delicious dishes. She is a founding member of the Community bank and she likes it because of the work structure of the institution. Her dream is to have her own home as the home in which they currently live is rented.

loans.use: to purchase cola, water, fish, shrimp, conches and other items for preparing cebiches [a popular seafood dish]

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda N. owns a small rice farm. She began this business in order to help support her children's education. She has three children; all of them are still in school. 

Roseminda has requested a loan from CEVI in order to purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She hopes that this will increase her business. She intends to use the profit to finance her children's daily fare and school fees, as well as provide for the family's daily consumption.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Isidro Alfonso

texts.es:
Don Isidro reside en Yamabal, departamento de Morazán, tiene 43 años de edad, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y la agricultura, su familia está compuesta por su esposa, sus hijas Adela de 15 años, Alejandra de 14 y su hijo Miguel de 11 años de edad, los jóvenes estudian.  Don Isidro trabaja todo el día en ocupaciones D. campo, en forraje, ordeño y cuido D. ganado, además D. trabajo de chapoda y siembra de maíz y frijol.
Él necesita un préstamo para la compra de alimento para el ganado (concentrado y forraje), este préstamo le sea muy útil, pues podrá adquirir la cantidad necesaria D. alimento para la época de verano, ya que el ganado depende D. alimento para que pueda dar leche abundante y esté en buenas condiciones.
Las aspiraciones son crecer en el negocio como ganadero, que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir, además de darle la educación a sus hijos y el sustento diario.
texts.en:
Don Isidro lives in Yamabal in the department of Morazán.  He is 43 years old and raises cattle and works in agriculture for a living.  His family is made up of his wife, his daughters Adela, 15, Alejandra, 14, and his son Miguel, 11. All of his children attend school.  Don Isidro works all day in the field feeding, milking and caring for his livestock, in addition to mowing and growing corn and beans.  

He needs a loan to purchase enough feed for his cattle (fodder and concentrate) to last the entire summer season since his cattle are dependent on the food for good milk production.  

His dreams are to grow his cattle business and for his family to have what they need to live, including an education for his children as well as daily sustenance.

loans.use: To purchase cattle feed (fodder and concentrate)

loans.name: Merilene

texts.en:
Merilene is a married woman who lives in Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband Bonifacio, who is 58 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 24 and 28 years old. Merilene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merilene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for house repairs. Merilene is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, es una luchadora madre soltera que cuida de su hijo Aldair a quien quiere mucho. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad de Guacamayo (selva central peruana). Desde muy joven se dedicó a producir la tierra que le fue heredada, pues tenía que velar por su hijo. Fue entonces que comenzó a sembrar una variedad de frutas cítricas como: naranja, mandarina y tangelo, ya tiene 9 años de experiencia, en todo este tiempo su buena disposición en las ventas, le permitieron adquirir 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas. Recientemente incursionó en la siembra de plátanos con el que piensa generar ingresos casa 15 días, ya que su maduración es más rápida que otras variedades. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde espera lograr todos los objetivos de su banco comunal. Alicia, hace poco sembró tangelo (fruta cítrica), por ello con el crédito está pensando comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá entre sus sembríos para que sigan creciendo sin inconvenientes.
texts.en:
Alicia is a determined single mother who looks after her son Aldair, whom she loves very much. They live in her house, located in the community of Guacamayo (central Peruvian rainforest). From a young age she worked the land she inherited in order to support her child. That's when she began to sow a variety of citrus fruits such as oranges, tangerines and tangelos. She already has 9 years' experience and over time her sales ability has allowed her to purchase 5 hectares of agricultural land. She recently ventured into the cultivation of bananas, which she expects that will generate revenue every fortnight, as the ripening process is faster than with other varieties. 

She is a member of the "nuevo amanecer de Guacamayo" ("new dawn of Guacamayo") communal bank and this is her first loan with MFP. She is hoping to achieve all of her communal bank's objectives. Alicia recently planted tangelo (a citrus fruit) and she is planning on using the loan to buy several sacks of organic fertilizer, which she will spread amongst her crops so that they can continue to grow smoothly.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Momosuluv

texts.ru: Махмудова Момосулув проживает в районе Кубодиён. Ей 58 лет. Замужем, имеет 10 детей. У нее большая и дружная семья. Муж работает в двух дехканских хозяйствах. Сама Момосулув занимается растениеводством. Она арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи, сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 6 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян арбуза и минеральных удобрений для сезонного посева.
texts.en: Momosuluv M. lives in the Qubadiyon district.  She is 58 years old, married and has 10 children.  She has a big and happy family.  Her husband works at two dekhan farms.  Momosuluv is involved in agriculture.  She leases a plot of land, where she grows vegetables and plants fruit trees.  She has been involved in this business for 6 years.  The goal of this loan is a purchase of watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizers for the seasonal sowing.

loans.use: to purchase watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizers for seasonal sowing

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old and is a married lady who is the mother of four children. For the past three years, she has been in the charcoal-selling business in Migori town. Nancy’s monthly profit is 10,000 KES. 

Nancy was introduced to KADET LTD by a client who is registered with KADET. She has never borrowed money from any other microfinance institution and is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES. Nancy will use her loan to buy more charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to pay school fees for her children and to repay her loan. 

In the future, Nancy hopes to open a large charcoal store.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Mwanarusi is a married woman with one child who is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a tailoring business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a cosmetic business which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanarusi faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to meet her customers needs in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase cloth materials, threads and cosmetics for her cosmetic shop. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials, threads and cosmetics for her cosmetic shop.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children. 

For the past six years, he has operated a carpentry business. He sells from home to his neighbors and passersby. In addition Said faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation from rural areas to his place of operation. He dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of timber in his area. 

With the Kshs 40,000 Saidi wants to purchase timber for his carpentry business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase timber for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Hilal

texts.ar: هلال عمره34 سنة اعزب ويعمل في بيع الالبسة والاحذية له في عمله 11 سنة يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله من خلال تطوير عمله يسعى الى ان يعمل بجد ونشاط حتى يتمكن من تأسيس حياة اجتماعية ومادية جيدة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة البسة واحذية موسمية لأقتراب الموسم الصيفي هو طموح محب للعمل يريد ان يبني اسرة تكون على اساس مادي سليم له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث استطاع القرض السابق من دعم عمله وتطويره ولكنه يعاني من منافسة قوية في محيطه
texts.en: Hilal is 34 years old and unmarried. He works in a clothes and shoes store and has been doing this for 11 years. He wants to increase his income by developing his business. He aspires to work hard and seriously so that he is able to establish a stable financial and good social life. With this loan he wants to buy new seasonal stock as summer approaches. He is ambitious and loves his business, and wants to establish a family whilst he is financially stable. He has good credit history with al-Majmoua and the last loan supported and strengthened his business; however, he suffers from a lot of competition in his local area.

loans.use: to purchase new seasonal clothes and shoes for the summer season.

loans.name: Menchelle

texts.en: Menchelle is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Menchelle has a food shop that sells & serves viands like afritada, caldereta & chicken & pork adobo. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients like meat, spices & vegetables. Menchelle is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Menchelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like meat, spices & vegetables

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
En el Municipio de santa rosa del peñón, departamento de león, Zeneyda se ha caracterizado por ser una madre muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su familia y a logrado mantener a su hogar que tanto ama y aprecia. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajador y con buenos valores cívicos ha hecho que se ganen el respeto muchas personas.
 Actual mete a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, para ello está solicitando un crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: sin, pintura y madera, con esto permitirá la mejora de su habitación ya que se encuentra en época de invierno, para las mejores condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón, in León department, Zeneyda is noted for being a very hard-working mother owing to the fact that she has known how to take care of her family and managed to support her household that loves and is so fond of.  Zeneyda is noted for being an excellent worker who has good civic values.  This has meant that she has earned the respect of many people.

Zeneyda came to Ceprodel El Sauce with the goal of requesting a loan to improve the living conditions in her home.  This is why she is requesting this loan; to buy construction supplies such as paint and wood which will allow her to improve her home as it is now winter.  She will thereby improve the conditions in which her family lives.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hector Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Hector es dueño de una despensa ubicada en la ciudad de Santani. Por medio de este trabajo el ha podido solventar aquellos gastos que implica la manutencion de un hogar y de su negocio mismo.
El se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora. Comenta que tener una despensa es un trabajo muy sacrificado, puesto que requiere no solo una gran invesion monetaria, sino tambien mucho esfuerzo fisico. Entre sus aspiraciones esta poder agrandar su negocio para ofrecer mas comodidades a sus clientes.
El solicita el credito para el abastecimiento de su local, por medio de la compra de comestibles, bebidas, hortalizas y demas. El esta muy esperanzado en el credito ya que le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Héctor owns a general store located in the city of Santani.  This business makes it possible for him to meet household and personal expenses.  

He defines himself as a very hard working, tenacious person.  He comments that having a store is a very demanding job because it not only requires a significant financial investment but also much physical work.  Among his hopes is being able to enlarge the business to offer more comfort to his customers.

He is asking for the loan to stock his store through the purchase of foodstuffs, beverages, vegetables and others.  He has placed high hopes on the loan that will be of great help to him.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge aprendió de su padre a trabajar la tierra, el desde muy joven trabajaba como jornalero en las fincas de café y gracias a su trabajo en ellas hoy día tiene su propia tierra con un sembrado de café que le proporciona tener el sustento diario para su familia conformada por 3 hijos.

El también trabaja como ayudante de construcción los fines de semana y sus hijos le ayudan en el cultivo para así poderlo cuidar y poner bien bonito para sacar una buena cosecha.

Para mantener su cultivo el necesita ferlitizantes y abonos que lo protejan de las plagas, además así cuando haya cosecha puede vender el café a buen precio y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge learned from his father how to work the land. He worked as a day laborer on the coffee plantations starting when he was very young, and thanks to his work there, he now has his own land where he plants coffee. This provides him and his family, composed of 3 children, with the daily bread.

He also works in the construction business as an assistant during the week-ends, and his children help him with the crop so that it is well cared for and of good quality to then get a good harvest.

To preserve his crops, he needs fertilizers and manure to protect them from blight, so that once harvested he can sell coffee at a good price and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime  de 28 años de edad, vive con su esposa en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en lazona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algunos años Jaime se dedica la venta de productos de primera necesidad (leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, etc) y de bebidas, su negocio lo a colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y mejorar su nivel de vida.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías con la finalidad de surtir su tienda, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga los productos necesarios para ofrecer a sus clientes.  Jaime es una persona responsable, dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por brindarle más comodidades a su esposa.
texts.en:
Jaime, 28, lives with his wife in his own home. He has only electricity and is located in a rural area of Tambo Grande district, in Piura department. The area is characterized by agriculture, cattle raising and craft work.

For several years Jaime has sold basic supplies (milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, etc.) and beverages. He has operated his business from his own home for convenience and security. He tries, with the profits obtained from the sale of his products, to cover all of his expenses and to raise his standard of living.

In order to expand his business he has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, which he will use to buy more merchandise to stock his store. His goal is to see his business grow and to have the necessary items to offer his customers.

Jaime is a responsible, dedicated and hardworking person who is concerned about providing more amenities for his wife.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Elvira Genoveva

texts.es: La Sra. Elvira es una profesora de primaria jubilada desde hace ya once años, ella vive con su mama la cual esta enferma, y  bajo sus cuidados, por las mañanas da apoyo a sus pequeños vecinos que anda mal en sus estudios y lo hace con amor, para que ellos puedan sobresalir con sus calificaciones, vende productos de catalogo (cosméticos) para así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su  mama y poder pagar sus medicamentos ya que es una persona discapacitada por su avanzada edad, ella va a pintar el exterior de su vivienda, ya que esta muy deteriorada por el tiempo, esta muy contenta de habernos encontrado y así poder llevar a cabo su proyecto, y a futuro poder instalar el vitropiso en el interior de su vivienda ya que cuenta actualmente con piso de concreto
texts.en:
Señora Elvira is a primary school teacher who has been retired for 11 years.  She lives with her mom who is sick and under her care.  In the mornings, she provides help to her young neighbors who are struggling with their studies, which she does with love so that they will be able to excel with their skills.  She sell products from a catalog (cosmetics), so that she can provide her mom with a better quality of life, and be able to pay for her mom's medicines as she is a disabled woman of advanced age.

She is going to paint the exterior of her house as it has greatly deteriorated over time.  She is very happy to have found us, and so to be able to carry out her project.  In future she will be able to lay floor tiles inside her home, as currently she has a concrete floor.

loans.use: to paint the exterior of her home.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ali has operated a vegetable stall business for over ten years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passers-by. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuation of products in the market. 

He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, onions and green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Selmita

texts.es: Selmita tiene 50 años, es una mujer valiente y muy gentil, ella esta casada ya por muchos años con su esposo, es madre de un hijo quien tiene 18 años y aún es estudiante. Vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia donde junto a ellos trabaja para tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Selmita consiste en la venta de abarrotes, pues posee una pequeña tienda instalada en su casa. Asimismo ofrece algunos productos por catalogo a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son amigos, vecinos y familiares. Por otro lado también tiene un mototaxi, vehículo que alquila a quienes desean trabajar ofreciendo transporte público. Tiene 17 años haciendo todo este tipo de trabajo, lo cual le ha generado los ingresos para compartir con su esposo en los gastos familiares. Su bodega es muy concurrida, ya que trata bien a sus clientes y tiene todo lo que ellos necesitan, por lo que tiene buenos ingresos y le va bien en este trabajo. Espera mas adelante poner un negocio más, como la venta de repuestos de moto y una vulcanizadora. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, es socia fundadora y cumplida con los pagos. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos para su bodega, además de comprar algunos repuestos y accesorios para su vulcanizadora.
texts.en:
Selmita, 50, is a very brave, very gentle woman.  She’s been married to her husband for many years and is the mother of an 18-year-old son who is still a student.  She lives with her husband and son in her own house where she works alongside them in order to have a better quality of life.

Selmita’s work consists in grocery sales because she has a small grocery store installed in her house.  She also offers a few catalogue items to her customers who for the most part are friends, neighbors and family members.  On the other hand, she also has a mototaxi, a vehicle that she leases out to those wanting to provide public transportation services.  She’s been doing all these kinds of work for 17 years and has generated income to share family expenses with her husband.  Her store is quite busy because she treats her customers well and she has everything they need so her income is good and she does well in this work.  She hopes later on to set up an additional business, like the sale of motorcycle spare parts and a tire repair shop.

This will be loan #16 with MFP.  She’s a founding member and very diligent with her payments.  She will use the requested amount to buy stock items for her store as well as a few replacement parts and accessories for her tire repair shop.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado y vive con su esposo e hijos  actualmente. El con el crédito va comprar una máquina de coser. El cuenta con un pequeño taller de costura en su casa además cuenta con la experiencia necesaria y el material para la realizar la confección de prendas de vestir. El quiere cumplir con la clientela que tiene y darles los trabajos encargados en un tiempo rápido y así obtener del proyecto los resultados esperados para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar su bienestar  familiar cada día.  Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 46 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children.  He will use his loan to buy a sewing machine.  Guillermo has a small sewing workshop in his home.  He has the necessary experience and material to make clothes.  He would like to please his customers and return the work they have ordered from him quickly, thereby obtaining the hoped-for results from his project so that he can improve his family's well being. and continue improving it.

This is the first loan that Guillermo has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have provided him this loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Martina De La Concepcion

texts.es: Martina De La Concepción de 53 años tiene 1 hijo de 16 años. ella se dedica al brindar el servicio de costura, la cual inició hace 12 años realizando vestidos para damas, caballeros y en la línea infantil, y poco a poco fue agregando otras mercancía, cuando sus clientes pedían diferentes estilos de ropa ella siempre se preocupaba para entregarlos. Su negocio está ubicado en su vivienda en donde a diario recibe visita de vecinos, amigos y familiares. Su crédito es para la compra hilos, tijeras, tela, dedales, aguja, botones, zipper entre otros. Con el cual responderá a pedidos de pendientes por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en: Martina De La Concepción, 53, has a 16-year-old son.  She provides sewing services, which she started doing 12 years ago by making clothes for women, men, and children.  Little by little she added more merchandise and when her customers asked for different styles of clothing, she always cared to deliver them.  Her business is located in her home and she receives visits from her neighbors, friends, and family daily.  The loan is to buy thread, scissors, cloth, thimbles, needles, buttons, zippers and more, with which she will respond to her customer’s requests.

loans.use: buy thread, scissors, cloth, thimbles, needles, buttons, zippers and more.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman. She has 5 children, with 1 currently enrolled in school. Her husband, Kombo, works as a businessman. For the past 3 years, Eunice has run her own shop selling water and poultry. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. Eunice's other source of income includes earnings from her husband and her adult children. She describes her greatest business challenge to be low demand during the rainy season and her highest monthly expense is food. She owns a house that has both electricity and piped water. 

Eunice will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cereals and other goods. Eunice aspires to expand into several businesses in the future. She joined Yehu to access loans in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals and other goods.

loans.name: Dourgham

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, married and has two children.

Dourgham has been the owner of his shop since 2006, selling mobiles phone, gifts, stationeries and has a photocopier machine. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is becoming well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $2400 loan in order to purchase a new camera for video and photography. He is aiming to gain more profits to allow him to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a new camera for video and photography.

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem is 50 years old. She has studied until 8th grade and lives with her husband and 2 sons.

She supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services to his passengers.  Her eldest son left his education after matriculation while the youngest one has completed until the intermediate level.  Both of them are looking for a job these days. Tasleem is hopeful that they will find a suitable job in the near future.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes-sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will allow her to finish the orders on time and earn more profits.

She has been operating her business for the past many years and her community ladies know her very well for her good quality work. She is confident that she will successfully be able to improve her business after the loan investment.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

Note: In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Tasleem.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Celestino

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Manhiça, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5  filhos todos ainda frequentam a Escola. Fez a 4ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

Saiu de Manhiça para oDistrito de Boane aprocura de melhores condições de vida, é carpinteiro ha mais de 31 anos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria(BIM).
Já teve emprestimos noutros bancos(TSHUMA) e conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 26.350.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(areia, cimento, pedra, ferro e outros)
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e comprar uma viatura para o transporte da madeira para a sua carpintaria, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Celestino was born in the District of Manhiça, in the Province of Maputo in the South of Mozambique. He’s married and the father of 5 children who are still all at School. He completed 4th grade and didn’t continue his education due to his parents’ lack of financial means. He lives in his own house with his family and doesn’t support anyone else.

He left Manhiça for the District of Boane looking for better living conditions. He has been a carpenter for more than 31 years and has a monthly income of around 15,000.00 meticals (MZN) which he spends on household expenditures and saves in his bank account (BIM).

Celestino has had loans from other banks (TSHUMA) which he has been able to pay back without difficulties and he came to know Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 26,350.00 MZN with which he intends to purchase construction materials in order to continue building his home (sand, cement, stone, iron and others). He commits to paying off the loan and in future he intends to finish off his house and purchase a vehicle for transporting wood to his carpentry workshop. To this end, he intends to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase construction materials in order to continue building his home (sand, cement, stone, iron and others)

loans.name: Mutoma W G Group

texts.en:
Mary is the facilitator of the Mutoma W G group. Mary and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Mary will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Mutoma W G group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Mary with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Luke is 43 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Luke has been working hard to manage his small business, which does welding. 

To help expand his business, Luke has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more equipment to make beds for resale and will help Luke to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Luke hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his working capital. 

Luke is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Luke who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more equipment to make beds for resale

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is a housewife who stays at home and fulfills her household responsibilities. 
Her husband has a low-income job. She has a son and 2 daughters. Her daughters are studying at a nearby school.
Shagufta is very supportive and has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her eldest son who operates a grocery store in the market. 
With the loan investment, he will buy sugar, spices, and other grocery items in bulk quantity that will allow him to fulfill the needs of his clients and increase his profits.
He started his business recently and Shugafta is hopeful that an investment will help him take his business to a more profitable position.
Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shagufta.

loans.use: To buy sugar, spices and other grocery items for her son's grocery store

loans.name: Ericka De La Concepcion
