He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., age 49, is a housewife. S. is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD $3.00 per day. The family has to spend USD $40.00 on food, USD $5.00 on electricity, and USD $43.00 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD $1000 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Edgar Edilberto

texts.es:
Edgar, tiene 21 años, vive en la provincia de Anta distrito de Anta departamento del Cusco.  Anta se encuentra ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Edgar se dedica a la ganadería, él vende sus animales en la feria de la comunidad de Inquilpata llamada “Tablada”. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra ubicada a 15 minutos de ciudad principal de Anta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va excelente gracias al empeño que le pone a su trabajo. Edgar espera recibir de S/. 800 nuevos soles de crédito y va comprar ganado como por ejemplo vacas, ovejas, muchas animales más. 

Edgar pertenece al banco comunal “LLankaq Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene un año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Edgar, 21, lives in Anta province, Anta district, Cusco department.  Anta is located 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.

Edgar is a cattleman.  He sells his animals at Inquilpata’s market called “Tablada.” Inquilpata is a community located 15 minutes from the main city of Anta.  He has been in this business for several years now and does excellently thanks to the effort he puts into the work.  Edgar hopes to receive an 800 new sol loan to buy cattle like cows, sheep and many other animals.

Edgar is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “LLankaq Maqui” communal bank which has been operating for a year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: To buy livestock like: cows, sheep and many other animals.

loans.name: Barot

texts.en:
Barot is married with four children. He is a small entrepreneur selling groceries. Barot owns a small storage facility in a local market. He and his son (in the photo) have much experience working in this sphere of trade. Barot launched his business over 6 years ago. His business is known for its reasonable pricing policy and free delivery service. One of his plans for the near future is to buy a facility for his business that he could own instead of renting a building. 

Barot is always on the go. He is very determined and knows how to achieve his goals. This time Barot is seeking a 1500 USD loan to purchase foodstuffs to expand his inventory. He is hoping to use the generated profit to finish remodeling his apartment, which he couldn’t complete due to financial constraints.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing more foodstuffs to expand his inventory

loans.name: Sampuli

texts.en:
Sampuli is a married woman with six children, three of whom attend school while three are still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a food vending business for the past eight years, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she also operates a video café which contributes to her income. Sampuli faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season the number of customers is lower leading to low income gained. She hopes to build rental houses in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and rice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and rice for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy some essential materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials to make infrastructure improvements

loans.name: Rateb

texts.en:
Rateb is a 41 years old married man, living in Chtoura with his wife and 4 kids.  He works several jobs.  First, he owns a shop where he sells gifts, gadgets, accessories and Hooka (i.e., a single or multi-stemmed instrument for smoking where the smoke is cooled and filtered by passing through water). The tobacco smoked using the Hooka is referred to as narghile or shisha (sheesha) in the United Kingdom, United States and Canada. Originally from India, hookah has gained popularity, especially in the Middle East and is becoming more popular in North America, South America, Europe and Australia.

Two months ago, Rateb opened a grocery store in order to increase his family's income.  He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to increase his capital and improve the grocery store. Rateb is well known in his region as an honorable man; he cares about customer satisfaction, which helps his business at the same time. This is Rateb's third loan cycle with Al Majmoua; his previous loans helped improve his social and financial situation.

loans.use: To improve his new opened grocery store

loans.name: Cintia Elisa

texts.es:
Cintia, tiene 28 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es comerciante de ropa, vive en compañía de su esposo, ella aprendió el negocio de la ropa por su madre, quien le heredo la venta, lleva 3 años realizándolo, ofreciendo ropa y sandalias, tiene un puesto fijo el cual lo atiende de 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Hoy día está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa variada, nueva y que esté de moda,  espera que esta inversión le sirva para crecer y aumentar sus ventas, también que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
Para Cintia, sus objetivos son aumentar las ventas, tener una mejor solvencia económica, algún día tener un puesto propio, y comprar su propia casa. Para conseguirlo ella dispone de muchas fuerzas para trabajar fuertemente.
texts.en:
Cintia, 28 years of age, lives in San Miguel and sells clothing.  She lives with her husband, and learned the business from her mother, from whom she inherited her sales ability.  She has been in business for 3 years, offering clothing and sandals.  Today, she has a fixed location that she tends to from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan today to buy a variety of clothing that is new and in fashion.  Her hopes are that the investment will help her grow her enterprise, augment her sales, and provide improved service to her customers.  Cintia’s goals are to increase sales, improve her financial situation, have her own store locale, and buy her own house.  To obtain these, she is disposed to put forth a great effort and work very hard.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Sergio Bladimir

texts.es: Sergio Bladimir F. M. de veinticinco años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo en el departamento de San Salvador. El tiene un taller de pintura de automóviles en una zona muy concurrida, es muy conocido en el lugar pues tiene una excelente calidad de trabajo y tiene precios accesibles. Sergio es un hombre emprendedor  y siempre le recuerda a sus clientes que el mejor automovilista es aquel que posee la mejor pintura en su auto y los recibe con amabilidad y con una sonrisa en el rostro; quiere ofrecerle lo mejor a su clientela por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pintura de diferentes colores para estar preparado y no defraudar a las personas que lo visitan. Sergio tiene esperanza que su trabajo le ayudara a sacar adelante a su familia y lograra darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sergio Bladimir F. M. is 25 years old and lives with his life partner and son in San Salvador department.  He owns a car body paint shop in a very busy area.  He is very well known in his area as his work is very good quality and his prices are affordable.

Sergio is an enterprising man and he always reminds his customers that the best driver is the one with the best painted vehicle.  He greets his customers with kindness and a smile on his face.  Sergio would like to offer his customers the best and, for this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy different colored paints so that he can be prepared and not let down the people who visit his business.  Sergio hopes that his work will help him to get his family ahead in life and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to paint cars

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a forty-three-year-old married man with eight children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family, and his desire is to educate his children. He has been in the transport sector for four years, and he got his initial capital from farming. He has a challenge because of the current financial crisis, which has led to an increase in fuel prices. His desire is to have three motorcycles. Peter needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Hajalhon's Group

texts.en:
Hajalhon, 22, the young leader of this group, is a farmer who cultivates and sells cotton. When she graduated from school, her mom taught her the craft of sewing, so Hajalhon also takes orders and sews Kyrgyz national blankets, pillows, cloth, and dressmaking supplies, earning 4000 soms per month. Haljahon saved some of her savings to contribute to her sister’s wedding, as under Kyrgyz traditions the wife’s family prepares a dowry (furniture, household appliances, clothes, etc.). She is now applying for a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers which are needed for sowing cotton.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 41-year-old married man and father of four lovely children. He has owned a grocery store since 1996. He is well known in the region and most of his clients are from the village. Ali is a hard worker, he does so in order to provide a secure and healthy life for his family. 

Ali has had four loans from Al Majmoua (a Kiva partner) and is a borrower in good standing. All his previous loans had a good impact on his business and family's social and financial situation. 

Currently he is requesting a loan in order to increase his business capital with summer special offers on soft drinks and ice cream. 

He hopes to improve his business more and more and to own a big Internet cafe in the future.

loans.use: To increase his summer season's capital through offers such as soft drinks and ice cream

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is a married lady with two children who attend school.  She runs a salon to earn a living.  She has been in the business for five years.  In addition, she sells gas cylinders to boost her income.  She was previously operating a green grocery.
Rahab has managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya and has improved her standard of living.  She hopes that one day she will run a wholesale business.  Rahab has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair braids.

loans.use: To buy hair braids

loans.name: Batkhishig

texts.en:
Batkhishig is a 33-year-old married man with two children, aged four and nine. He and his wife operate a business together at Kharkhorin, the local outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, with two stalls at a rented space selling underclothing, sunglasses and school supplies.  

His family used to live in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) at another person’s land plot. Since then their business has expanded, hence with their business earnings, he bought a small plot and built their first house. 

Batkhishig is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) loan to buy vacuum-insulated windows, a sliding metal door and other necessary materials to fix and renovate his small house. By doing so, their family can enjoy safe and comfortable living conditions.

Since he started his business in 2007, Batkhishig’s life has considerably improved. He is a bright and hard-working man who is willing to raise his children in a good environment and with the help of this loan, he will get the opportunity to finish his housing project.

loans.use: to buy vacuum-insulated windows, a sliding metal door and other necessary materials to fix and renovate his small house

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, a 33-year-old married mother of three children, has been operating a retail shop for the last five years, having previously sold vegetables. Caroline works hard in her business to provide for her children's needs, including their education. She attributes her business success to the good service she provides.

Now requesting a 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy rice and sugar, Caroline hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar and rice.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 70 years old and the single mother of six children. For a living, she raises animals to sell such as guinea pigs, pigs and chickens. After they are fully grown, she brings them to a market to sell them. In addition, Dominga rents a small stand in the Cusco bus terminal where she sells traditional Peruvian food from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy more pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens that she can raise and eventually sell. Dominga is a very hardworking woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens to sell

loans.name: Eva Elena

texts.es:
Eva de 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 16 años,  en Malambo, municipio área metropolitana de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a 5 kilómetros del aeropuerto de la ciudad, contiguo a las poblaciones de Soledad, Sabanagrande y Santo Tomás, caracterizado por una composición social muy especial, debido a que en sus habitantes encontramos una mezcla gente de todo el país, que llega a trabajar de manera independiente mediante un negocio o en El Parque Industrial Malambo S.A. -PIMSA- condominio industrial privado de completa infraestructura de servicios, orientados a garantizar reducciones en los costos a las empresas que se ubiquen en sus instalaciones y que tienen garantizada la disponibilidad suficiente de mano de obra a las empresas de la zona.

Eva con su negocio “Variedades Eva”, donde vende insumos de confección, papelería, accesorios femeninos y domésticos y goza de una clientela que lo reconoce porque de la mano y con la calidez de Eva,  encuentran de todo un poco de lo que buscan. Su negocio inició con el apoyo de su esposo, quien invirtió un pequeño capital producto de sus ahorros cuando trabajó en una empresa, en un principio Eva vendía mercancías variadas entre sus vecinas y poco a poco agregó vitrinas y capital  de trabajo, producto de 20 créditos recibidos hasta hoy por parte de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los que ha logrado, extender su clientela y hacer compras de contado en un mayor volumen financiando así, su cartera de crédito de clientes. Eva aún recuerda su primer crédito por valor de $180.000 Cop, y después vinieron otros más y con ellos su crecimiento, por eso fue postulada al premio City Bank, porque su excelencia en el buen desempeño, reflejó siempre su crecimiento así como su proceso de formalización empresarial. Aunque ha tenido desafíos importantes como cuando hace 3 años, la inseguridad de ese momento generó gran disminución en su capital de trabajo, no obstante a ese impase inteligentemente ha salido adelante logrando manejar efectivamente su crisis. 
En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, con el cual comprará insumos para la confección, accesorios femeninos y papelería. Pues planea surtir su negocio con productos que vende muy rápido, para manejar un stock de ellos que le permita la disminución de sus costos de transporte y la posibilidad de aumentar cada día mas su volumen de compras, con lo cual obtendría muy buenos descuentos. Mientras todo esto ocurre Eva se esmera diariamente en su trabajo, generando una rentabilidad no menor del 30%, con lo que impacta el bienestar de su hogar.
texts.en:
Eva is 55 years old and lives with her husband and two children (ages 13 and 16) in Malambo, a metropolitan section of the city of Barranquilla that is five kilometers away from the local airport. This area is also adjacent to the towns of Soledad, Sabanagrande, and Santo Tomás. Malambo is known for having a special demographic composition because the residents are a mix of people from all over the country. They came to work either independently, for a company, or as part of the Malambo Industrial Park, S.A. (or PIMSA), which is an industrial complex that provides a complete infrastructure of services. This complex was designed to ensure cost savings to companies that located their facilities there and would guarantee a sufficient pool of labor to the local businesses.

Eva has a business called “Variedades Eva” (Eva’s Varieties) where she sells sewing supplies, stationery, women’s accessories, and household goods. She has a customer base that knows her because of her work and her warm personality. Her customers can find a little bit of everything they need. Her business was started with the help of her husband, who invested a small amount of capital from his savings when he worked at a company. At first, she began selling various products to her neighbors and gradually over time she acquired display cabinets and more operating capital. As of now, Eva has received 20 loans through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She used the money to expand her customer base, make larger cash purchases, and extend lines of credit to her customers. Eva still remembers the first loan she received, which was in the amount of 180,000 COP. She received subsequent loans and used them to grow. As a result, she was nominated to receive the City Bank Award for her excellence in developing her business. This reflects her growth and the formalization of her business process. Even though there have been significant challenges since starting her business three years ago, the insecurity of recent times has greatly diminished her operating capital. However, this impasse has caused her to move forward intelligently and effectively manage this crisis.

Eva is now applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy sewing supplies, women’s accessories, and stationery. She plans to restock her business with products that sell very quickly. By managing her inventory, Eva will be able to reduce transportation costs and create opportunities to increase her sales because of her ability to obtain good discounts. While Eva moves forward with her daily work, she is able to achieve profitability of at least 30%, which has a significant impact on the welfare of her household.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies, women's accessories, and stationery.

loans.name: Luis  Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Luis solicita su préstamo para poner una losa de concreto al frente de su vivienda, ya que en temporada de calor el sol le da de frente a su casa y esto hace que se sienta más el calor, por la tanto tiene la necesidad de tener los aparatos de aire prendidos casi todo el día y como consecuencia el gasto de la energía eléctrica es muy alto, por tal motivo solicita un crédito con nuestra institución para llevar a cabo este proyecto que beneficiara  y dará comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Luis is requesting a loan so that he can lay down a concrete slab at the front of his home. The heat from the sun makes the front of his house even hotter, which means he must leave the air conditioner on most of the day, causing his electric bill to be very high.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Credituyo so that he can carry out this project which will benefit his family and make them more comfortable.

loans.use: to install a concrete slab in his home.

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María, vive con dos hijos de 18 y 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a una pupuseria y administrar una tienda de productos domésticos, lo atiende de 7:00am a 8:00pm, tiene 2 años de existir y surgió por iniciativa propia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceite, azúcar, churros, gaseosa, frijoles y arroz, con esta compra tendrá más capacidad para atender la clientela y satisfacer las necesidades de ellos.
El sueño de María es mejorar la condición económica de su familia y crecer con el negocio.
texts.en:
María lives with her two children ages 18 and 5. She has a pupusa business [pupusa: a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans] and also runs a convenience store. She tends to her store from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm. She started this business on her own initiative and has had it for two years.
She is now requesting a loan for the purchase of oil, sugar, churros, pop, beans and rice. With this purchase she will have a greater capacity for serving her customers and satisfying their needs. 
Maria's dream is to improve her family's economic situation and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase oil, sugar, churros, pop, beans and rice

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, vive por el sector camino al Tejar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera  ciudad más importante del país, desde 1999 es patrimonio cultural de la humanidad y fue  nombrada así por la belleza de su arquitectura.

Doña María tiene 40 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 6 hijos de 21, 19, 18, 15, 12, 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan  económicamente, su tercera hija es casada e independiente, su cuarta hija pasa en casa y le ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de granizados, la casa en la que habitan es de su propiedad siendo el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de granos cocinados, que los cocina muy temprano en la mañana y los vende en los días de ferias.

Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de granos para continuar con su negocio.

Su meta es crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Las Caleras' community bank.  She lives in Camino al Tejar, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the third most important city in the country.  It was named a World Heritage Site in 1999 owing to the beauty of its architecture.

María is 40 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage who are 21, 19, 18, 15, 12 and 10 years old.  Her two eldest children work and help out financially.  Her third child [a daughter] is married and lives independently.  Her fourth child [a daughter] stays at home and helps her with the housework, and the two youngest children attend school in the city.  Her husband sells 'granizados' (snowcones).  They own the house in which they live.  They acquired it as a result of their hard work.
 
María sells all kinds of cooked grains.  She cooks them very early in the morning and sells them on market days.

This is María's fourth loan through her community bank and she will invest it in buying grains so that she can continue in her business.

Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es: Ligia, tiene la edad de 29 años, está casada y vive con su esposo actualmente. Ella con el crédito va comprar los repuestos para la mejora de su vehículo de trabajo. Ella cuenta con un camión para las labores agrícolas y le sufrió un desperfecto mecánico por lo cual tiene que repararlo para seguir adelante con su trabajo y su proyecto actual. Ella con este camión reparte la mercadería a los clientes de su esposo y lo necesita en óptimas condiciones urgente para seguir prosperando con su negocio cada día. Ella con esta mejorar al camión pretende obtener el mejor rendimiento de este y salir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar la economía de ambos para una mejor bienestar de ambos en el futuro. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ligia, 29, is married and living with her husband at present.  She will use the loan to buy replacement parts to repair her work vehicle.  She has a truck used in farming chores that had a mechanical breakdown so she needs to repair it in order to continue with her work and current project.  She uses this truck to deliver her husband’s customers' merchandise and she urgently needs it to be in optimal operating condition to continue making progress in her business every day.  With a repaired truck she hopes to get better use out of it and to succeed with her project improving both her and her husband’s economy for their better mutual future wellbeing.  This is her first FUDECOSUR loan.  She has had no previous loans from state banks.  Fudecosur has offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to repair her work vehicle.

loans.name: Marvin Andres

texts.es: El señor Marvin Andrés es casado junto a su esposa tienen 3 hijos menores de edad. Su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, tiene más de 4 años en este negocio  pues sabe muy bien que ha sido difícil el mantener a su familia sin obtener un trabajo estable. Desde muy joven le ha gustado  este medio de vida pues siempre esta preocupándose por mejorar cada día más en el servicio con sus clientes. El solicita el crédito para la compra de cremas, tratamientos, perfumes, calzado, bolsos, entre otros. Está muy feliz porque con el crédito otorgado ya podrá obtener los productos que necesita.
texts.en:
Sr. Marvin Andrés is married and lives with his wife and three young children. He has been selling general merchandise for more than four years. Marvin knows very well that it is difficult support a family without having a stable job. Since he was a young man, Marvin has enjoyed working in this manner because he is always concerned about improving each day the service he provides to his customers.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy crèmes, treatments, perfumes, shoes, handbags, and other items. He is very happy with the loan he has received because he will be able to obtain the products that he needs.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, treatments, perfumes, shoes, handbags, and other items.

loans.name: Tsend-Ayush

texts.en:
Tsend-Ayush is 27 years old and lives with her husband and four-year-old son. They live in a small house that is in bad condition. She is a loyal client to Credit Mongol and always pays back her loan on time. His husband works as a carpenter at a local shelter.

She was employed as a seller at a supermarket before her current job, which is as a sales manager at a book store. As mentioned earlier, her house is very old and so is the furniture. She is a very caring mother and wife. She is requesting a loan to renew some furniture in her house in order to have healthier and better living conditions.

loans.use: To renew some furniture in her house in order to have healthier and better living conditions.

loans.name: Saima Rani's Group

texts.en:
Saima Rani is 41 years old, married, and has four children. Saima's husband is a contractor and builds houses and other buildings. He is very experienced in his work. All of Saima's children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education, except the eldest one, who is 22 years old. He left school after completing the eighth grade. He now runs a video game shop.

Saima has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the expansion of her son’s video game shop. With the loan, he will purchase different video games that will allow him to earn more income by encouraging more children from his community to play video games. He has been operating his business for many years, and Saima is very hopeful that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and will increase his income.

Saima is a new loan user with Asasah, and this is her first loan application. She is hopeful that this loan will help her son's business succeed. In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Saima Rani.

loans.use: to buy video games.

loans.name: Fehmida's Group

texts.en:
Fehmida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a vegetable seller. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal vegetables for selling. He is very hardworking person and Fehmida is very much sure that her husband will be able to improve his business condition after the loan investment.

She is a working lady who stitches clothes for her neighboring clients on order to financially assist her husband. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She is the mother of three daughters and a son. Unfortunately, she couldn’t provide education to her children due to her poor financial situation.

Her eldest daughter is 18 years old and supports Fehmida in her sewing work.

Fehmida is hopeful that after the improvement of her husband’s business she will be able to save some profits for the marriage of her elder daughter.

She is a new loan applicant.

Note: In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Fehmida.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El Sr. Richard tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero actualmente vive con su madre en la ciudad de Caaguazú.
Richard tiene una despensa, aproximadamente desde el año 2009. El comenzó administrando lo que fue el negocio de su madre, y cuando ya era mayor de edad le dejo el manejo a Richard. Con esfuerzo y sacrificio el negocio logró tener una gran clientela, y en la actualidad Él realizó algunas reformas de la infraestructura para lograr tener mas éxito en su local comercial.
Solicita este préstamo para comprar artículos de primera necesidad para ofrecer mayor variedad de productos y asi satisfacer las demandas de sus clientes, esos productos consisten en comestibles, bebidas, lacteos y demás.
texts.en: Richard is 20 years old, he is single and lives with his mom in the city of Caaguazu.  Richard has a convenience store, he's had it since 2009.  He begun by helping in the administration of his mother's business and when he became of age she gave it to Raul to manage.  With effort and sacrifice the business reached to a wide client base and now he has done some renovations to have more success at the store.  He requests a loan to buy basic need items to offer a variety of products and satisfy the demand from his clients, these items include food, drinks, dairy and other.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy and other basic products for his convenience store.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino is a farmer in the Philippines who operates a farming business as a source of income. He also engages in the poultry-raising business to generate additional income. He is 40 years old and supports his wife and five children through these businesses. He aims to improve his living and increase his income to satisfy his family's needs, especially the educational needs of his children.

Rufino is now requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to use in developing his farming business. Hopefully, the loan will help grow his business and help him lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to use in developing his farming business.

loans.name: Gloria Amparo

texts.es: La señora Gloria Amparo a sus 41 años de edad es madre de cinco hijos de 18, 17, 15,9 y 6 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de souvenirs navideños y juguetes en una pequeña chaza a la orilla del rio Medellín por donde se exhibe el alumbrado navideño de la ciudad de Medellín. Con esta actividad, la señora Gloria Amparo llevas tres años trabajando en las temporadas de diciembre y en otros meses en las fiestas populares de la ciudad como lo son por ejemplo feria de flores y desfiles. La señora Gloria Amparo necesita de la compra de mercancía para impulsar su negocio y conseguir mayores ingresos en la temporada de diciembre y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Amparo is 41 years old and the mother of five children, ages 18, 17, 15, 9, and 6.  She sells Christmas souvenirs and toys from her small point of sale along the Medellín river, where one can see the city’s Christmas lights.

Gloria Amparo has been doing this for three years, working in December and other popular festive months in the city, such as the flower festival and parades.  Gloria Amparo needs to buy merchandise to set up her business and increase her income in December.  This way she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inventory

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr:
Dopé est une femme âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 4 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 19 ans et le dernier a 8 ans.
Dopé travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2004. Elle vend de la nourriture pour tous clients dans son restaurant. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a pas de difficultés. 
Dopé a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des poissons congelés, du maïs, du riz, du poulet et des boissons. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dopé voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dopé is a 39-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has four children who all go to school. The first-born is 19 and the last-born 8 years old.

Dopé has been working as a restaurant owner since 2004. She sells food to all types of customers in her restaurant. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. At the moment, she has no difficulties.

Dopé has requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy frozen fish, corn, rice, chicken and drinks. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the coming years, Dopé would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy frozen fish, corn, rice, chicken and drinks.

loans.name: Gloria Yane

texts.es: Gloria Yane tiene 44 años de edad, es una emprendedora que inicio su negocio con capital propio, este negocio de venta de queso lo aprendió de forma empírica, donde sus hijos que todavía están a su cargo le ayuda en el negocio. Gloria ya tiene un local en el mercado de la localidad donde ya tiene establecido sus clientes fijos y eventuales que la visita, además lo hace también su servicio a domicilio. Gloria está solicitando crédito para poder abastecer de producto lo cual comprara queso, cuajada, entre otros derivados de los lácteos.
texts.en:
Gloria Yane is a 44 year-old enterpreneur who started her business with her own capital.  She learned this business of selling cheese by doing it. Her children, who are still her responsibility, help her in the business. 

Gloria already has a shop in the local market, where she has already established her regular clientele, and attracts casual visitors as well. In addition, she also does home deliveries. 

Gloria is applying for a loan in order to stock up on merchandise, so she will buy cheese, curds, and other dairy products.

loans.use: To buy cheese, curds, and other dairy products.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Dembagnouman sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans le quartier Pelengana de Ségou et se sont connues à travers leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché Château de Ségou. Les membres du groupe mènent des activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes wax, de condiments et de jus locaux. 
Dans le but de satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle de plus en plus croissants, elles ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Timi (1ère femme en position debout sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de jus dans le quartier de Pelengana. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de sucre, 500 kg de tamarin et de gingembre. 
Pour faire des jus, elle imbibe  les fruits de gingembre et de tamarin dans l’eau pendant 3h au moins. le filtrat recueilli est ensuite aromatisé avec des essences puis on y ajoute du sucre. Le jus ainsi fait est mis dans les sachets et au frais avant la vente. 
Elle se ravitaille en matière première au grand marché de Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et à crédit à domicile et en ambulant à Pelengana à une clientèle mixte. Madame Timi compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants, Madame Timi a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Pour  acheter des ingrédients  pour la préparation des jus locaux

loans.name: Thart

texts.en: Thart, 52, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Chhnang province. Since 1999, she has been selling duck eggs, making around US$17 in income each day. Her husband works in construction, typically make US$3 each day as well.Thart is asking for a loan of US$500 to reinvest in her duck eggs business. She believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: reinvest in her duck eggs business

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Jeannette est une femme dynamique de 31 ans qui vit avec son mari et ses 3 enfants à la campagne. Pour nourrir sa famille, elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine au marché et pratique de l’élevage porcin.
Elle veut prendre un prêt pour augmenter et diversifier les ustensiles de cuisine à vendre et aussi acheter 3 porcins à engraisser. Elle est très connue sur le marché car cela fait maintenant 11 ans qu’elle pratique ces activités. 
Elle espère gagner beaucoup de bénéfices pour assurer les études de ses enfants et finir la construction de sa maison.

loans.use: Acheter des cuvettes, des seaux, des assiettes pour vendre au marché et 3 porcins à engraisser

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fish from the lakes and expand the business.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en:
Suleyman is an IDP from Fizuli district of Azerbaijan. In 1999 he started his private business in Baku with his own resources. 
In 2004-2006 he borrowed 2 loans from Normicro Baku branch and used it for business expansion. Now he borrows 800$ to expand his business further to be able to cover all his family expenditures.

loans.use: to expand business volume

loans.name: Fiapaipai

texts.en:
Fiapaipai G. comes from a family of highly educated people. But Fiapaipai herself is a different case altogether. She took art when she attended school. It was a hobby for her, and her favorite pastime was to create something or paint anything that she could get her hands on. When she was about to retire from work, she decided to start a business that would put her artistic talents to good use and at the same time generate income so that she could fend for herself.

Fiapaipai designs her own patterns and cuts her own designs. These designs feature mainly plant leaves and flowers such as the pua and Samoan mamanu. She used the money she received from SBPD to purchase paints, brushes, and cloth.

Fiapaipai’s husband passed away a long time ago, but she found the courage and determination to continue living. Even though her children are well employed, Pa’i does not rely on them for money. She will use the money she earns to continue living independently and repay her loans.

loans.use: Purchase of paint, brushes, materials

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en: Eight years ago, Yaroslav G. opened a small business for the sale and repair of household engineering, electric, and plumbing systems.  Over that time, he has received and successfully repaid six loans from Nadezhda Ukraine. Combined with his hard work and experience, these loans have helped Yaroslav expand his business into a successful company with twenty-eight employees. Despite some financial hardships, Yaroslav remains focused and committed to improving the standard of living for his wife and three small children. He plans to continue expanding his business and hopes to operate throughout all of Western Ukraine. Currently, Yaroslav is seeking a loan for $600. This loan will help him to purchase a car and thus more efficiently travel between the various locations of his work.

loans.use: Purchase car for work

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.en: I have a small business selling perfumes and creams. I have this business in my house. I am a hawker. I visit offices and my neighbors. They are clients than I have. Now I need to buy products to be able to increase my sales in these months. With this business, I help my husband with the expenses that we have with our children.

loans.use: Purchase lotions, creams, and gels for the body and the face.

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.ru:
In the past, Uguljon would come out to the market and help her sister sell goods on the market. Over time she decided to start her own business. Her husband provided her with the startup capital. She has also obtained a loan from MicroInvest. Since then, her business has gotten significantly larger. Uguljon is 45 and married. Both her husband and her elder son work. Her younger son and her daughter help her with the business. She purchases a portion of her goods from wholesalers at the market where she works. She also purchases goods in the city of Hudjan, located 35 kilometers away from where she lives and works. She plans to continue increasing the size of her business, which is the reason why she is seeking to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Раньше Угулжон выходила на базар помогать своей сестре торговать. Постепенно она решила самостоятельно заняться бизнесом. Для этого ее муж дал денег для начального капитала. Еще она получила займ в Микроинвест. С того времени ее бизнес заметно расширился. Угулчон 45 лет, она замужем. Ее муж и старший сын работают, младший сын и дочь помогают матери на базаре. Товар она покупает у оптовых продавцов здесь же на базаре и еще ездит за товаром в г. Худжанд который находится в 35 км. Она собирается и дальше расширять свой бизнес и хочет получить для этого новый займ.

loans.use: Increase the size of the business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
"My wife and I have a notions and paper supply store, which has been a lot of work and sacrifice to make it successful but now we need a little money to be able to invest in the purchase of merchandise and thereby increase our earnings." I am asking for US$1000 to invest in my business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

“Mi esposa y yo tenemos un negocio de Mercería y Papelería, nos ha costado mucho trabajo y sacrificio levantarlo pero ahora necesitamos un poco de dinero para poder invertir en la compra de más mercancía y así poder aumentar nuestras ganancias”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para invertir en mi negocio

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alim

texts.en: Alim is single, 25 years old and lives in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan.  Alim has been in the taxi business for 2 years. Now he needs a loan of $850 to buy spare parts for improving his taxi and business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar B. owns and operates a wood working shop in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Vugar is 22 years old and has been working in this field for a number of years already. He specializes in making custom doors for his customers. He is currently looking for funding so that he can invest in his business by purchasing new tools for his shop.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for his wood working shop

loans.name: Sreydy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreydy D. (pictured with her mother) and her husband have been married since 2006 and have one son. She works in a garment factory. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and does construction work. The couple lives with her mother who grows rice. Their home is approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. D. is requesting her third loan in the amount of $800. She will use this money to purchase a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Doris' Group

texts.en:
Haydee, Martha and Doris have been part of the Legioncito Comunal Bank for 2,2,1 years respectively. They learned to be responsible, punctual and mainly to save.

Haydee is 37 years old with 2 children. Haydee makes empanadas and desserts, which are baked in a rented oven, and sells them in street fairs.

Martha is 36 years old, married with 2 children. Martha has a small convenience stO., which is run from her home. Additionally she makes chocolates, which are exported to Colombia. Her son helps her in this activity.

Doris is 23 years old, married and has 1 child. Doris sells spices, which she makes herself, in the “Las Americas” farmers market.

Haydee, Martha and Doris need a loan of 600 soles, 400 soles and 400 soles, respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of flower, sugar, chocolate, nuts, pepper and cumin.

The dreams of Haydee, Martha and Doris are to have their own established business, to build their own house and to send their children to college.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Haydee, Martha y Doris pertenecen al Banco Comunal Legioncito hace 2, 2, 1, años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar y administrar bien el dinero.

Haydee es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, Haydee hace empanadas y otros postres que son horneados en un horno alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Nery García ambulantemente.

Por otro lado Martha es casada, tiene 36 años y 2 hijos, Martha tiene una bodega surtida en su casa. Además, Martha hace chocolates rellenos D. manjar, productos que envía a Colombia, actividad que realiza con su hijo.

Mientras que Doris es casada, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Doris venD. condimentos en el mercado Las Américas, productos que elL. misma prepara.

Haydee, Martha y Doris necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 400 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. harina, azúcar, chocolate D. cobertura, manjar, ají, maní, pimienta, comino.

Los sueños D. Haydee, Martha y Doris son tener una empresa, brindar una buena educación y alimentación a sus hijos, construcción D. casa y mejorar su calidad D. vida.

loans.use: Haydee, Martha and Doris need a loan of 600 soles, 400 soles and 400 soles, respectively, money that will be invested in the purchase of flower, sugar, chocolate, nuts, pepper and cumin.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
The business of selling Andean food products has become the main income of Gregoria and her beloved family. She is a diligent mother, an entrepreneur, and very responsible that with persistence, will, and faith, the family situation will improve. With help from her husband she has always carried out this noble profession; together they acquire the Andean food products in markets in the various villages bordering their city and then sell them at economic prices in one of the principal markets in the city of Juliaca. The dream of this humble couple is to increase the amount of their investment, both believe that increasing and expanding the merchandise volume will improve their income and therefore their quality of life. It is with this objective that they turn to you and respectfully ask for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio D. venta D. productos andinos se ha convertido en el ingreso principal D. doña Gregoria y su amada familia. Ella es una madre diligente, emprendedora y muy responsable que con empeño, voluntad y fe viene sacando adelante a su familia.Con apoyo D. su esposo ha desempeñado siempre este noble oficio, juntos adquieren sus productos andinos en las ferias D. los distintos pueblitos aledaños a su ciudad para luego venderlos a precios económicos en uno D. los mercados más comerciales D. la ciudad D. Juliaca.El deseo D. esta humilD. pareja es incrementar el monto D. inversión, ambos creen que aumentando y amplificando el volumen D. mercadería mejorarán sus ingresos económicos y por enD. su calidad D. vida.Es con ese objetivo que recurren a ti para solicitarte gentilmente un préstamo.

loans.use: Increase of working capital in order to offer greater quantity of products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in women's clothing and silver jewelry for a small business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business of selling fruits and vegetables in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Djerry

texts.fr:
Mr. Djerry Sidibé is 37 years old and lives with his four children and wife in the district of Torakabougou in the Bougouni region in Sikasso in the Republic of Mali. He worked at a phone booth kiosk for two years before he decided to become self-employed. He has mastered this business.

In order to obtain the necessary complimentary resources for the development of his business, he approached Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso. With this loan, he is hoping to buy a significant amount of prepaid calling cards (Orange and Malitel) and a Sotelma-Malitel telephone (a national telephone company in Mali).

He generally buys his stock in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali and sells these cards retail in his own telephone booth kiosk.

With this loan, Djerry Sidibé hopes to earn a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. He hopes to pay for the interest of the loan and support the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur Djerry Sidibé a 37 ans et vit avec ses 4 enfants son épouse dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni.Région de Sikasso République du Mali. Il fut 2 ans durant employé d’une cabine téléphonique avant de décider de s’installer à son propre compte. Il a une grande maîtrise de cette activité. Pour obtenir des ressources complémentaires indispensables à l’épanouissement de son affaire il approche Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle institution il est à sa premiere expérience. Il compte acheter avec ce pret une importante quantité de cartes de recharges prépayées(Orange et Malitel et un appareil téléphonique de la Sotelma- Malitel(une compagnie de téléphonie nationale du Mali). Il s’approvisionne très généralement à partir de Bamako capitale de la République du Mali et vend ses cartes essenteillement en détail au niveau de sa cabine téléphonique. Avec ce prêt, Djerry Sidibé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA. avec lequel il va payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase prepaid calling cards (Orange and Malitel) and a telephone

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in jewelry in order to keep operating her business.

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es: El profesor C.,  de 42 años, separado, con 2 hijos 1 varón de 7 años y una niña de 11 años, ambos estudian la primaria. En estos momentos está en proceso de separación y ha tenido que dejar su casa y todos los bienes a sus hijos, trabaja como director del Instituto San Sebastián de Acoyapa, desde hace 14 años. Solicita su 3er crédito el que necesita con urgencia ya que está habitando en la casa de los nuevos suegros y tiene que hacer una división para un cuarto para habitar con su nueva pareja. El Señor C. ha sido un excelente cliente con el pago de sus créditos anteriores demostrando responsabilidad. Espera muy pronto pder tener su propia casa en donde habitar con su nueva familia, y donde también poder recibir y atender a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Professor C. is 42 years old, separated from his wife, has 2 children, a son 7 years old and a daughter 11 years old, both of whom are in elementary school. Today he is in the process of getting a separation and he had to leave his house and his things for his children. He has worked as the director of the San Sebastián Institute in Acoyapa for 14 years. He is seeking his 3rd loan, which he urgently needs, as he is now living in the home of his new partner's parents an dhe has to make a wall for a room for himself and his new partner. C. has been an excellent cliente and has paid his previous loans responsibly. He hopes to soon be able to have his own home where he can live with his new family and also where he will be able to host and take care of his children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make walls for a room

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro M., 51, is a farmer who lives in Chrey Krem Village, Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 1979. Currently, he earns approximately US$1.50 per day. He is married to Mrs. Ty Nhep, 52, who is a housewife; in other words, Ty stays home to care for their children and to cook food for the family. Indeed, Ty has a difficult task because they have eight children, four of whom are married while the other children are young and attend school.

Unfortunately, Saro's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of 700,000 Riel (US$175) to purchase fertilizer to use on his rice crop. Ty hopes the loan will allow him to increase his rice yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on his rice crop

loans.name: Mawussi

texts.fr:
Né en 1985 Davié, monsieur A. Mawussi vit à Adétikopé. Soudeur de formation, il fabrique différentes sortes d’objets métalliques. Célibataire, il exerce efficacement son activité. 
Pour accroître ses revenus, il sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des tôles et barres de fer pour la fabrication et la vente d'objets métalliques. Ainsi il pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et prendre correctement en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Monsieur Mawussi A. was born in 1985 in Davié, Togo, and lives in Adétikopé. As a trained welder, he makes a variety of metallic objects. He is single and an efficient worker. In order to increase his income, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase sheet metal and iron rods to make and sell metallic objects. This will enable Monsieur A. to make his business profitable and properly take care of his family.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell metallic objects

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokun S., 31, and her husband, Mr. Pov Prich, 36, live in a small village across the Mekong River about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1997 and have two children. Their son studies in primary school and their daughter is still young and is at home. 

Mrs. Sokun has been selling fish for eight years. She buys them from a fishing lot for resale to the middleman in her village.  Her husband has been producing rice wine and raising pigs for three years. The couple want to expand their pig raising business. Therefore, Sokun is requesting a loan to purchase more pigs to raise.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to raise.

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en: Orepa M., 63, is married with 6 children.  She has 1 year of experience with her shop business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (about USD $250).  SPBD loans are Orepa’s only access to capital because she does not qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase soap, milk, chicken, lamp flaps, flour, sugar, rice and onions to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 37-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Hassan has been working as a school bus driver for a year. He likes being independent.

He requests a loan of $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his bus and pay his debts. This is the first time that Hassan has requested a loan. In the future, he plans to purchase a bigger bus.

loans.use: Do some maintenance work on the school bus and pay debts

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Mrs. Norn M. is a villager in Trapaing Kok village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Oun Chrin, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a fisherman to earn their living.

Mrs. Norn M. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, eight more piglets, and to build a piggery for her pig-breeding business. She hopes to increase their income and improve her family's living conditions with this loan. She is 59 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, eight more piglets, and  build a piggery

loans.name: Betty Barzaba

texts.es:
La señora Betty Barzaba A. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen de Guadalupe”, del barrio central, en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 06 hijos y posee estudios de primaria incompleta (quinto grado). 
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 12 años, ella posee una tienda de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que invirtió en la compra mercaderías para su tienda. 
Actualmente requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 05 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo ella desea implementar y mejorar su tienda, es decir adquirir algunos andamios mas y completar con mercadería variada (bebidas, abarrotes de primera necesidad, aceites, leche, etc.), con lo cual podrá satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes y obtendrá mejores ingresos, su anhelo es brindarles una adecuada educación a sus hijos, y es por ello que viene empeñada en ahorrar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Betty Barzaba A. G. is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” Community Bank of the Barrio Central in the Pomata district of Chucuito province, in the Puno region of Peru. She’s 48 years-old, married, has six children and has a 5th grade education. She owns a grocery store and has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 12 years. She used her first loan of 300 soles to purchase merchandise for her store. Now she needs an additional loan of 1200 soles, which she is committed to repaying in 5 monthly installments. With this loan she wants to improve her store i.e. purchase some more shelving and stock a wider variety of merchandise (beverages, basic groceries, oil, milk, etc.) to satisfy her customers’ needs and make better profits. Betty is saving up so that she can give her children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her store and purchase merchandise (beverages, oil, milk etc.)

loans.name: Benita Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el municipio de Ciudad Sandino de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Benita labora en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa ofertada todos los días en su propia casa de habitación. Es de importancia destacar que ella ha atravesado difíciles situaciones económicas pero tiene un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio.

Actualmente ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito ya que requiere la compra de la ropa para ofertarla en su negocio y así suplir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
In the township of Ciudad Sandino in the city of Managua, Benita works away at her little business selling clothes every day from her own home where she lives. It is important to emphasize that she has gone through difficult financial situations, but she has a great talent for excelling in her business.

At this time, she has turned to Ceprodel to obtain a loan as she needs to buy clothes to offer for sale in her business, and in this way to supply for her own needs.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Luz Victoria

texts.es:
LUZ VICTORIA S. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”, con domicilio ubicado en el Jr. Luis Escavino Nº 171, en el distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 36 años de edad. Se dedica a la venta de comida, de jugos y gaseosas, su esposo es transportista y tienen 3 hijos.

Ella tiene 2 años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y el primer préstamo que obtuvo fue un monto de S/ 300 Nuevos Soles, lo utilizó para comprar gaseosas y vender jugos, con el fin de contribuir económicamente en su hogar y hacer trabajar su capital. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200. Nuevos Soles, lo cual invertirá para surtir su negocio con la venta de comida, jugos, gaseosas y carbón, con el propósito de seguir haciendo trabajar su capital y contribuir económicamente en su hogar.

Se encuentra agradecida con Manuela Ramos, porque la apoya como por medio de los créditos y las charlas que le brindan las promotoras, permitiéndola seguir invirtiendo y prosperando en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz Victoria S. S. belongs to the community bank "Las Margaritas", located at Jr. Luis Escavino Nº 171, in the district of Callería, city of Pucallpa. She is 36 years old and works selling food, juice, and soft drinks. Her husband works in transportation and they have 3 children. She has worked for 2 years with Manuela Ramos and the first loan she obtained was for 300 nuevos soles. She used it to buy soft drinks and sell juice, and the loan contributed to help with the economic status in the home and to grow her capital. This loan of 1,200 nuevos soles will be used to supply her business of selling food, juice, soft drinks, and coal, with the goal of continuing to increase capital and help her household out financially. She is thankful for Manuela Ramos because they support her through loans and discussions that help her develop her business, allowing her to invest in her business so that it prospers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy juice, soft drinks, and coal

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Mrs. Liza C. started her membership with Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, in September of 2003. She is 40 years old, married and blessed with three children. Two of her children are studying in elementary school and the other one is already married. She is a resident of Barangay Magsaysay, Baliangao Misamis Occidental.

She is considered a member in a good standing. In fact, she seeks her 16th loan for a rice-field cultivation project to purchase sacks of fertilizer and a bottle of pesticide. These are very important in rice-field cultivation. Now she is glad and inspired, managing her project together with her husband. She's very thankful to Paglaum MPC for the financial assistance that gives them armor to fight poverty.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en:
Funmilayo F. sells clothes and cosmetics. She is 38 years old and married with three children.

She hopes for a loan in the amount of N30,000 to purchase more clothes and cosmetics to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Nafeesa Raees Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Shahida baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 
Musarat baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy mason tools. 

Nafeesa baji is the wife of R. A. who has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the last 12 years. Her husband runs a decorative embroidery business. He sells embroidered dresses to the cloth shops and buys from the famous markets of Lahore “Ichra and Shahalmi”. Nafeesa baji herself has a dairy business. She grows the animals (goats) and then sells their milk to the milk shops and earns income. With the income, she renovated her house. She is applying for a loan to buy embroidered dresses to grow her husband’s business.  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy embroidered dresses to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 38 years old, married, and has two infant children. Jean owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Jean joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jean is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mordina

texts.en: Mordina I. sells ice-cream by hawking it (going door-to-door) within her community in Benin City, Edo State. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more ice-cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice-cream to sell

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture above are Mrs. Chea S. and her husband with their grandchild. This older couple has always cultivated a rice crop and they have this crop as annual business. They also grow rice enough for their family’s eating.

The main source of their family’s current income comes from Chea S.’s work in selling grocery items in front of her home. She makes around of $3 each day to meet her family’s needs. Chea S. has two married children, all of whom earn a living as domestic farmers. 

Chea S. says that her business is currently too small because she lacks money to sustain her business' growth. She would therefore like a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, for capital which she will use to accumulate a larger quantity of merchandise into her store supply for resale.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a forty-two-year-old woman who is married with three children who are currently in school.

Comfort is a food vendor and sells banku. Banku a local Ghanaian dish prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. It is believe to be a native food for the Ewe tribe in Ghana but other tribes enjoy it too. Comfort has many customers since it is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch and supper.

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy more ingredients like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to raise more income to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making banku

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita C., a 61-year-old widow with five adult-aged children, is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, Conchita sells fish. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3000 PHP.

In 2008, Conchita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Conchita's second from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Reynalda es socia del Banco Comunal Milenio.
Reynalda es viuda, tiene 57 años y 8 hijos, Reynalda venD. medias, ropas interiores, actividad que realiza todos los días D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Clara, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima.
Reynalda necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. medias.
Los sueños D. Reynalda son tener un local propio para su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de medias.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mr. Sarin H. lives in Koul village in Takeo province. He breeds ducks and pigs. Since his poultry business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing 250 more ducks for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Chan Sokha, uses the rice to make wine to sells to support her household. Mr. Sarin H. is 42 years old and the father of two children, one of whom is employed in a Casino club and the other is attending the local school. His wife is presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: By purchasing 250 more ducks for breeding.

loans.name: Maria Yakeline

texts.es: La Sra. Yaqueline vende comida en  la Feria de Barrio Lindo los días miércoles y sábados ,también vende en el mercado La Ramada los días lunes y viernes , entre los platos que ofrece son el  Picante de Pollo, la Milanesa de Pollo , Fricase de cerdo(comida tipica boliviana), Chuleta de cerdo, Bife y otros. Cuenta con el apoyo de dos ayudantes para la preparación y distribución de los mismos en el mercado como en la feria atendiendo solo al medio día y culminando a las 14:00.La señora emprendió este negocio hace cuatro años atrás desde entonces sus platos son muy solicitados y requeridos. Con esta actividad pudo comprar y construir su casa. El sueño que tiene la señora al margen de mejorar su vivienda  principalmente su cocina, es la de poder adquirir un vehiculo para el traslado de su producto a los centros mencionados para tener mayor comodidad en el traslado como en el recojo de sus ollas y demás utensilios.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yaqueline sells food in the Barrio Lindo market Wednesdays and Saturdays and she also sells in the market La Ramada Mondays and Fridays. Some of the dishes that she sells include spicy chicken, milanesa chicken (thin strips of chicken, dipped in egg and seasoned with breadcrumbs and shallow fried in oil), pork fricassee (a pork dish accompanied by boiled corn a type of dehydrated potato, served in its own broth seasoned with yellow ají pepper—a typical Bolivian food), pork cutlets, steak and others. She has the support of two helpers to prepare and distribute the food in the markets and works alone in the afternoon and ends at 2 p.m. Mrs. Yaqueline began this business four years ago and since then her dishes are sought after and required by her customers. With this activity she has been able to buy and build her home. Her dream is to improve her home, especially the kitchen, and to have a car to move her products to the markets as well as the convenience to move her pots, pans and other utensils.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in fixed assets (to buy an oven).

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang C. and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Sem, were married in 1993 and they have four daughters. One of them is a garment factory worker, two attend school and the other one is still young. They live in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Leang is now a tailor. Her husband has been driving a motorbike taxi in Phnom Penh for over ten years. Unfortunately, his motorbike is old and doesn’t work well so he spends a lot of money on repairs. Therefore, Leang is asking for a loan of $700 to buy a new motorbike for her husband to replace the old one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Suzith

texts.en:
Suzith L. is from Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 29 years old. Suzith is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Suzith owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Suzith has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Suzith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Suzith is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Suzith from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 54 years old and is a widow with four children. She lives in Oyo state and has been in business for 12 years. She owns a restaurant where she sells drinks and pepper soup. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Janet is requesting a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thank you and promises to pay her loan back promptly.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Hilda Maurina

texts.es:
Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal Pura Vida.
Hilda es separada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Hilda vende comida típica en el recreo de su mama, actividad que realiza los días domingos, además Hilda viaja a las ferias en donde compra animales que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Hilda en los próximos días apertura su tienda de abarrotes.
Hilda necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, arroz, fideo.
Los sueños de Hilda son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios, comprar un carro para su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Pura Vida” (Pure Life). She is 38 years old, separated from her spouse, and has four children. Hilda sells traditional food at her mother’s resort every Sunday. In addition, she travels to the fairs where she buys animals to sell in the city of Ayacucho. She plans to open a grocery store within the next few days.

Hilda needs a loan of 3000 soles to purchase milk, rice, and noodles. She dreams of seeing her children complete their studies and purchasing a car for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
