loans.use: Purchase milk, rice, and noodles

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie A. is a 34-year-old mother who is focused on her family’s dream. She lives in the Coastal Place of Talim Island, Binangonan, Rizal, Philippines with her loving husband and two kids. The couple works hard to provide a better education for their children's future and they want a better life as well.

They decided to join the Kiva field partner, ASHI, in 2009 to get capital for their fishing business. They have requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. They will invest this capital to reconstruct fish cages and to buy more fishnets, bamboo and fingerlings (small fish). Winnie also has a secondary source of household income, which is hog fattening (raising pigs).

She hopes to build their own beautiful house, expand her fishing business and to have a larger space for their fishing equipment. She also dreams of a successful pig farm business. 

The family feels very happy with the loan that helped their lives to become improved from before. Winnie will continue praying and wishing all lenders the best of luck, and she hopes they will continue to support poor families like them, who want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To recontruct fish cages, buy more fishnets, bamboo and fingerlings(small fish).

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is 45 years old and lives in her own house in Pilar in the San Francisco neighborhood.  She relies upon basic amenities for her well being.  

Clotilde sells clothing for a living.  She has a well-formed client base in her city and in the interior part of the country.  She offers a variety of types of clothing of varying qualities.

She is seeking a loan to purchase clothing for her business.  She is thankful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that it has given her.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Helena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene más de 5 años de ser cliente de Fundación, por lo que en todo este tiempo ha logrado aprovechar sus financiamientos con el objetivo de mejorar su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene 7 años de mantener activo este negocio, que implica levantarse temprano, conversar con sus clientes y comprar sus productos, algo de lo que Maria está acostumbrada pues su trabajo forma parte de su vida. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de lápiz labial, joyas, perfumes, ropa en general y calzado. Su deseo es mejorar cada día con la atención de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Elena has been a client of the Foundation for over five years. In all of that time she has used the loans to improve her business. She sells general merchandise, and she has kept this business going for seven years. She needs to get up early, talk with her customers, and buy her products. These are things that Maria is used to because her work is part of her life. She is asking for this loan to buy lipstick, jewelry, perfume, general clothes, and footwear. Her wish is to everyday improve the service she gives her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lipstick, jewelry, perfume, general clothes, and footwear

loans.name: María Nela

texts.es:
La señora María Nela M. V. tiene 34 años de edad,  casada, Madre de tres niños, dos de ellos en edad escolar, comerciante desde hace  nueve años su negocio lo tiene ubicado a cuatro cuadras del Mercado central, ahí ella alquila ese local.
La señora V. anteriormente era ama de casa pero con el tiempo le fue gustando el trabajo de su esposo y ahora los dos administran ese negocio, abren el negocio a las ocho y media de la mañana y lo cierran alas cinco y media de la tarde de lunes a sábados los días domingos lo dejan para sus hijos.
Tiene cinco años de trabajar con ceprodel, este financiamiento ella lo solicito para comprar algunos tipos de venenos para plagas ya que es un producto que no deja de vende y el cual casi no tenia en existencia esperando que este producto le ayude a las ventas malas que ha tenido. En los financiamientos que le hemos dado le han ayudado a remodelar su casa y su negocio ya que ahora tiene mejor acondicionado su negocio y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Nela M. V. is 34 years old and married. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are school-aged. She has been a merchant for nine years. Her business is located four blocks from the Central Market. She rents her place of business. Ms. V. used to be a homemaker, but over time she came to like her husband’s business and now the two of them administer it. They open the business at 8:30 in the morning and they close it at 5:30 in the afternoon, Monday through Saturday. They spend Sunday with their children. She has been working with Ceprodel for five years. She is requesting this loan to buy various types of poisons for pests because this is a type of product that always sells well. She hasn’t had this product well stocked and she has been waiting to buy it to help her with the poor sales she’s been having. The loans we have given her have helped her to remodel her house and her business. Her business is now better equipped and her quality of life is better.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for my business, such as poison for ants, other pests, etc.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta C. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 61 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Vicenta owns and operates a buying and selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from peddling dried fish and some agricultural products, such as banana and coconut fruit, harvested from her small farm and selling it to tourists and local community members. Vicenta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Vicenta joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Vicenta is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sorn T. is 52 years old and is the village bank president of her group, which consists of 12-members, located in Toul Sala village in Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use it to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes. Mrs. Sorn T. and her husband, Mr. Yaem Rin, are farmers who own a plot of land. They cultivate rice to earn for their family's cost of living. In this farming, Mrs. Sorn T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed for growing rice. This couple has two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy rice seed.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
Esther A. is from the town of Gud, San Isidro. She is 42 years old. Esther is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Esther A.'s group.

Esther is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esther joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Esther is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Esther from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Bertha viene formando parte del Banco Comunal Damas en Progresos desde hace 7 ciclos y con los créditos ha salido adelante junto a su familia, ya que le ha tocado enfrentar la vida como madre soltera de 4 hijos.

El negocio de la señora Bertha es  la venta de mangos, grosellas, papitas fritas y dulces, en un triciclo, ya son 7 años que viene realizando esta labor, la manera de trabajar es salir de casa desde muy temprano, sola en su triciclo siendo ella misma quien lo conduce,  al preguntarle el porque decidió por este negocio, esto fue lo que nos comentó:” cuando era niña sus padres por el hecho de ser de bajos recurso no le pudieron dar los estudio,no tenia educación y no podía trabajar en ningún otro negocio, es por eso que decidió por este trabajo.”

El negocio de nuestra señora Bertha lo realiza de lunes a viernes a la salida de clases en las escuelas, y los fines de semana. Con ella vive su nieto quien lo tiene a su cuidado, ella se las ingenia para poder llevar a cabo su  trabajo.

 Con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia Bertha podrá incrementar su negocio, comprando todo lo que vende, como lo son los mangos, grosellas y golosinas en general.

 En la mañana se dedica a la casa, sábado y domingo sale todo el día a vender, compra lo que necesita en un lugar especifico, trabaja todos los días para poder hacer realidad su sueño que es tener su casita propia.
texts.en:
Our member, Bertha, has been a part of the Progressive Women’s Community Bank for the past seven loan cycles. With these loans she has progressed with her family. She is a single mother with four children. Bertha sells mangos, gooseberries, French fries, and sweets from a tricycle. She has been doing this for the past seven years. She leaves the house early in the morning on her tricycle. She herself rides the bike. When asked why she decided to do this business, this is what she said. When she was young her parents, lacking resources, were not able to educate her. She is is not educated and therefore cannot work in another business. This is why she decided to do this business. She works from Monday to Friday after school gets out and also works on the weekends. She also cares for her grandchild. She carries out her business in a creative way. With this new loan Bertha will grow her business. She will buy everything that she sells such as mangos, gooseberries and sweets in general. In the mornings she takes care of her household chores. Saturday and Sunday she sells all day. She buys everything she needs in a specific place. She works all these days in order to achieve her dream of having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mangos, bananas, gooseberries and papayas

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia M. is from the city of Calibo St., Dipolog City. She is 55 years old. Lydia is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Lydia owns & operates a business providing tailoring services to local community members. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 33 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 3,000.00 PHP which will be used to purchase additional capital for her business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly O. is a 54-year old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: sari-sari (general) store, buys and sells herbal medicine and sells Avon products.  She lives in Sitio Quiao, Alijis, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. 

Nelly has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  By working hard she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of PHP6,000 monthly. 

Nelly is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy more products for her store.  This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of PHP15,000, was paid off well within its term; it was another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Nelly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

-----------------------------
About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 24 años, es una joven trabajadora y honesta, vive con su pareja Joel, de 27 años y su hijo Arnold de 3 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica a sembrar papa y de diferentes variedades, además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es albañil pero en sus ratos libres ayuda a Marcelina. Lo que más le gusta es cosechar sus frutos, porque sabe que al comercializarlos, verá recompensado su esfuerzo y trabajo constante. Considera además rentable esta actividad agrícola, puesto que le brinda satisfacciones económicas, por tal motivo desea sembrar en mayor proporción, así como una nueva variedad de papa denominada “mama lucha”. Por otro lado desea instalar un negocio de venta de comestible en su casa. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y está feliz porque podrá continuar trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, a quienes respeta por su perseverancia. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico y semillas de papa.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 24, is a hard working, honest young woman. She lives with her significant other, Joel, 27, and their son, Arnold, 3. They live in their own home. For over 2 years she has farmed a variety of potatoes. Her husband is a bricklayer but in his spare time he helps her with her farming chores. What she most enjoys about her work is harvesting because she knows that when she sells her products her work and efforts will be rewarded. She considers farming to be profitable work because it affords economic satisfaction. For this reason, she’d like to plant larger plots as well as a new variety of potato known as “mama lucha.” In addition, she’d like to set up a food sales business in her home. This is her 4th loan with MFP. She is happy to be able to continue to work with the members of her communal bank whom she respects for their perseverance. She will use the requested funds to buy sacks of organic manure and potato seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic manure and potato seed.

loans.name: Deidamia Marilin

texts.es:
Deidamia Marilin R. J., tiene 23 años.  Es casada y vive con el esposo y los hijos,  en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Nataly (5) y Paul (1). 

Deidamia es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Y”, que está ubicada a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 17 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Deidamia  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra naranja. Realiza sus compras cada semana donde el señor Gerardo y vende la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de naranja y cacao desea sembrar a futuro. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener un negocio propio e incrementar los ingresos. Enfrenta desafíos es la falta de dinero.

Le gusta el comercio y salir a vender las naranjas.
texts.en:
Deidamia Marilin R. J. is 23, married, and lives with her spouse and children in the Ventanas province in Los Rios. She has two children, Nataly (5 years) and Paul (1 year). Deidamia is a member of the rural community bank, the “Y”, which is located an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 17 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture. This is the first loan they have taken out with the San Jose Cooperative. Deidamia works in agriculture, planting oranges. She makes her purchases every week in Mr. Gerardo’s location and sells in the same place. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of oranges and cocoa that she wishes to plant in the future. She thinks the loan is an opportunity to get ahead in life. Her dreams are to have her own business and to increase her income. The challenge she faces is a lack of capital. She enjoys business and going to sell the oranges.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of oranges and cocoa that she wishes to plant in the future

loans.name: María Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora María Luzmila T. es socia del banco comunal Cumbe, vive en el centro de la  parroquia Cumbe, esta parroquia es conocida por su exuberante vegetación y su  clima frió, su gente se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, mucha de su población joven a migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora María Luzmila se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura produciendo variedad de hortalizas, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes y gallinas a los cuales los vende en su propia parroquia.

Doña María  tiene 50 años, es viuda hace 22 años y tiene 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y casados, cinco de ellos viven de manera independiente y solo su último hijo es quien le acompaña y comparten los gastos del hogar, con el sacrificio de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra trabajando con los créditos de la fundación hace 6 años y le han beneficiado en la compra de animales y semillas para sus siembras,  su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos para la cría, su meta es tener más animales para su negocio.
texts.en:
María Luzmila T. is a member of the Cumbe communal bank. She lives in the center of Cumbe parish. This parish is known for its lush vegetation and cold climate; its inhabitants make a living from ranching and farming, though much of the younger population has left in search of better jobs. María has made a living from farming since she was very young. She grows a variety of vegetables, and also earns money raising guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells within her parish. María is 50 years old, has been widowed for 22 years, and has 6 children. All of her children are adults and have married. Five of them live independently, while the last son lives with her and shares the household expenses. María has managed to build her own house through her own hard work. María has been working with loans from the foundation for 6 years and has used them to purchase animals and seeds for her plants. She will use her new loan to purchase chickens that she will raise. Her wish is to have more animals for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing chickens to raise.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: El Señor Joel  junto con su esposa se dedican a la venta de ropa, los señores tienen un hijo pequeño, esta venta lo realiza en las distintas ferias de la ciudad, también llevan a las ferias de las provincias el y su esposa realizan este trabajo a diario, ellos quieren ahorrar y tener mejores condiciones para  vivir, ambos tienen planes de ser grandes comerciantes y así poder comprarse un lugar donde puedan vivir juntos y tranquilos y cuidarle mejor a su hijo y darle una educación mejor que la que tuvieron ellos, con el dinero del crédito desean comprar ropa para niños por docena y así poder ganar algo mas para así incrementar su capital de trabajo .
texts.en:
Sr. Joel and his wife have a small child and support themselves by selling clothes. They sell their products at the different fairs throughout the city as well as the provincial fairs. He and his wife work every day because they want to save and have better living conditions. Both of them have plans to become successful merchants, and they want to buy a place where they can live together peacefully, take care of their child, and provide him with a good education.

With this loan, Joel and his wife will buy children’s clothing by the dozen so that they can earn more income. This will help them increase their operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase children's clothing by the dozen

loans.name: Nancie Estrella

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal los Jazmines.

La señora Nancie tiene 46 años, está casada hace 24 años y tiene cuatro hijos dos ya son mayores de edad y dos menores que están aun estudiando en el colegio pero todos viven en su casa, su esposo es ebanista y trabaja en el centro de la ciudad. 

Ella desde hace tres años con la ayuda de una amiga empezó un negocio de venta de ropa por catalogo y artículos de bazar, tiene su local que aunque es pequeño está bien surtido para el gusto de sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 20h00 y como está en su casa a veces hasta un poco mas tarde de acuerdo a las necesidades de sus clientes. Dice que lo que más vende son cosméticos y bisutería y en cuanto a la ropa la entrega bajo pedidos. Sus productos los adquiere en Quito y Guayaquil una vez por mes.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en poner una puerta enrollable que le ofrezca más seguridad. Está en el Banco Comunal hace varios ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado.
 
Sus metas son seguir mejorando día a día en su negocio y en su vida.
texts.en:
Every 15 days Los Jazmines Communal Bank meets in the neighborhood of Los Jazmines located in Portoviejo, the capital city of of the Manabi province which has been well known for years as the city of the Real Tamarinds. Nancie is 46 years old, she has been married for 24 years, and has four children; two of which are older and two who are still underage and in school, but they all live in her home. Her husband is a cabinetmaker and works downtown in the city. Thirteen years ago with the help of a friend she started a business selling clothing through catalog and selling other variety items. She has a small location but although it is small it's well stocked to meet her client's demands. She works everyday from 8AM until 8PM but sometimes stays longer since she sells from home, it depends on her customer's needs. She states that she sells cosmetics and jewelry the most and clothing orders are fulfilled upon order placement. She stocks on product once a month from the cities of Quito and Guayaquil. The loan will be used to install a roll-up door for security. She has been a part of the Communal Bank for some time and likes them due to the help they have offered her. Her goal is to continue improving her business and her life.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a roll-up door.

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda B., photographed with her only baby, is from the town of Talibon. She is 31 years old and married. To make a living, Criselda has a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She does her best to keep the farm productive.

Criselda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Maria Jose Dias

texts.pt:
Maria José Dias M., nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, é divorciada mãe de 8 filhos de 25 aos 45 anos de idade nenhum deles vai a Escola, todos estão empregados. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e responsabiliza se pala sua neta que vive com ela em sua casa.

Maria é obrigada pelos pais a abandonar os estudos para se casar com um marido que eles atribuíram a ela. Assim ela recusa se e sai da casa dos pais para casa do namorado, que por ela foi escolhido. Começa a trabalhar na OMM (Organização da Mulher Moçambicana) como Educadora, anos depois é contratada para trabalhar na Escola Secundaria da Namaacha na sensibilização das alunas internas e como Modista daquele recinto Escolar. É funcionaria permanente ha 8 anos, tem um salario de 2.500.00mt que aplica nas despesas da casa, mas conta também com ajuda dos seus filhos no valor de 3.000.00mt mensal e ainda tem inquilinos em sua casa que pagam 1.500.00mt por mês, assim ela consegue poupar algum no final de cada mês.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, este é o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende custear as despesas de legalização do seu terreno e fazer reabilitação das janelas da sua casa dando assim mais conforto a sua família. Os três empréstimos anteriores no valor de (5.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt e 10.000.00mt) foram usados para comprar material de construção. 

Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir mais empréstimo pois pretende abrir uma fábrica de sabão no Distrito.
texts.en:
Maria José Dias M. was born in Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique.  She is divorced and has eight children between 25 and 45 years old.  None of them attend school; they are all employed.  She lives in her own house with her family and takes care of her granddaughter who lives with her.

Maria's parents made her abandon her studies to marry a man they chose for her.  She refused and left her parents' house to move to her boyfriend's house.  She began to work at OMM (Mozambican Women's Organization) as an educator.  Some years later she was hired to work at the Namaacha Secondary School educating the boarding students and working as the school dressmaker.  She has been a permanent employee for eight years.  She has a salary of 2,500 meticais which she uses for household expenses, but she counts on her children's help for 3,000 meticais monthly, and she also has lodgers in her house who pay 1,500 meticais per month.  In this way Maria manages to save some money at the end of each month.

She has never had loans from other banks.  This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva.  She is asking for 15,000 meticais, which she intends to spend on purchasing the title to her land and replacing the windows in her house so her family can be more comfortable.  The first three loans were for 5,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 10,000 meticais, and were used to buy construction materials.

Maria is confident that she will pay off the loan ahead of schedule and ask for another loan since she intends to open a soap factory in the District.

loans.use: Purchase title to land

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie M. is 42years old. She is married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures, a Sari-sari(general) store and a food vending business. Elvie lives in Sin-sin, Bato, Toledo City, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Sari-sari store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. Elvie is now borrowing PHP 15000 that she could use as additional working capital. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elvie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way.

 About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, aged 39, is a married mother of two children, ages sixteen and seven, respectively. Her husband is a farmer who specializes in dairy farming and supplies different customers.

Susan has been buying and selling maize for five years and has been earning good profits from this business, especially when the supply is low and demand is high. She was introduced to Kadet by an existing client. With this first loan she plans to buy additional bags of maize since this is the season when prices are low.

Her future plan is to own a lorry, which she will use to transport maize bags to her customers, which will improve efficiency and customer satisfaction.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer - Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal "NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO"; la socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kris Milagros, La socia tiene 29 años de edad ella es soltera y tiene 1 hijo;  la socia se dedica a administrar una agencia de viajes y turismo, la agencia de la socia está ubicada en la ciudad del Cusco; la socia desea poner en su casa en el primer piso junto a sus parientes un depósito de cerveza, para lo cual está solicitando el préstamo, ella y su familia atenderán en turnos que se les haga posible la administración y la atención de este su nuevo negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en un depósito de cervezas que la socia pondrá en su casa.

Los otros socios se dedican a comercio minorista, ellos se dedican a la administración de su restaurante, bar karaoke, a la atención de una ferretería, y otros dos socios se dedican a la atención en el area de promotores en espectaculos.

La socia agradece el préstamo que se le otorgará y se compromete a seguir trabajando con mucho ahincó para cumplir con los pagos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Kris Milagros is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER - CUSCO" ("New Dawn - Cusco") community bank.  She lives in Huanchac district in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Kris Milagros is 29 years old, single, and has one son.  She runs a travel agency, which is located in the city of Cusco.  She and her relatives want to open a beer shop on the first floor of their house, which is why she is requesting this loan. She and her family will take it in turns to run this new business. She will use the requested loan to install the beer shop in her home.  

The other members of the bank are small traders.  They run a restaurant, a karaoke bar, and a hardware store, while two  group members work promoting live shows.

Kris is grateful for this loan and promises to keep working hard so she can meet her payments and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of beer to sell from her home.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en: Mr. Vuthy C., who we see in this photo, is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Touch Vy is 30 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 2001 and have three sons. Two attend primary school and the third is too young to attend school. Vuthy has made a living painting cars for the last 11 years. His wife works in a garment factory. He is asking for a loan of $500 to repair the house where he and his family live

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Nov S., 46, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-ankorean temples. Nov and her husband produce rice wine and sell snacks, earning an income of USD 4 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 30 on other necessary expenses every month.

Nov is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a water pump to water the rice fields, and in the future plans to use any additional profit to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie L.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has one school-aged child. They are from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Rosie has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,300 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rosie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to invest in expanding the business. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya E. is 69 years old and has three children. She graduated from Pedagogical University and worked as a teacher of the Russian language for 33 years. Her colleagues characterize her as a very optimistic and responsible person. Now she is retired and earns her living through breeding cattle. 

Zoya got started in this business 20 years ago when her family needed additional earnings to cover their expenses. Thanks to her persistent and hardworking personality, Zoya managed to make her business successful and today earns about 8,000 KGS monthly. Using the revenue from reselling fattened livestock, she was able to hold daughter’s wedding. 

Zoya plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to broaden her business by purchasing more cattle. With the revenue from this investment, Zoya plans further development of her farm. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Pablo De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero y reside en el caserío La Estancia; que se encuentra ubicado en el  distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Pablo se dedica hace dos años a la compra y venta de  ganado ovino y caprino, los cuales cría en un  ambiente cerca de su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ayuda a su familia.

Pablo desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas debido al aumento de la demanda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Pablo is 33 years old, single and lives in the village of La Estancia, located in the district of Olmos, a rather commercial agricultural area in the province of Lambayeque that's located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. Pablo has made a living for the past two years buying and selling sheep and goats, which he raises on land near his home. When the animals reach a good level of development he sells them to the general public and to the businessmen who frequent the area. He helps his family with the income from this activity. Pablo wishes to expand his business by purchasing more animals as well as balanced feed so he can increase his sales to go with the increased demand. To do that, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a thirty-seven-year-old married woman with eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, longing to own a car for the family. She has been growing onions for five years amidst hardships in transportation to the different markets, and her business desire is grow onions on at least ten acres of land. Betty needs the loan to buy onions for planting.

loans.use: Buying onions for planting

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
Doña María de 66 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive junto a su esposo, un hijo y una nieta, se dedica a la venta de tamales y verduras, este negocio fue fundado por iniciativa propia, aprendió de su madre y trabaja todos los días de 5:00am a 4:00pm desde hace 5 años.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, aceite, hoja de banano, pollo y condimentos, estos productos son los que utiliza en la preparación de tamales, por lo que esta inversión le será de mucha ayuda para contar con todo lo necesario para realizar su venta y aumentar la producción.
El objetivo de doña María es mantenerse en el negocio, tener siempre ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 66 years old and lives in San Miguel with her husband, son, and granddaughter. She works selling tamales and vegetables, a trade which she learned from her mother. She started the business out of her own initiative and she has worked every day from 5am to 4pm for the past five years.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of corn, firewood, oil, banana leaves, chicken and condiments. These are the products that she uses when making tamales, which is why this investment will be a great help to her so that she will have everything necessary to make her sales and increase her production.

María’s goals are to maintain her business and to always have income to cover her and her family’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, oil, banana leaves, chicken and condimients

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a fifty-year married man with six children .He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer and also distills alcohol. Andrew started with three acres of banana trees which he used to make alcohol. Later he diversified into maize growing. He dreams of educating his children and buying a car to help him in business. Andrew wants a loan to plant maize and pay for labour.

loans.use: to plant maize and pay labourers.

loans.name: Rudy Manuel

texts.es:
Don Rudy de 47 años de edad, es originario del municipio San Juan del rio coco,  en Estelí se dedica a reparar zapatos, esta casado, es padre de familia de 6 hijos de los cuales tiene dos a su cargo, pues los demás son independientes, sus origines humildes no le permitieron seguir estudiando solo llego hasta segundo grado de primaria no tenia los recursos económicos. Inicio esta actividad por la necesidad de trabajar, con el tiempo le fue gustando y además le da de comer a el y su familia, este a sido su único negocio, trabaja desde su casa, su esposa es profesora de una escuela primaria, se ayudan mutuamente en las tareas del hogar, pues su trabajo le permite permanecer cerca de sus dos hijos mas jóvenes que están en la secundaria. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar material de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar, componer el techo de su casa. Pues así podrá tener un hogar mas seguro mejorara las condiciones de su zapatería. Desea tener maquinas de cocer zapatos modernas y brindar un mejor servicio. Su próxima meta es aumentar sus ventas de zapatos para venderlos en diferentes tiendas y consuman productos hechos por el y sobre todo poder pagarles una buena educación a sus hijos para evitar que pasen la situación de pobreza e ignorancia que le toco vivir a el por no poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Rudy is 47 years old and from San Juan del Rio Coco, in Estelí.  His business is repairing shoes.  He is married and has 6 children.  Two of his children are still in his care and the others live independently.  Rudy's humble origins meant that he was unable to complete his education.  He only reached the second year of elementary school as he didn't have the financial means to continue.

Rudy started this business because he needed to work.  Over time he came to enjoy it and it also fed his family.  This has been Rudy's only business.  He works from home.  Rudy's wife is an elementary school teacher.  They help each other with the household chores as his work allows him to remain near his two youngest children who are in high school.

Rudy requested this loan to buy construction supplies so that he could improve the infrastructure of his home and repair his roof.  This will make his home safer and improve the conditions of his cobbler's workshop.  He would like to own modern shoe stitching machines and provide a better service to his customers.

Rudy's next goal is to increase his shoe sales so that he can sell the products he makes in different stores.  He would like to pay for a good education for his children so that they don't have to suffer the same situation of poverty and ignorance that he did due to the fact that he couldn't study.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to improve the infrastructure of his home.  To repair his roof.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús Z. A. habita en casa propia con sus tres hijas dos de las cuales se encuentran cursando sus primeros años de estudio. Teresa se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y sobre todo luchadora. Como cualquier madre responsable, ella sueña con ver a sus pequeñas hijas convertidas en profesionales y no pierde la esperanza de que algún día logrará su sueño. Ella se dedica a la venta de diversos productos como: lociones, cremas, jabones, productos comestibles  como galletas, etc.  No posee un puesto en donde ofrecer sus productos por lo que los comercializa de manera ambúlante en el Municipio de San Vicente del Departamento de San Vicente, durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado de esta forma y es  así como se gana el pan de cada día. Sus productos los vende con facilidad gracias a su carisma y compromiso en su trabajo. Ha tomado la decisión de aumentar  la variedad de productos que ofrece con el fin de atraer a más clientes y así poder seguir dando a sus hijas lo necesario. Para poder cumplir su sueño necesita de este crédito que solicita a INTEGRAL  para poder comprar variedad de cremas para el cuerpo, cremas para el cabello,  lociones (para hombre y mujer), jabones, maquillaje, y de más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera  aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús Z. A. lives in her own home with her three daughters who are in their first few years of attending school. She is known for being an enterprising and extremely determined woman. Like any responsible mother, Teresa dreams of seeing her young daughters become professionals. She does not lose hope of someday seeing her dream come true.

Teresa sells different products such as lotions, crèmes, soaps, snacks such as cookies, and other items. She does not have a vending post where she offers her products, so she sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor in the town of San Vincente in the Department of San Vicente. Teresa has spent great amount of time working in this manner so that she can earn a living. Her products sell easily due to her charisma and her commitment to her work. She decided to expand the variety of products that she offers so that she can attract more customers and continue providing her daughters with what they need.

To fulfill her dream, Teresa decided to request a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy a variety of body crèmes, hair gels, lotions for men and women, soaps, makeup, and other products that are popular with her customers. By working in this manner, she hopes to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase body crèmes, hair gels, lotions for men and women, soaps, makeup, and other products.

loans.name: Abdrahamane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdrahamane F. est un homme marié de 35 ans et père de 2 enfants, qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez lui même à Bougouni, dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord.
Après des études secondaires sanctionnées par un diplôme en commerce et marketing, il est resté pendant des années sans emploi. C’est ainsi qu’après une longue réflexion il décida d’apprendre auprès de son ami des activités d’achat et de vente des appareils électroniques.
Avec 6 ans d’expériences, il maitrise son activité d’achat et de vente des appareils électroniques, dans laquelle il est très sollicité et apprécié.
C’est dans le cadre du renforcement de ses activités, qu’il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son premier prêt.
Il compte acheter avec son prêt diverses sortes de petits articles électroniques. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali) et effectue sa vente au marché de Bougouni et une partie dans les villages environnants les jours des marchés hebdomadaires. Il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices il envisage agrandir son entreprise.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdrahamane F. is 35 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in Bougouni, in the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood. After completing his studies and obtaining a diploma in business and marketing, he stayed unemployed for several years. After a long reflexion, he decided to learn buying and selling electronic devices with a friend.

Having six years of experience, he masters his business buying and selling electronic devices, and he is very much sought after and appreciated. In order to bolster his business, he decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is seeking his first loan.

He intends to use his loan to buy various small electronic items. He gets his supplies in Bamako, the capital of the Republic of Mali), and sells at the market in Bougouni, and in the surrounding villages on the day of the weekly fairs. He intends to turn a monthly profit of XOF 35'000 (ca US$ 75), to be used to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy various small electronic devices

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNOGOTALA, composé de sept femmes toutes mariées, ont   une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 4 enfants et vivent majoritairement dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA HAMEAU un des villages de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et tous les prêts passés ont été remboursés dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de riz à travers BINTOU, qui compte acheter avec son  prêt,  une tonne de riz, auprès des paysans producteurs du village et des villages voisins.  Le riz est  revendu au  marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail et au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75.000FCFA qu’elle utilisera  pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
KOTOGNOGOTALA is a group composed of seven women, all of whom are married. They average 35 years of age and 4 children. Most of them live in polygamous families in BOUGOULA HAMEAU, one of the villages of Sikasso, 3rd administrative region of Mali.
This is their 8th collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance insitution. All their previous loans have been repaid in good conditions. This group of women is in the rice business through BINTOU, who, with this loan, intends on buying one ton of rice from the farmers in her village as well as surrounding villages. The rice is then sold retail and for cash, both at the market and door to door, to a clientele of men and women.
She expects to make a monthly profit of 75.000FCFA, which will be used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy rice

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 18, has worked in manufacturing aluminum since 2005. Ali was very young when he started in this business, but it was necessary for him to work because of his parents' rough financiA. situation. Ali left school after the third Intermediate level. He tells us that he cannot say whether or not he misses school since he considers his family's needs to be his first priority.
 
Ali is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time. With it, he plans to expand his business by addng a glass work department. This is the first step in moving toward his planned future business, which will involve specializing in windows and kitchen closets as well as storefront displays. Ali is confident that this expansion will offer considerable value to his customers and will allow him to take another step toward his eventuA. future business.

loans.use: to expand his business by addng a glass work department

loans.name: Berlina

texts.en: Berlina is 52 years old. She is married with four children. Berlina has a shop that sells different kinds of bananas. She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy green and yellow bananas. Berlina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Berlina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 33 years old .He is married and a father of two children.

He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area, which has proved to be good for wheat farming. He learned about KADET through KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan. He is planning to use the loan to prepare his wheat farming. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming, to increase his wheat production and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer.

Dickson is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to prepare his land for wheat farming

loans.name: Arise Club Group

texts.en:
John is 28 years old and has been in the motorcycle transportation business in Mpigi for seven years. The good-humored father of two is a go-getter who knows the only way to get enough to survive is to work hard and put in long hours, sometimes burning the midnight oil. Mpigi is not so busy a town and it’s small. This means John has to strain every nerve to make ends meet most of the time. Most people are poor and cannot afford even basic commodities. It becomes difficult, therefore, to get clients who are willing to part with the modest money they have.
This is not a business for the faint-hearted and John knows it. It is not in his nature, however, to sulk nor is he predisposed to depression. He has to provide for his family and handle his other responsibilities. He therefore has no choice but to work hard. John also does some modest commercial farming at his small village farm. He grows bananas, cassava, maize and beans. His weekly business sales profits total 70,000 Shillings. John says he will use his Kiva loan to purchase better spare parts for his motorcycle and also maize and bean seeds to plant.

loans.use: to purchase better spare parts for his motorcycle and also maize and bean seeds to plant.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es: El joven Rogelio es una persona muy responsable con su trabajo que tiene desde hace 4 años, en una empresa que da servicio de paquetería en toda la república y el la recibe en esta ciudad y reparte a su destino. Hace ya mas de 3 años adquirió su vivienda de interés social, la cual necesita construir una barda al frente para que esta mejor protegida; de algún delincuente que quiera robar alguna pertenencia de Rogelio que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación ha ido comprando. Para poder realizar su proyecto el necesita comprar material para iniciar la construcción y pagarle a la persona  mano de obra, todo para que el tenga mas tranquilidad al irse a su trabajo.
texts.en: Rogelio is a responsible young man who has worked for 4 years in a company that delivers packages all over the country.  He receives the packages in this city and delivers them to their destination.  3 years ago he bought a home in public housing.  The house needs a fence in the front for more security against a delinquent who may want to steal some belongings that Rogelio has worked hard to buy.  For this project he wishes to purchase material to begin the construction and to pay the  labor. This fence would give him peace of mind when he goes to his work.

loans.use: to build a fence

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El  señor  Julio  tiene cincuenta y cuatro  años  de edad , se dedica al servicio automotriz.
Tiene un hijo varón quien se llama Ángel  de  veinte años de edad .
Esta  muy contento  por que la va muy bien en su negocio  van muchas personas ya que les brinda  un buen servicio ,  aparte de dedicarse al servicio  automotriz , hace trabajo  de  electricidad.
Es un señor muy trabajador , siempre le ha  gustado  el trabajo de automotriz su padre Ricardo le enseño ya que su papa desde chico trabajo en eso.
Pidió el préstamo para  comparar  mas material para  su local de servicio automotriz ya que  su inventario esta muy escaso.
Uno de sus sueños  es  que su hijo termine de estudiar la lic. en contabilidad ya que el solamente  estudio hasta  la primaria terminada.
Le da las gracias a fundación  por el apoyo que le ha dado  para salir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y por ser parte de ellos .
texts.en:
Sr. Julio is 54 years old and provides automotive services. He has a son named Ángel who is 20 years old. Julio is very pleased that he is doing very well in his business since he provides many people good service. In addition to providing automotive services, he performs electrical work. Julio is a hardworking gentleman who always enjoys performing automotive jobs. His father Ricardo taught him this trade when he was a young man.

He is requesting a loan to buy more materials for his automotive service shop since his inventory is very low. One of his dreams is to see his son finish his studies and complete his accounting degree. The only classes he has completed are his basic courses.

Julio is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support it has provided so that he can move forward and fulfill his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase automotive supplies.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en:
Jean Batiste is a father of five children among which the eldest is 22 years old. He is a Rwandan rice farmer and he has been doing farming for the past 40 years.

He will use Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: paying labour for his rice farming.

loans.name: Katana

texts.en:
Katana is a single man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is business rent bills.

For the past year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop and from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. Katana dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale one in the future.

With the KSHS 15,000, he wants to purchase household consumptions, bundles of maize four, wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking fat oil and sugar.

loans.name: Grizelda

texts.en:
Grizelda is married, with 9 children. Grizelda is 44 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Grizelda has a mooring services business. She has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 10,000. Grizelda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

She has requested a loan of PHP11,000 to purchase a pump boat for her mooring services business.  In the future, Grizelda hopes to have an expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase a pump boat for her mooring services business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: El señor Esteban tiene un taller de costura donde elabora deportivos los que vende en la localidad de Yacuiva  y también lleva al Brasil, el Sr. Esteban comenzó desde muy pequeño a trabajar en el área y ahorrando poco a poco logro equipar su taller de costura y como en todo negocio este tiene su estacionalidad en el año de acuerdo a temporada, a su vez el sr. esteban tiene clientes fijos para que de esta manera su taller siga en actividad, cabe destacar que al taller se le aumento una maquina bordadora computarizada, demostrando así, el crecimiento del taller, con el dinero del crédito comprara tela por cantidad, le va muy bien en su negocio pero su deseo es poder confeccionar muchas mas prendas de vestir y poder contratar nano de obra y brindar oportunidad a otros jóvenes que aprendan del oficio, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superarse se encuentra agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Esteban has a sewing workshop where he makes sweatsuits which he sells at a locale in Yacuiva. He also takes them to Brazil. Esteban started when he was very young, working in the area and saving. Little by little, he was able to set up his sewing workshop. As in all businesses, it has its seasons of high demand during the year. Esteban also has regular customers that keep his workshop busy. It is worth noting that he added to his workshop with a computerized bordering machine. With it, he is demonstrating his workshop's growth. With the money from the loan, he will buy fabric in large quantities. It is going very well in his business but he wants to make more types of clothing and be able to hire workers and offer opportunities to other young people who can learn the trade. He is a young person who really wants to get ahead and is grateful to the institution for the support it has offered.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is single and blessed with two children. She has been selling clothes for the last 14 years to make a living. She describes her business to be busy because her potential customers are passersby. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy shirts and ties for resale. Beatrice expresses gratitude to Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.

loans.use: To buy shirts and ties.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Jane has a food shop or canteen that sells snacks such as rice cakes and halo-halo (flavored, crushed ice). She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Jane is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is a single mother of five school-aged children. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Salama has operated a fabric retail business for the past five months; in addition she runs a beauty salon. Her potential clients are her neighbours and friends. She faces a major challenge of inadequate capital to run her business. She dreams of expanding her business.

With a loan of KES 15,000, Salama wants to purchases more fabric for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its low loan interest rates.

loans.use: to purchases more fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es:
El Sr. Ceferino tiene 41 años de edad, es un hombre  muy trabajador, está acompañado con la Sra. Juana, hace 12 años, tienen tres hijos juntos Juan, Sara y Elias, viven en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo hace mas de 12 años.
El Sr. Ceferino es Mototaxista hace 5 años, vivía en el campo con sus padres pero decidió ir a vivir en la ciudad pensando en el progreso suyo y el de su familia.
Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado porque en las épocas de invierno tiene que pasar por muchos obstáculos debido a que tiene menos pasajeros porque hace mucho frío. Su sueño es comprar mas motos para trabajar y así progresar cada día mas.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para su mototaxi, ya que este es su medio de trabajo y es indispensable para el.
texts.en: Ceferino is 41, he is a very hardworking man, he's been with Juana for 12 years, they have three children; Juan, Sara and Elias, they live in the city of Cornel Oviedo.  Ceferino is a motorbike taxi driver, he has been for five years, he used to live in a rural area with his parents but he decided to move to the city thinking about his future progress and his family's.  he indicates that his job is hard because during winter he has to overcame obstacles due to having less passengers because it's very cold.  His dream is to buy more motorbikes to work and make more progress.  He requests a loan to buy repair parts for his taxi because being the bike his work equipment, it's indispensable for him that it works.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Katosia Group

texts.en:
Ben is the facilitator of the Katosia group. Ben and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Ben and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Ben takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to send his children to school and secure enough food for his children. In the recent 2011 season, Ben had a very good maize yield harvesting 17 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ben was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Ben will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Katosia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Ben is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Goorgoorlu Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 09juillet 2002. Il  est  constitué de quinze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Maguette qui est à la gauche de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge dix autres enfants confiés par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de petit déjeuner. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
Goorgoorlu Group was formed in solidarity on July 9, 2002. It consists of 15 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their primary business is shopkeeping.

Madam Maguette who is on the left of the photo raising her hand is responsible for the group. She is 55 years old. She is married and mother to three children. She also takes care of 10 other children entrusted to her by her parents.

She actively sells breakfast. She has good experience in this domain, where she has been working for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and to better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, nutrition, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy breakfast products.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertrudes is 41 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 12 years old. Gertrudes's husband is a farmer.

Gertrudes has had a sari-sari store business for 5 years. She sells items like canned goods, noodles, shampoo and soap. Gertrudes earns 3000 PHP per month with her business.

Gertrudes requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and coffee. She hopes that this loans helps her business grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and coffee.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Maricel has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Maricel has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Nuevo Amanecer es de la Ciudad de Carapeguá.   Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 12º ciclo con 19 integrantes, son mujeres con  deseo y ganas de superación, son muy activas, y por sobre todo muy trabajadoras y luchadoras.
La Sra Carmen es una de ellas  su labor de todos los días se basa en venta de chipas (alimento típico de Paraguay) de forma ambulante por las mañana y por las tardes. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que pese a ello le gustaría poder seguir en el.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar las chipas que vende, como ser almidón, manteca, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Amanecer [New Dawn] group is from the city of Carapeguá. Currently, the group is in its twelfth loan cycle, with nineteen members. The women, who desire to improve their lives, are very active, not to mention very hard-working, and prepared to overcome any obstacles.
Carmen is one of them. Every day she works selling chipas (traditional Paraguayan food [bread made from cassava dough])  on the streets in the mornings and afternoons. She says that her work requires sacrifice, but in spite of it, she would like to continue with it.
She is requesting the loan to purchase the ingredients necessary to make the chipas she sells, such as cassava dough, butter, condiments, etc.

loans.use: to purchase cassava dough, butter, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña guapa está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Caacupé, sus integrantes se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder salir adelante.
La señora Mercedes es una de las integrantes, ayuda al Sostenimiento de su familia con la venta de ladrillos, comenta que tiene muchos pedidos, y que gracias a la ayuda que recibe dentro de su grupo ha podido crecer mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de arcilla, para poder seguir con su elaboración y venta de ladrillos, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo.

loans.use: Comprar arcilla para hacer ladrillos.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane was born 31 years ago in Kiambu Kenya. She is a single mother with two children. After finishing her secondary level education, she could not continue to college because her father could not afford to pay her tuition and instead he opted to educate other children to at least the same level like hers.

Her father gave her USD 60 to start a small business. She bought two piglets which she looked after for 6 months and later sold them. She made a profit of USD 150, it has been her business ever since. In 2003, Jane joined WEEC and received a loan of USD 150. She bought 6 piglets which she looked after for 6 months to make sure they are big enough. Jane paid her loan promptly and made good money, she does not bother the Dad any more and she is able to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Jane would like to buy about 7 pigs of different age in order to have a steady supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grace would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Fei

texts.en: Fei is a smiling, happy woman.  She is a mother of six.  Two of her children have moved overseas to find work, but Fei is happy living in Samoa and committed to remaining in her homeland and working hard to support the four children that remain in Samoa with her.  Fei makes flavoured ices (locally referred to as “ice cakes”) that she sells in her village.  She enjoys the work, and is applying for a loan to help her purchase bulk supplies of purified water, sugar and cordials to make her product.

loans.use: Supplies for making ice cakes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia is married and has four daughters, one of whom lives with her. Her husband works as a chauffeur at a construction company. Each of her daughters help her with her business. She began her business by selling used clothing that she no longer wore, after which she purchased clothing in bulk and began selling it in her home. With time her business grew and today she sells clothing in her home and in three markets. She began this in order to support her husband with general expenses as well as because she is a hard working woman and she has a knack for sales.

Amalia is asking for a loan of $275 in order to purchase products and therefore be able to offer better products to her clients. Understanding that their their tastes change over time, she would like to have the best in order to have better sales. She would like to pay back this loan in 3 months and is very thankful for the support your support so that she can continue to expand her beusiness and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Amalia esta casada y tiene cuatro hijas de los cuales una de ellas vive aún con ella, su esposo trabaja como chofer en una empresa constructora, todas sus hijas la ayudan en el negocio, ella empezó vendiendo ropa usada que ya no la ocupaba y después compro ropa por pacas y empezó vendiendo en su domicilio, con el tiempo fue creciendo y ahora vende en su casa y en tres mercaditos, empezó para apoyar a su esposo en la economía familiar, también empezó con el negocio por que es una mujer muy trabajadora y tenía gustos por las ventas por ello es que poco a poco lo hizo crecer.

Amalia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería y así tener más surtido y poder ofrecer mejores productos a sus clientes, sobre todo siempre que hay cambios de temporada ella desea tener lo mejor para tener mejores ventas, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses y te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindes para que continúe con el crecimiento de su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús is an entrepreneurial man and lives with his partner in common-law union. They have three children, one of which helps him in the business in addition to a relative who also collaborates in the production and sale of steamed breakfast tacos. He began his business to help with household expenses and at the same time to cover the costs of study of his children and their basic upkeep. He began his business 18 years ago by selling tacos in both his house and on a highly-trafficked street, counting for himself already an almost fixed clientele.

Jesús is asking for a loan of $650 to buy a burner with 4 grills which will help by allowing him to give better attention to his clients as well as be able to make more tacos in less time. He is offering to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you very much for the help which you give him in being able to follow through in creating his business and being able to continue with it in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Jesús es un hombre emprendedor y vive con su pareja en unión libre, ellos tienen tres hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos le ayuda en el negocio, además de un familiar que también colabora con el en la elaboración y venta de tacos mañaneros al vapor. Él empezó con su negocio para ayudarse con los gastos de su hogar y a la vez poder cubrir los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos y manutención de los mismos. Empezó con su negocio hace ya 18 años vendiendo tacos en su casa y vende en una avenida muy transitada, contando ya con una clientela casi fija.

Jesús está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para comprar un quemador de 4 parrillas el cual le servirá para poder otorgarle mejor atención a sus clientes y además poder hacer más tacos en menos tiempo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder seguir con el crecimiento de su negocio y poder continuar con el mismo.

loans.use: Purchase of work equipment

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica is married has 6 children and takes care of 3 dependents. She has run the retail store in this picture for the last 5 years. The store has a lot of character and charm. There is a comfortable bench in front that allows people to gather and visit. It is very inviting. I don’t know what it is about this place, but it just draws you in. It’s on a busy, large pathway in her village. Out front she sells local food, bananas, tomatoes, onions and avocados. Inside she sells eggs. Lots and lots of eggs. Floor to ceiling, wall to wall, eggs. I asked her if she had layers. She said no, but everyone in the village that needs eggs comes to her.

With her loan, she hopes to restock her store with rice, salt, sugar and of course, eggs. Her dream is to one day own her own home.

loans.use: Scolastica plans to user her loan to buy rice, salt, sugar and eggs for her retail market

loans.name: Casilda

texts.en:
Casilda is a single mother of two. She is in the popular business of taxi rental, and owns a taxi and a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a covered seated area attached to carry passengers) that she rents out daily.
