She rents to the same people each day, and charges 30 Soles ($10) for the taxi and 25 Soles ($8.25) for the mototaxi. Casilda also buys clothes wholesale and sells them from her home. Christmas is the busiest time of year for this, especially for Christmas dresses for girls.

Casilda’s two sons, ages 24 and 23, both live with her. Her older son is working at a supermarket chain in Lima, and her younger son works for her with her taxi rental. She has been with her village bank for 10 years and says it has helped her a lot. Her dream for her business is to open her own shop to sell her clothes. She also has a goal of buying her own home. With this loan of $175 Casilda will fix the tires on her taxis and perform other necessary maintenance, and she will also purchase dresses to sell for Christmas.

loans.use: To fix the tires on her taxis and purchase dresses to sell for Christmas

loans.name: Ma

texts.en: Mrs. N. Ma, 28, is a housewife with two little kids. To service in her family’s expenses, her husband works driving a taxi, earning about $10 each day. Mrs. N. Ma has humbly requested for a loan to replace her husband’s old ruined taxi, which needs habitual repairs and wastes her family a lot of money. With a new car, she believes it will increase her family’s savings and raise their standard of living. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. N. Ma is unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi to replace his old ruined one.

loans.name: Marystella

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! MaryStella M. is 30 years old, she is married, and she does not have any children. In 2000 MaryStella established a photography and digital services business and she now seeks a loan in order to purchase a digital camera and a pinnacle capture card. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA:
SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing whereby SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA will purchase equipment from said client, extend a loan to her, and then lease the same equipment back to her – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; therefore, financial institutions do not consider Tanzanian women to be credit-worthy because they lack tangible assets that could serve as collateral. As a result, Tanzanian women with low income receive poor financial support and meager access to basic needs and services. SELFINA thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase a digital camera and pinnacle capture card.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is a married mother of five. She supports her family and husband, who is a mason, by selling bowls and chicken feed. She is requesting $525 to buy a wider variety of bowls and kitchenware in hopes to improve her income and profit.

Mary is also a member of a lending group called “Wisdom Group”, which consists of 14 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of bowls and kitchenware.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry M. and her husband have been married for twenty five years. They have five children—three sons and two daughters. One of their daughters is married and lives outside the family home. as for the other four children, two are employed full time and other two are in school. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. has been a fish seller for twenty five years. She buys the fish in her village for resale at market. Her husband is a security guard at a company in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. M. is requesting a loan for the second time. She is asking for $1000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for his work, and to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale and a motorbike

loans.name: Marilud

texts.es:
La señora Marilud P. Izuza  se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Su tienda se encuentra ubicada en el  Jirón Ambrosio Saavedra S/N del distrito de Puerto Rico, departamento y  provincia de San Martín , ella desarrolla este negocio  hace 03 años. 

El  préstamo de 1000.00, que será pagado en 6 meses,  lo invertirá en la compra de vestidos, polos, pantalones   para  niñas y niños, pantalones jean y polos de diferentes marcas para damas y caballeros. Para surtir su negocio busca satisfacer a sus clientes en todos sus gustos y estar siempre actualizada con la moda.

Ella tiene 29 años de edad, tiene  un hijo. Se caracteriza por ser gentil y muy atenta con sus clientes. Preocupada por sacar adelante a su familia y por ser un ejemplo para  su hijo.

loans.use: Con el prestamo comprara mas mecaderia para su venta

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi D., 57 years old, is the fifth member of TYM Fund. Her children are all grown-up and building their own family. Only her youngest child is still attending university. Before, Mrs. D. used the borrowed money to buy material (sedge) to weave mats. This activity brought her a stable income and was also very convenient for repaying weekly. During these recent years, Mrs. D. sells sedge mats to improve her income. Now, she is owning a motorbike, and is free from worries about tuition for her youngest child. Her average income is 220 USD/month. This time, Mrs. D. wants to borrow 950 USD to buy sedge and mats.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị D., 57 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 5 của Quỹ Tình thương. Con cái chị đều đã trưởng thành và có gia đình, chỉ còn người con út học đại học. Các vòng vốn trước chị D. vay vốn về mua nguyên liệu (cói) để dệt chiếu. Công việc này mang lại cho chị một nguồn thu ổn định và rất thuận lợi cho việc hoàn trả tuần. Trong những năm gần đây, chị D. còn buôn bán chiếu để nâng cao thu nhập. Qua các vòng vốn chị D. đã mua được xe máy, con chị cũng không còn phải lo lắng khi xin tiền đóng học phí. Thu nhập hàng tháng hiện nay của chị khoảng 220USD. Vòng vốn tới chị D. xin vay 950USD mua cói và chiếu về bán.

loans.use: Buy sedge and mats

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Moa K., 42, is married and lives with three of her children in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband work together in a fishing business, selling their catch in the market, earning about $5 each day; their family is also supported by two of the children who are construction workers.  Heavily dependent upon weather conditions, the fishing business is a difficult one. Moa K. is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase some new equipment to replace gear that is old and in need of repair.  She would also like to purchase a new net,  which will allow her to increase her daily catch and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Maman Filicité

texts.fr:
Mrs. D., 24, married and mother of 3 children, was born in Davié and now lives on the outskirts of the city of Lomé. A seamstress by trade, she is the owner of a workshop called “COUTURE DAME FELICITE”. She is specialized in sewing women’s fashions so she has an essentially female clientele. Since 2005 she has added to her business the sale of costume jewelry for women. But Mrs. D. did not stop there. She also sells charcoal since she is married to a chauffeur who brings back charcoal that she warehouses and sells in small quantities.

This first loan will allow her to purchase 40 sacks of charcoal and some jewelry to expand her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 24 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants, madame D. née à Davié habite aujourd’hui à la périphérie de la ville de Lomé. Couturière de profession, elle est propriétaire de l’atelier « COUTURE DAME FELICITE ». Elle est spécialisée dans la couture en couture dame ce qui fait qu’elle a une clientèle essentiellement féminine. Depuis 2005 elle associa à son activité, la vente de bijoux pour femme. Madame D. ne s’est pas arrêtée là. Elle vend aussi du charbon car elle s’est mariée à un chauffeur qui lui ramène du charbon qu’elle stocke et vend en détaille.

Ce premier crédit lui servira d’acheter 40 sacs de charbon et des bijoux pour augmenter son stock.

loans.use:
Purchase and re-sale of charcoal and costume jewelry

Achat et vente de charbon de bois et de bijoux

loans.name: Mrs. Khut Nary Group

texts.en: This group, which located in Chrouy Ampil Thmey Village in Kandal Province consists of four members and Mrs. Khut N. is the group leader who was born in 1957.  She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Her business is going well and she now wants to expand it. She has therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Doem Duong, is a construction worker who generates a small income to support his family. Mrs. Khut N. is 51 years old and the mother of six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other two assist their parents business. The remaining three are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Ernesto Javier

texts.es: Ernesto Javier B. tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de Managua. Su compañera de vida es ama de casa, se dedica al cuido del hogar y de su hija de 10 años de edad. Ernesto se dedica a la distribución de pan desde hace 6 años, actividad que inició con capital propio. Se encarga de distribuir pan en varias pulperías de algunos barrios de Managua, y su plan es poder ampliar la red de distribución que actualmente tiene. El medio utilizado en esta actividad es la bicicleta, el uso del préstamo será para reforzar la línea de distribución, invertirá en la compra de más inventario para así poder agrandar más el servicio. Espera poder mantener la estabilidad económica que hasta ahora ha tenido, para así darle a su familia todo lo que necesite
texts.en:
Ernesto Javier B. is 42 years old and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. His wife is a housewife who takes care of their home and their 10 year old daughter. Ernesto has been distributing bread for 6 years, an activity he began with his own savings. He is in charge of distributing bread to convenience stores in various neighborhoods in Managua. His plan is to be able to expand his distribution network that he has. He distributes bread by bicycle, and he will use the loan to increase his distribution line, investing in purchasing more inventory in order to be able to expand his service. He hopes to be able to maintain his economic stability that until now he has had, thereby being able to give his family everthing that his family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase distribution line of bread

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Sophia H. from Mwanza. Married with three children between the ages of four and eleven, Sophia has been running an ice cream business since 2006. Assisted by one employee, she works at the business for eight hours per day, five days per week, currently earning about $300 per month.

She is requesting a loan of $675 in order to buy a deep freezer, and in the future plans to increase her ice cream stock. Sophia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer for her business.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Né le 11 avril 1978, Monsieur M. Komi est marié et père de 2 enfants. Tapissier de formation, il arrive difficilement à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il sollicite un financement pour acheter des matériels de travail afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born on April 11, 1978, Mr. Komi M. is married and the father of two. An upholsterer by training, he is managing with difficulty to provide for his family. He is applying for financing to buy work materials in order to satisfy his customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials to make furniture

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John A. is 32 years old and is married with four children. Three of the children are in school. John lives in Rongo, Kenya.

John supports his family by making shoes. He has been making shoes for 19 years, starting when he was only 13 years old. John is applying for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Schillings in order to purchase more materials needed for making shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim is an active client of IMON International. He has a little shop with a refrigerated case for meat and dairy products. He became a client of IMON International in 2006 and used his first loan to purchase his first batch of meat products like sausages, boiled sausage, frankfurter, etc. The business was successful, and Abdurahim decided to conclude an agreement with a distribution firm for a longterm partnership. 

Today his shop is one of the known shops in the food market. He is a very cheerful person, and he is always glad to meet anyone who comes into his shop. All his clients are satisfied with his service. Abdurahim tries to make his assortment of food products more competitive. In the near future he dreams of expanding his business and buying another refrigerated case. Right now, however, he is requesting $ 1000 USD to purchase sausages, boiled sausage, frankfurter, butter and cheese. This loan will be an important part of the growth of Abdurahim’s business.

loans.use: To purchase sausages, boiled sausage, frankfurter, butter and cheese.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella A. is 43 years old and married with 5 children. She sells chickens in the market, and she plans to increase her sales. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more chickens for sale.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to sell

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en: Mrs. Srey Mao N. is 29 years old and lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Em Nop, is an ice-cream seller. Even though they try to work hard, they do not earn enough to support their family. In order to increase their income and improve their standard of living, Mrs. Srey Mao N. needs a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She has two children, one of whom is attending the local school. The other is too young for school or to help with the work. Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding to increase income.

loans.name: Ndiolle

texts.fr: Madame Ndiolle D. est une restauratrice à Bambey, une petite ville à 130 km de Dakar.  Elle prépare les repas sénégalais traditionnels et elle les servit au gens du marché.  Elle vend aussi des produits cosmétiques, par exemple, les effets de toilettes et Thiouraye, un produit que les femmes utilisent pour que leurs chambres sentent bonnes.  Elle est mère d’une fille, et son mari est un menuisier qui travaille à coté d’elle, dehors le restaurant.  Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses activités de commerce.  Elle va acheter plus de produits cosmétiques pour mieux servir ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndiolle D. is a restaurant owner in Bambey, a small city 130 km from Dakar. She makes traditional Senegalese meals and serves them to people at the marketplace. She also sells cosmetics, for example, toiletries and Thiouraye, a product that women use for making their bedrooms smell nice. Ndiolle is a mother with one daughter, and her husband is a furniture-maker who works adjacent to her outside the restaurant. She's requesting this loan to bolster her commerce. She's going to buy more cosmetics, so as to serve her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products that she sells in the restaurant

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo a travéz de la Sra. Albina L., a quien le llamo la atención el programa y se decidio a propagar en el vecindario de Jose Maria Alfonzo Godoy. Las mujeres del comite son muy humildes y trabajadoras. Aprendieron a valorar el trabajo en grupo y realizan diferentes actividades comunitarias para solidarizarse. Ellas son independientes en sus labores como venta de ropas, venta de comidas, venta de helados, realiza primeros auxilios, etc. y reciben de crédito en un promedio de Gs.386.000 cada una, quienes invierten en la compra de sus productos.

1	Ramona Carrillo	        Venta de comida
2	Lidia G.	        Venta de comida
3	María Velásquez	        Venta de comida
4	Ana F.	        Venta de comida
5	Albina López	        Venta de comida
6       Pablina R.            Venta de cubierto
7	Ada López	        Modista
8	Silveria L.	Comedor
9	Florentina V.	        Venta de Frutas
10	Fátima D.	        Bordados Aho poì
11	Justina D.	        Copetin
12	Irene Ruíz	        Venta de comida
13	Liz V.	        Despensa
14	Fatima P.	        Venta de Ropa
15	Mirian C.	Venta de Ropa 
16	Stefania P.	Primeros Auxilios
17	Cinthia C.	        Heladeria
18	Clara A.        Heladeria
19	Ilda N.	        Venta de comida 

Tambien hay un integrante que esta en la foto, Carmen Roa, que no saco un credito en este ciclo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Mrs. Albina L., who brought attention to the program and decided to expand in the Jose Maria Alfonzo Godoy neighborhood. The women in the committee are very modest and are hard workers. They learned to value working as a group and they perform different community activities to support each other. They are independent in their work activities such as clothing sales, food sales, ice cream sales, first aid, etc. Each person receives an average loan of 386,000 guarani to invest in the purchase of their products. 1 Ramona Carrillo, Food Sales 2 Lidia G., Food Sales 3 María Velásquez, Food Sales 4 Ana F., Food Sales 5 Albina López, Food Sales 6 Pablina R., Silverware Sales 7 Ada López, Dressmaker 8 Silveria L., Cafeteria 9 Florentina V., Fruit Sales 10 Fátima D., Aho poi (Embroidered fine linen clothing) 11 Justina D., Appetizers 12 Irene Ruíz, Food Sales 13 Liz V., Pantry 14 Fatima P., Clothing Sales 15 Mirian C., Clothing Sales 16 Stefania P., First Aid 17 Cinthia C., Ice Cream Parlor 18 Clara A., Ice Cream Parlor 19 Ilda N., Food Sales There is also a member in the photo, Carmen Roa, who is not taking out a loan this cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of sugar, meats, jeans, T-shirts, thread, aho poi, cloth, silverware, lingerie, carbonated beverages, cotton, gauze, alcohol, penicillin

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del Bancomunal Sarita Colonia.
Virginia es viuda tiene 47 años, tres hijos  de 25 23, y 13 años que esta  estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Virginia empezó con un negocio de verduras en el mercado, pero sufrió un accidente, el carro donde viajaba se volcó quedando ella impedida de caminar, entro a rehabilitación por dos años y pudo recuperarse, ahora camina y  ha puesto una bodega en su casa.   
Virginia necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosas surtidas, verduras, frutas y útiles escolares. 
Desde que esta en Finca, los préstamos le han ayudado para crecer en su negocio, le gusta la solidaridad entre las socias.
El sueño de Virginia es tener un pequeño minimarket.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of Bancomunal Sarita Colonia. Virginia is a 47 year old widow, with three kids that are 25, 23, and 13 years old. They are studying at the state school. She started with a vegetable business in the market, but was in an accident, the car she was in overturned and she could not walk. She entered into rehabilitation for two years to recover, and is now walking and has put a market in her home. Virginia needs a 3000 soles loan, to purchase beer, a selection of soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, and school supplies. Since she has been in Finca, the loans have helped her business grow, she likes the solidarity between members. It is Virginia's dream to have a small minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Virginia needs a 3000 soles loan in order to buy beer, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits and school supplies.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta D. A. is a rice grower. She has been into this kind of business since she was single. She is 54 years old and has eight children. Her husband is the one managing the farm. Her children help them sustain their business. AsiD. from rice, they also raise chickens and pigs to supplement their income.

Now she is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and insecticides. The loan will really help Loreta increase her income.

CEVI is a nonprofit organization and a partner of World Vision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but also offers training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia tiene 40 años, madre de 4 hijos, mujer muy trabajadora que vive en su casa propia junto  a dos de sus hijas; Yulisa de 15 años y Jerson de 11 que son el motivo de su sacrificio y trabajo. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a venta de ropa, tales como; chompas y buzos de lana, los jueves y domingos en las ferias de la ciudad de Tarma, su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Huancayo donde la encuentra a un precio muy cómodo, que le permite acumular mayores ganancias. Por otra parte, el resto de los días, trabaja en su chacra, ya que le agrada mucho esta labor, y para lograr buenas cosechas, cada temporada abona sus cultivos, para eso alquila un burro donde  transporta los sacos de fertilizantes hasta su chacra, y después de abonar sus sembríos se concentra en alimentar bien al burro hasta que quede satisfecho, y de ese modo se lo vuelvan a alquilar posteriormente. Durante estos años de trabajo como agricultora y comerciante Dionisia aprendió a cuidar a sus plantas y a sus clientes, puesto que sabe que gracias a ellos tendrá el dinero necesario para mantener a sus hijos y brindarles educación, y de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos ha sido muy puntual y espera seguir del mismo modo en este ciclo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy graciosa y todos los integrantes le tienen mucho cariño. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de insecticidas para sus cultivos, y con otro tanto incrementará la cantidad de mercadería en prendas de ropa gruesa para el invierno.
texts.en:
Dionisia is 40 years old, the mother of four children, and a very hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with two of her daughters--Yulisa, 15, and Jerson, 11, who motivate her sacrifice and work. For the past five years, she has worked selling clothing like wool sweaters on Thursdays and Sundays in the fairs of Tarma city. She buys her merchandise in the city of Huancayo, where she can buy at a convenient price, which permits her to earn better profits. On the other days of the week, she works in her field. She enjoys this work a great deal. In order to reap a good harvest, she fertilizes her crops every season, and she uses a donkey to transport the fertilizers to her field. After fertilizing her seeds, she feeds the donkey until it is satisfied and thus prepares it to work again. During these years of working as a farmer and saleswoman, Dionisia has learned to take care of her plants as well as her customers. She knows that thanks to them, she will have enough money to take care of her children and give them an education, and thus improve their quality of life. This is her third loan with MFP. In her previous loans, she was very punctual and she hopes to continue this in the current loan cycle. She is very gracious in her communal bank and all the members care for her deeply. With this loan, she will purchase insecticides for her crops, and she will use the rest of the funds to increase the quantity of thick winter clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticides and increase merchandise for sale

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S. is a 31-year-old married woman, a mother blessed with two children who are teenagers and in school. She owns a wheelbarrow which she uses to sell frying noodles door-to-door around the village. Her husband, Kom Sim, age 34, works selling clothes by mobile transportation. Because the business of selling clothing is a very profitable one for a whole family, Sem S. would like a loan of $1200 to order additional clothing for her husband to sell. This will provide them with income to attain a comfortable standard of living.

loans.use: To order additional clothing for her husband to sell

loans.name: Melik

texts.ru: Мелик Шарифова проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Мелик по специальности "врач". В данный момент он более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает семечки и кукурузу, а потом продает их на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, для покупки семян и удобрений.
texts.en:
Melik S. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 35 years old, married and has four children. Melik is a doctor by profession. At this time he is in agriculture and has been for more than ten years. He mainly grows seeds and corn and then sells it on the market. The client is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ipogolo D Group

texts.en:
Fabiola is a member of the Ipogolo D borrower group in Ruaha, Kilimanjaro. She is a 43-year-old married mother of 2. Her children are ages 18 and 20, respectively.   

Fabiola has owned a salon for 5 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 190,000 Tanzanian shillings (or about $140 US).

This is Fabiola’s 1st loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 shillings (or about $155) in order to buy more supplies. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Fabiola hopes to expand her business. 
Maria, another member of the Ipogolo D borrower group, has requested 250,000 shillings (or about $195) in order to support her business of selling snacks and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for her salon.

loans.name: Турсун

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Содиров  Турсун- мужчина 48ми лет, Женат, имеет 3 сына и дочку. Его дело это закупать и откармливать овец на дому. Турсун  покупает овец на скотном рынке на базарный день и присматривает за ними 4-6 месяцев. Затем он продает их на базаре за хорошую цену и снова покупает скот для откорма. На выручку он содержит семью. Его жена Содиева Суюда тоже присматривает за скотом помогая мужу. На полученный кредит Турсун купил жене телёнка, который уже стал большим быком. Они собираются его продать и получить прибыль .Эта семья благодарна нашей организации. И в дальнейшем планируют  снами работать.

loans.use: покупка скота

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-three year old local producer of polythene (rubber) bags. He is married with a child who is currently in school. Joseph is a young man with a vision to serve humanity with his talent and skills. He dreams of a well established company of his own which produces bulk polythene bags to serve all kinds of purposes. He produces and supplies to food vendors, market sellers and super markets operators to wrap bought items for their customers. Joseph is constrained by capital to produce on large scale to meet the demands of his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy large quantities of rubbers and another machine to facilitate his production to meet demand.

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.es:
La señora Nicolasa es socia del Banco Comunal “Lucero del Amanecer”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 60 años de edad, estado civil soltera y es madre de 5 hijos, estudio educación primaria incompleta (2do de primaria), vive en el Barrio Alto Rinconada Av. Tupac Amaru s/n.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace varios años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de compra venta de golosinas. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, caramelos, yogures, galletas, gaseosas, etc. Para venderlo en su puesto.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gusta la facilidad en los prestamos así puede con facilidad aumentar en su capital para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Nicolasa is a member of the Morning Star Community Bank which is in the Juliaca district, the San Román Province, in the Puno Department. She is 60 years old and a single mother of 5 children. She studied through the 2nd grade of primary school and lives in the Alto Rinconada neighborhood on the street of Tupac Amaru. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for many years, and her first loan was for the amount of 300 New Soles, for investment in candles for her business. Currently she is seeking a loan of $525, for the purchase of chocolate, caramel, yogurt, crackers, soda, and other items to sell in her stand. Her wish is to continue to work. She likes the ease of the loans so that she can easily increase her capital to be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of chocolate, caramel, yogurt, crackers, soda, and other items

loans.name: Maria Irene

texts.es:
la sra. MARIA IRENE V. se dedica al comercio cuenta con una pequeña tienda de variedades 
actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 9 años, es casada y madre de 3 hijos los dos mayores estudian en centros educativos publicos de la ciudad,  con los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permiten suplir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros, Maria tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion lo que le permite atender su negocio sin descuidar a sus hijos , tambien los fines de semana sale a vender de manera ambulante a las colonias y aldeas vecinas a su domicilio uno de los rubros que junto a su esposo han implementado en su negocio es la apicultura que es el manejo y cultivo de abejas productoras de miel lo que les a generado buena aceptacion ya que la zona es apta por ser de clima fresco y una amplia floracion de plantas.
esta solicitando un credito para capital de trabajo y mejorar las inversiones.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Irene V. has managed a small variety store for the past 9 years. She is married and the mother of three children. Her two oldest children are students who attend public schools in the city. Her income enables her to cover her family expenses and meet her financial commitments. Maria operates her business out of her home so that she can continue to look after her children. On the weekends, she travels to different neighborhoods and villages near her home to sell her products.

In addition, she and her husband have established a beekeeping business in which they produce and sell honey, a product that is well-received in their area. The region is well suited for beekeeping because of the cool climate and the abundance of flowering plants.

Sra. Maria is requesting a loan to use as working capital for improving her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase household cleaning products, disinfectants, soaps, honey, deodorants, lotions, perfumes, creams, oils, and skin treatments

loans.name: Adelaide Luis

texts.pt:
Adelaide C. é natural de Maputo, tem 37 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 13 e 6 anos de idade. Fez 7ª classe, parou com os seus estudos devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria com os filhos e sem ninguém mais por sustentar. 

Nunca mudou de residência, vive de comércio já a 10 anos e é dona do próprio negocio. Vende mais refrigerantes e outros produtos de mercearia. Para os refrigerantes o valor de compra é de 240.00mt e 340.00mt venda e mercearia 1.100.00mt na compra e vende a 1.500.00mt. obtém aprox. 1.500.00mt diários provenientes das vendas.

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com o qual pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria comprando mais refrigerantes e produtos de mercearia. Ela conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinha que também já é cliente a longa data nunca havia levantado créditos em outras instituições.

Tem como objectivo ampliar o seu negócio através de pedido de mais empréstimos para a aquisição de um congelador como forma de satisfazer as necessidades dos clientes.
texts.en:
Adelaide C. was born in Maputo, she is 37 years old, single and mother of two children who are 13 and 6 years old. She studied until the 7th grade, she had to stop when she got pregnant. She lives at her own home and doesn't support relatives, just her family. She never moved from her home, and has been working in commerce for the past 10 years and owns her own business. She sells soft dirnks and groceries. She buys soft drinks at 240MT and sells them at 340MT, and she buys the groceries at 1,100MT and sells them at 1,500MT she gets a profit of approximately 1,500MT from her sales. This is her first loan at Hluvuku for 10,000MT, which she expects to use to increase the volume of her merchandise buying more drinks and groceries. She learned about Hluvuku from a neighbor who is a long time client. She has never requested credit at another institutions. She expect to increase her business requesting more loans to get a freezer in order to satisfy her client's needs.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell soft drinks and groceries

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol L. is from the village of Tagulalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is 29 years old. Mirasol is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing and selling bamboo products to local businesses and community members. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Mirasol joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Mirasol from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offering

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Mrs. Glory V., 46 years old, owns a variety store located at Victoria, Aurora Isabela. She is married to Floriano who is already 49 years old but still strong and very determined to harvest more yield on their small farm lot. The couple is blessed with three children: Gemma, Michelle and Floriano Jr. Only the youngest is still studying; the other two are already working.
Glory’s business is very important to her, especially when her two children were still studying. She is thankful because even though her only source of income was selling of goods, she was able to support the education of her children, especially their daily allowances. She just hopes that her youngest child will also graduate with a college degree. With her desire to earn a higher income, she decided to borrow a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP6,000 as her additional business capital. She shared that the more commodities she sells means a lot of income, thus she is really hoping that lenders will approve her request.

loans.use: Additional capital for her variety store business

loans.name: Antonina

texts.es:
La señora Antonina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Corazón de Jesús”, Distrito de San Jose de Sisa, Provincia del Dorado, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 49 años y 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su trayectoria paso por muchas dificultades, pero su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante sola, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de refrescos.
En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y le va muy bien, tiene 05 años ya, ejerciendo este tipo de actividad, tiene sus clientes fijos y ya es conocida por sus clientes y por la buena sazón de sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus refrescos como: linaza, cebada, boldo, cola de caballo y soya, todos esto lo comprará quincenalmente en kilos

Antonina, se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con sus ventas de refrescos y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonina is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank, which is located in the District of San Jose de Sisa, El Dorado Province, Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old and has 3 dependent children.

Antonina started her own business so that she could support her children in hopes of seeing them become professionals who can earn their own income. She has experienced many difficulties, but she is known for her fighting spirit and has the desire to succeed for herself. Therefore, she started this business selling soft drinks. Antonina has been managing her business for 5 years and is prospering. She has regular customers who know her well and enjoy the great flavor of her products.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will purchase supplies for preparing drinks such as flaxseed, barley, herbal tea, horsetail plant, and soybeans. Antonia acquires these ingredients by the kilo every two weeks. She is determined to continue her soft drink business and thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing beverages

loans.name: Florence  Bonareri

texts.en:
Florence Bonareri M. sells baby clothes to repeat and walk-in customers on Ngong Road in Nairobi. She has been in this business for one year and her main challenge is strong competition which leads to low demand from customers. She is using her loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more sweaters. Her goal in life is to own a maize mill shop.

Florence is married with three children ranging in age from 3 to 15. She is hardworking and patient.

loans.use: To restock baby sweaters

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is forty-seven years of age. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a tourist-attraction community in the central region of Ghana. The community is one of the coastal towns in Ghana and as a result, the major occupation of the people is farming.

Adwoa is a trader. She trades in vegetable cooking oil and other food items. She procures her goods from nearby towns and sells in a store in her community. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to increase her stock.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente  tiene a su cargo dos hijos, estos se encuentran en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en ese lapso ha invertido  dos  créditos en  mejorar  las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del techo de su vivienda en que habita por lo que antes se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba y el pago de la mano de obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 
Silvio dijo que con los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una mejor casa.
texts.en:
This client is raising two schoolage children and is married. He has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for two years. During that time he has invested two loans from CEPRODEL in improving his housing conditions. The loan he is requesting is to invest in the purchase of materials for remodeling the roof of the home where he lives and paying the labor costs. It was in very bad condition and in winter the water would leak through. This is to give his children a better quality of life. Silvio says that with the financing given to him by CEPRODEL he has been helped a lot and now has a better house.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: IMPROVEMENT OF HOUSING AND ENLARGMENT

loans.name: Hoai's Group

texts.en:
Hoai T. Đặng  is 35 years old. She lives in Xom Vang, Co Loa, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has two children who are going to school. She is a tailor. She works at home. She has a sewing machine. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamese dong. 

She joined SEDA, a Kiva partner, four years ago and makes repayments on time. This time, she wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to buy a sewing machine. She hopes her life will be better. 

About the other borrower in her group: 

Hòa Thị Hoàng is 34 years old. She is a hairdresser. She has a monthly income of about 2.500.000 VND. She wants to borrow 6.322.000 VND to invest in her hairdressing business.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Yahya

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yahya K. est un jeune célibataire âgé de 28 ans et qui  après l’école coranique suivît un métier de tapissier sous l’influence de son père. Il gère maintenant  sa propre entreprise de tapisserie  au quartier cité Senghor de Thiès. Il fabrique ainsi des meubles sur commandes ou même pour l’exposer à la vente. 
Ce jeune tapissier avec une expérience de 11 ans dans le métier, souhaitait s’approvisionner en matières premières pour  finir  une confection de meubles. C’est ainsi qu’il demande auprès de la caisse Jammi Xaleyi de U-IMCEC Thiès un crédit de 500 000 FCFA. 
Avec ce montant il pourra acheter des tissus, éponges et bois nécessaires et constituer avec  le reste  un fond de roulement pour assurer  le bon fonctionnement de ses activités. Il est dans son entreprise avec ses 3 apprentis qu’il forme également pour le métier de tapissier.
texts.en:
Mr. Yahya K. is a 28-year-old bachelor who, through his father’s influence, learned the upholstery trade after leaving the Coranic school. He now manages his own upholstery business in the Cité Senghor area of Thiès. He also makes furniture to order or even displays it for sale. This young upholsterer has accumulated 12 years’ experience in the business, and now needs raw materials to complete a furniture order. This is why he has requested a loan of 500,000 FCFA from the Jammi Xaleyi credit loan branch of U-IMCEC in Thiès. With this loan, he will buy the necessary fabric, sponges and wood and use the remainder as working capital to ensure the smooth functioning of his activities. He runs his business with three apprentices who are also being trained as upholsterers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials and establsih a working capital

loans.name: The Women’S Bank Of The Sixth Of May (Banco Mujer Seis De Mayo) 2 Group

texts.en:
The Sixth of May Women’s Bank (Banco Mujer Seis De Mayo) 2 is a group of women from San Martin, Limón; a rural region located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The women of this group are engaged in productive activities including bread-making and the rearing and selling of livestock (poultry products). This loan will be used by the group members to further the development of their individual productive activities. Specifically, the money will be used to finance the purchase of ingredients and raw materials necessary to bread-making such as flour. Additionally, this loan will be used to purchase livestock (chickens) and animal feed. 

San Martin is a rural region with few employment opportunities. As a result, the women of this group have taken it upon themselves to create work.  The members of this group have a desire to succeed in their businesses and to provide a better standard of living for themselves and their families. The women who produce bread have the goal of one day owning a bakery. The women involved in animal rearing hope to use this loan to increase their poultry sales.
For the women engaged in bread-making, a difficulty has been high costs for raw materials. Likewise, individuals involved in the rearing and sale of chickens have encountered obstacles such as high prices for animal feed and low market prices for poultry products.

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock, animal feed, and bread-making materials

loans.name: Fernando Obdulio

texts.es:
Don Fernando Obdulio M. M., vive en una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada en el municipio de yali donde él se dedica a la actividad de trabajos agrícolas  específicamente al cultivo de café y a la ganadería. El crédito lo utilizara para darle asistencia técnica a su finca de café, en este periodo el necesita darle mantenimiento como es regulación de sombra, limpia y asistencia con insumos el va a comprar 12 quintales de abono y 12 quintales de urea y pago de mano de obra para la aplicación de los insumos.
Este cliente vive en una zona altamente productiva y por la característica de la zona que tiene una altura de 1000 msnm (mil metros sobre el nivel del mar) es apta para el cultivo de café que es la actividad principal de trabajo de este cliente, este productor comenzó su trabajo ayudándole a sus padres desde que el era pequeño y después le dieron como herencia 4 manzanas de café. Don Fernando con el crédito el espera darle la asistencia que necesita su finca o cultivo de café debido a que acaba de sacar la cosecha y en este periodo comienza a darle mantenimiento para garantizar la cosecha del próximo año ya que este tipo de cultivo da la cosecha una vez cada año, con esto el obtendrá mayores rendimientos y un producto de mejor calidad el cual le beneficiara a él a la hora de la cosecha, tomado en cuenta que este es un rubro de bastante importancia y uno de los principales  rubros de exportación en nuestro país.
Don Fernando Obdulio es casado y tiene 2 hijos la esposa le ayuda a los quehaceres de la casa y cuido de sus hijos él tiene una niña y un varoncito, el varón está estudiando la primaria y la niña no tiene edad todavía para la escuela.
Don Fernando tiene 3 años de trabajar con Ceprodel y se le han otorgado 4 créditos para estas actividades de trabajo.
El impacto que obtiene este cliente es bastante importante ya que con este apoyo el podrá garantizar y asistir a sus cultivos obteniendo mayores rendimientos y un producto con mejor calidad, esto le beneficiara y mejora sus ingresos permitiéndole ofrecer un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando Obdulio M. M. lives in a community located in the town of Yali. He does agricultural work, specifically in growing coffee and in cattle. He will use the loan to give technical assistance to his coffee farm. At this time he needs to give it maintenance such as shade regulating, cleaning and help with materials. He is going to buy 1,200 pounds of fertilizer and 1,200 pounds of urea and also pay the labor costs for the application of the materials. This client lives in a highly productive area. Due to the fact that the area has an altitude of 1000 meters above sea level, it is apt for growing coffee which is the main work activity of this client. This producer started his work helping his parents when he was small. Afterwards, they gave him 6.8 acres of coffee as inheritance. With this loan, Fernando hopes to give his farm and coffee crop the help that it needs. At this time, he just finished the harvest and he is starting to do maintenence to guarantee next year's crop, since this type of crop is harvested once a year. With this he will be able to have higher yields and a higher quality product. This will benefit him when the time comes to harvest, taking into account that this is a very important area and one of the main areas of export in our country. Fernando Obdulio is married and has two children. His wife helps him with the household tasks and in taking care of the children. He has a girl and a little boy. The boy is in elementary school and the girl isn't old enough for school yet. Fernando has been working with Ceprodel for 3 years and he has been given 4 loans for these work activities. The impact on this client has been very important since with this support he can guarantee and help his crops have higher yields and a higher quality product. This will beneifit him and improve his income allowing him to offer a better quality of life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Technical assistance for his farm- to purchase 1,200 pounds of fertilizer and 1,200 pounds of urea

loans.name: Melisa

texts.en:
Melisa G. is from the village of Barandiaz, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 23 years-old and married with a baby. Melisa owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products such as fish and dried fish in the local community. She also owns a small sari-sari (general) store . Melisa has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melisa joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Melisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Melisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Cindylou Burlas Group

texts.en:
Cindylou B. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Cindylou is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Cindylou is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cindylou owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different food products in the local community. Cindylou has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Cindylou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cindylou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Cindylou is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Cindylou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell
